MetaTitle: Datuk Dr. Abd Aziz Yahya | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 507, 5th Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Datuk Dr Abd Aziz Yahya graduated with the MBBS from the University of Malaya in 1982 and became a Specialist Obstetrician and Gynaecologist in 1988 after obtaining his qualification from the Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists in London. He spent another two and half years at the St. Mary’s Hospital in London where he undertook further training in Gynaecological Oncology.

He returned to Malaysia in 1990 and worked in the Academic Department of the National University Hospital and was soon appointed an Associate Professor and Head of the Gynaecological Oncology Department.

He was awarded “The Most Esteemed Order of Distinguished Service” in 2007 which carries the title Datuk by His Royal Highness, The King of Malaysia.

He is a certified Robotics Surgeon, having gone through the required training and proctorship in Singapore and South Korea.  He did his first Robotics Assisted Hysterectomy in April 2009.  He now performs regularly Robotics assisted gynaecological surgery for both benign and malignant conditions.

In June 2017, he was awarded the Honorary Fellowship of The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists. He is currently the President of the Asian Society of Gynecological Robotic Surgeons (ASGRS).

He was the Past President of the Obstetrical and Gynaecological Society of Malaysia and was a Board Member of the International Federation Of Obstetrics and Gynaecology.
ConditionsTreated: Gynaecological Oncology disorders, Endometriosis, PCOS, Ovarian cysts, Uterine fibroids, Uterine prolapse, Urinary Incontinence, Pre-Cancerous  Lesions of the Cervix and Vagina.
OpenGraphTitle: Datuk Dr. Abd Aziz Yahya | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
QualificationAndCertifications: MBBS (Mal), FRCOG (UK), FAMM (Mal), FACOG (Honorary, USA), Certified Robotics Surgeon
ProceduresPerformed:
Conventional Gynaecological Oncology Surgery, Robotics Gynaecology Surgery for cancer and non-cancer diseases.

Manage all conditions in Obstetrics and Gynaecology, Colposcopy, Hysteroscopy.
Title: Abd Aziz Yahya

MetaDescription: Dr Abd Razak Muhamad is a full resident consultant at Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur as a Consultant Orthopaedic Surgeon. He sub specialises in the care of children with orthopaedics condition.
MetaTitle: Dr. Abd Razak Muhamad | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
OpenGraphDescription: Dr Abd Razak Muhamad is a full resident consultant at Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur as a Consultant Orthopaedic Surgeon. He sub specialises in the care of children with orthopaedics condition.
FacilityLocation: Specialist Clinics, 6th Floor, Block B (New Block)
Recommendation:
Dr Abd Razak Muhamad is a full resident consultant at Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur as a Consultant Orthopaedic Surgeon. He sub specialises in the care of children with orthopaedics condition.

His main expertise and interest are in children with congenital and developmental condition as well as trauma related. He has a long and wide range of experience from the busiest paediatric service in the country i.e. Institute of Paediatrics, Hospital Kuala Lumpur during his services with the Ministry of Health.

Dr Abd Razak graduated with medical degree from University of Malaya in 1995 and subsequently completed his Masters in Surgery (Orthopaedics) in 2003 from Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM).

He  then joined the medical subspecialty program under  Ministry of Health in Paediatric Orthopaedics  from 2006 -2010 before underwent  another year of International Fellowship training from University California of San Diego at Rady’s Children Hospital, San Diego, California, USA from 2010 – 2011.
ConditionsTreated:
Adults:

Fractures and dislocation

Lower limb deformities

Bone and soft tissue tumour

Common hand condition i.e. carpal tunnel syndrome

Children: 

Fractures and dislocation

Paediatric hip condition i.e. DDH, Slipped Upper Femoral Epiphysis, Perthe’s disease

Clubfoot (CTEV) and other foot deformities

Lower limb deformities and limb length discrepancy

Neuromuscular condition i.e. Cerebral Palsy
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Abd Razak Muhamad | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
QualificationAndCertifications: MBBS (Malaya), M.S Ortho (UKM), Fellowship in Paediatric Orthopaedics (USA)
ProceduresPerformed:
Fractures and/ or dislocation fixation

Soft tissue and bony procedures for deformity correction includes lengthening

Soft tissue and bone tumour excision

Common orthopaedics procedure i.e. carpal tunnel release, joint aspiration and injection
Title: Abd Razak Muhamad

MetaDescription: Dr Abdul Aziz bin Marwan went to Queen’s University of Belfast, United Kingdom for his undergraduate training (MBBCh BAO) and continued his core medical training in United Kingdom for 2 years before..
MetaTitle: Dr. Abdul Aziz Marwan | Respiratory Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
OpenGraphDescription: Dr Abdul Aziz bin Marwan went to Queen’s University of Belfast, United Kingdom for his undergraduate training (MBBCh BAO) and continued his core medical training in United Kingdom for 2 years before..
Recommendation:
Dr Abdul Aziz bin Marwan went to Queen’s University of Belfast, United Kingdom for his undergraduate training (MBBCh BAO) and continued his core medical training in United Kingdom for 2 years before deciding to specialise in Internal Medicine at Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, completing Master of Medicine (MMed). After an intensive work period of 3 years at a busy setting in Hospital Ampang, he furthered his interest in pulmonology training at various tertiary pulmonology centres around Klang Valley.

Dr Aziz received intensive training in early detection of lung cancer and treatment, sleep medicine, intensive care medicine and infective respiratory diseases; was involved heavily with interventional pulmonology team at a referral centre, and had experienced heading the Pulmonary Hypertension clinic (Respiratory Division) in the past.

He is well verse with Internal Medicine diseases and management, but his real talent shines in Respiratory Diseases. Apart from the usual cough clinic, breathing difficulties, pleural disease and difficult to manage respiratory symptoms, he had developed his niche expertise in Interventional Pulmonology, dealing with central airway emergencies like tumour obstruction, foreign body aspiration, benign tracheal stenosis, and endo-bronchial procedures such as electromagnetic navigational bronchoscopy, endobronchial ultrasound, and trans-bronchial cryo-lung biopsy.

Patient encounter with Dr Aziz often led to satisfying consultation due to his jovial and laid-back nature. He is very approachable, easy to work with and very resourceful in difficult-to-diagnose/-manage cases. Despite his casual approach, he is very sharp in making sure patients received the most optimum approach at arriving to a diagnosis and disease management.

After years of clinical experiences, Dr Aziz joined Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur as a resident Pulmonologist and Internal Medicine specialist consultant.
ConditionsTreated:
1. General respiratory disorders
  2. Pulmonary hypertension
  3. Interventional Pulmonology
  4. Pleural Diseases
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Abdul Aziz Marwan | Respiratory Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
QualificationAndCertifications:

  • Master of Medicine (Internal Medicine) (UKM)
  • Fellowship of Respiratory Medicine (MOH)
  • National Specialist Registered for Respiratory Medicine

  • Pleural procedure and ultrasound
  • Broncshocopy
  • Endobronchial ultrasounds
  • Boom operation

MetaDescription: Datuk Dr. Hj. Abdul Rahman Ismail underwent medical degree course at medical school in University of Malaya from 1981 to 1986. He graduated with M.B.B.S. (Malaya) in 1986, and started working with...
MetaTitle: Datuk Dr. Abdul Rahman bin Ismail | Cardiothoracic Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
OpenGraphDescription: Datuk Dr. Hj. Abdul Rahman Ismail underwent medical degree course at medical school in University of Malaya from 1981 to 1986. He graduated with M.B.B.S. (Malaya) in 1986, and started working with...
Recommendation:
Datuk Dr. Hj. Abdul Rahman Ismail underwent medical degree course at medical school in University of Malaya from 1981 to 1986. He graduated with M.B.B.S. (Malaya) in 1986, and started working with Ministry of Health since January 1987. His first posting was in Sarawak General Hospital (housemanship).

In mid-1988, he was transferred to Kemaman District Hospital, Terengganu as a medical officer. Underwent post-graduate studies (master programme in General Surgery) at the Department of Surgery in National University of Malaysia from 1990 to 1994. After completed the programme, and obtained Master in General Surgery (UKM) in 1994, he worked as a general surgeon at Kuala Lumpur Hospital in 1995. He then decided to choose Cardiothoracic Surgery as his subspecialty; and joined the Ministry of Health fellowship training programme in Cardiothoracic Surgery.

During four years period (End of 1995 to 1999), he underwent training at Penang Hospital; at National Heart Institute (IJN) in Kuala Lumpur; and at Monash Medical Centre in Australia. After completed training, he was gazzetted as a Cardiothoracic Surgeon in 2000. Underwent Fellowship oversea team training in VATS Lobectomy at Seoul National University Bundang Hospital (for a month) in September 2013.
ConditionsTreated:
• Coronary artery disease or blockages of the arteries in the heart
• Blockages in the heart valve(s)
• Leaking heart valve(s)
• Abnormal enlargement or aneurysms of the large arteries in the chest
• Heart failure
• Atrial fibrillation etc

MetaTitle: Dato' Dr. Adel Zaatar | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dato’ Dr Adel Zaatar has more than forty-five years of experience in the field of Radiotherapy and Medical Oncology, in the management of malignant tumours in general and breast, lung, prostate, brain, stomach, pancreas, colorectal cancer, cervical and ovarian cancer, head and neck cancers, sarcoma, childhood cancers and nasopharyngeal carcinoma, in particular.

He has been the Principal Investigator for many clinical trials for lung cancer, breast, pancreas, nasopharynx and colorectal cancers. Several of these studies have been published in international journals.

Dr Zaatar is a member of the Royal College of Radiologists UK, the European Society for Medical Oncology (ESMO), the Malaysian Oncological Society and the Academy of Medicine of Malaysia.

He has worked in the Department of Radiotherapy and Nuclear Medicine at Cairo Medical School in Egypt, Beatson Oncology Centre in Glasgow, United Kingdom, and at the Department of Radiotherapy and Oncology at Cork Medical School and Cork Regional Hospital in Ireland. He joined Mount Miriam Hospital Penang in 1985 as senior Consultant Radiotherapist and Oncologist until February 2011.

Dato’ Dr Zaatar joined Gleneagles Penang on 1st March 2011 as Consultant Radiotherapist and Oncologist.   

Dato’ Dr Zaatar has contributed greatly towards cancer management in Malaysia and in recognition of his service, has been awarded the Darjah Setia Pangkuan Negeri in 2000 which carries the title Dato’ and the Pingat Kelakuan Terpuji in 1991 from the Yang di-Pertua Negeri Pulau Pinang.
ConditionsTreated: Management of all solid tumours including breast, lung, head and neck cancers, brain, nasopharynx, stomach, pancreas, colorectal, prostate, cervical and ovarian cancer, sarcoma and childhood cancers.
OpenGraphTitle: Dato' Dr. Adel Zaatar | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
QualificationAndCertifications: DSPN, PKT, MB Bch(Cairo), DMRT(Cairo), DMRO(London), AM
ProceduresPerformed:

   Radiotherapy using:

   Conformal / IMRT / SRS / SBRT / VMAT

- Brachytherapy

MetaTitle: Dr. Ahmad Ashraf Zaini Anwar | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
OpenGraphDescription: Dr Ashraf completed his undergraduate medical training at The Royal College of Surgeons, Ireland in 2000. After 5 years of internal medicine training, he began his specialist training in Clinical...
Recommendation:
Dr Ashraf completed his undergraduate medical training at The Royal College of Surgeons, Ireland in 2000. After 5 years of internal medicine training, he began his specialist training in Clinical Cardiology in 2005.

In 2007, Dr Ashraf joined the Mater Misericordiae University Hospital Dublin as a Clinical and Interventional Cardiology Specialist. The Mater Hospital is the National Heart and Lung Centre for Ireland, and is the tertiary referral centre for advanced, complicated and end-stage cardiac disease.

In 2010, Dr Ashraf was appointed as the first ever Interventional Fellow in Cardiology at the Mater Hospital. He would spend the next 3 years training in advanced interventional cardiology. His specialty is in Primary Angioplasty (the definitive treatment for Acute Myocardial Infarction), and complex coronary anatomy, including chronic occlusion of coronary arteries. He performs the majority of his cases through the radial artery of the wrist, which allows patients to mobilize earlier, and reduces the risk of major bleeding complications. Dr Ashraf looks forward to providing cutting edge Cardiology treatment to the residents of Kota Kinabalu and Sabah in general.
ConditionsTreated: Acute ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction. Acute Non ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction. Stable / Unstable Angina. Heart Failure. Uncontrolled hypertension. Heart Block. Pericardial effusion.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Ahmad Ashraf Zaini Anwar | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
ProceduresPerformed: ECG, Stress Test, Echocardiogram, Stress Echocardiogram. Coronary Angiogram, Coronary Angioplasty, Coronary Fractional Flow Reserve Assessment, Coronary Rotational Atherectomy, Coronary Intravascular Ultrasound Imaging. Single chamber / Dual chamber Pacemaker, Cardiac Resynchronisation Pacemaker, Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator, Temporary Pacing Wire. Intraaortic Balloon Pump. Pericardiocentesis.
Title: Ahmad Ashraf Zaini Anwar

MetaDescription: Dr. Ahmad Radzi bin Ahmad Badruddin | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor Cancer Centre Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
MetaTitle: Dr. Ahmad Radzi bin Ahmad Badruddin | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
OpenGraphDescription: Dr. Ahmad Radzi bin Ahmad Badruddin | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor Cancer Centre Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
Dr. Ahmad Radzi graduated from Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM) in 1984. He did his Oncology training at the Hospital Kuala Lumpur before continuing with the fellowship programme in St. Bartholomew’s Hospital, London in September 1987. Whilst in London, Dr. Radzi trained under internationally acclaimed Medical Oncologists including Dr. Sid Arnott, Dr. N Plowman and Professor T Andrew Lister. After his training period in London, Dr. Radzi went on to complete his second fellowship programme in Western Infirmary Glasgow under the supervision of Professor Anne Barrett.

His earlier Specialist posting was under the Professorial unit in Hospital Kuala Lumpur at the Radiotherapy and Oncology Department. In 1997, he moved onto Hospital University Kebangsaan Malaysia, Cheras to setup the Oncology Unit. He has had vast experiences in spearheading and running private Oncology centres throughout Malaysia including Johor Specialist Hospital. He was also a panel for several Consensus Meeting organized by the Ministry of Health Malaysia and an Advisory Board Member of several pharmaceutical companies in the Asia Pacific region.
ConditionsTreated:
General oncology

MetaTitle: Dr. Aida Zairani Mohd Zahidin | Ophthalmology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
OpenGraphDescription: Dr. Aida graduated her medical degree from University of Leicester, UK in 2001, and completed her specialist Ophthalmology training from University Kebangsaan Malaysia in 2007. She subsequently...
Recommendation:
Dr. Aida graduated her medical degree from University of Leicester, UK in 2001, and completed her specialist Ophthalmology training from University Kebangsaan Malaysia in 2007. She subsequently completed a Cornea fellowship program from the  Sydney Eye Hospital in 2015 working with 7 Cornea Consultants with vast experiences. She is also a member of the Academy of Medicine, Malaysia, and registered with the National Specialist Registry.

She was a Senior Lecturer at UKM Medical Centre from 2007-2018, and the Head of Cornea Unit at the same centre from 2015-2018. She was actively involved in training of medical students and Master’s Ophthalmology trainees enrolled in the Masters program, as well as the Optometry graduates ; involved in research and has published various articles in peer-reviewed national and international journals.

She provides cornea and external eye disease, cataract and general ophthalmology services. She is trained in penetrating keratoplasty, DALK and DSAEK.
ConditionsTreated: General eye screening, diabetic eye disease, glaucoma, dry eyes, cataract, pterygium, cornea diseases, OSSN

MetaTitle: Dr. Alagammai A/P Ramanathan | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
OpenGraphDescription: Dr Alagammai graduated from Bangalore University in 1997. Subsequently, she worked in the emergency as well as the psychiatric department till 2001, after which she began her journey in OBGYN...
Recommendation:
Dr Alagammai graduated from Bangalore University in 1997. Subsequently, she worked in the emergency as well as the psychiatric department till 2001, after which she began her journey in OBGYN. She commenced her training as a medical officer in Queen Elizabeth Hospital and later in Sabah Women and Children Hospital (SWACH). She obtained her postgraduate degree from University Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM) in 2009 and returned to serve the people in the state of Sabah. She worked as a specialist in SWACH which has the highest delivery rate in Malaysia.

She underwent further training in Ultrasonography in Chennai, Basic IUI and Semenology (basic fertility treatments) from EART (accredited by Embrology and PGD Academy UK) and advanced laparoscopic training in Kerala. Dr Gammai is able to handle most obstetric and gynaecological conditions with special interest in subfertility and fetomaternal. She is also keen on performing key hole surgeries for gynaecological conditions.

She had been in charge of the Feto Maternal Unit at SWACH. She is also responsible for teaching 3rd and 5th year medical students from University Malaysia Sabah as well as nurses in midwifery training. She strives with determination to improve the status of women health and to bring a smile on their faces.
ConditionsTreated: Birth control, endometriosis, fibroids, gynaecological disorders, gynaecological cancer, infertility, ovarian cyst, placenta previa, antenatal care, urinary incontinence related to gynae issue.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Alagammai A/P Ramanathan | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
ProceduresPerformed: Caesarean section, dilatation & curettage, episiotomy, minimal access surgery (laparoscopy), hysteroscopy, pelvic ultrasound, PTO, sterilization, tubal ligation reversal, 3D/4D ultrasound, intra uterine insemination (IUI), pelvic floor repair (strengthening)
Title: Alagammai A/P Ramanathan

MetaTitle: Mr. Alan Oh | Psychology | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
OpenGraphDescription: Alan Oh is a counseling psychologist. He is registered with the Board of Counsellors (Malaysia) and a clinical member of the Malaysian Marriage and Family Therapy Association...
Recommendation:
Alan Oh is a counseling psychologist. He is registered with the Board of Counsellors (Malaysia) and a clinical member of the Malaysian Marriage and Family Therapy Association.

He provides consultation, counseling and therapy services to adults, elders, adolescents and children in the following formats - individual, group, family, couple or a combination of these formats based on patient and client needs.

He had facilitated clients and patients to recover from poor mental, behavioral and relationship health owing to depression, anxiety, bi-polar disorder, personality disorders, risky and aggressive behaviors, self-harm, process and substance addiction, relationship and psychological traumas, separation, grief and loss. He had also counseled individuals such as adolescents and young adults in dealing with the psychological and relationship trauma of bullying and abuse, and behaviors related to developmental issues.

His clients and patients also include those who are undergoing medical treatment and referred by their physicians for psychological interventions, counseling and therapy to enhance treatment compliance and recovery.
ConditionsTreated: Moods, anxiety, personality, trauma and stressors, psychosomatic, adjustment and thoughts based disorders. Relationship traumas, Workplace burnout, Bullying, Self-harming, Suicide ideation, Grief, Addiction.

Recommendation:
Dato' Dr Alex Mathews has worked as Consultant in Obstetrics & Gynecology in several Government Hospitals in Malaysia for many years and finally was Head of the Ministry of Health Obstetric and Gynecological Service based at Kuala Lumpur Hospital.

He has worked in Edinburgh, Scotland in the Gynecological Unit (Royal Infirmary Edinburgh) in sub-specialist training and has been much involved in the training of specialist postgraduates in Malaysia.

He has written and has presented over 50 scientific papers and lectures locally and internationally.

He currently holds management responsibilities in Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur and is Vice President of the College of Obstetric & Gynecology, Malaysia.

He has served in many capacities in local and international professional organisation.

She went on to complete her specialist training in the UK and became a member of the Royal College of Obstetrician and Gynaecologists in 2010. Dr. See was also certified as a colposcopist by the British Society of Cervical Pathology and Colposcopy. In addition to caring for women in their pregnancy, Dr. See manages benign gynaecological conditions and performs both open and laparoscopic surgery. She obtained advanced training in minimally invasive surgery at KK Hospital, Singapore and Yonsei Severance Hospital, Seoul. Dr. See has also been invited as trainer at various regional conferences. Prior to joining Gleneagles, Dr. See worked in Singapore, where she was recognized for her dedication to patient care and received KK Hospital Service from the Heart Award 2017 and SingHealth Quality Service Silver Award 2018.

MetaDescription: Dr. Sim treats both benign and malignant urinary tract diseases, which include BPH, Urinary Stones, Urinary Tract Cancer (Kidney, Bladder, Prostate) and Urinary Dysfunction.
MetaTitle: Dr. Allen Sim | Urology | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
OpenGraphDescription: Dr Sim graduated with honours from University College Dublin in 2005. He completed his advanced traineeship in Urology in 2014. In addition to presenting at various local and international...
Recommendation:
• Dr Sim graduated with honours from University College Dublin in 2005. He completed his advanced traineeship in Urology in 2014. In addition to presenting at various local and international conferences, Dr Sim has also been speaker and faculty at international conferences. He is author of various publications in both local and international journals. Dr Sim has also been actively involved in the education of medical students, residents and fellows. Dr Sim has successfully conducted multiple advanced laparoscopic urology and Endourology workshop in Singapore, Myanmar and Thailand.
  • In 2014, Dr Sim was awarded a fellowship at the Eberhard Karls University of Tuebingen (Germany) with Prof Christian Schwentner, sub-specialising in Endourology, Laparoscopic and Robotic Surgery. He has a keen interest in management of urinary stone diseases and minimally invasive surgeries for bladder, kidney and prostate. He is trained in sub-specialized procedures such mini PCNL (Percutaneous Nephrolithotomy), wide range of laparoscopic surgeries such as laparoscopic radical nephrectomy, nephroureterectomy, partial nephrectomy, pyeloplasty, retroperitoneal lymph node dissection (RPLND), IVC thrombectomy as well as robotic partial nephrectomy, prostatectomy and radical cystectomy with special interest in intracorporeal urinary reconstruction. Since returning from his fellowship, he has been advancing minimally invasive surgeries and pioneering surgical techniques such as supine PCNL, ECIRS, Video Endoscopic Inguinal Lymphadenectomy (VEIL) and zero ischaemic partial nephrectomy with super-selective clamping.
  • Prior to returning to Malaysia, Dr Sim was Consultant urologist at Singapore General Hospital and he was also Director of Endourology and Fellowship at SGH. Dr SIm has won various service awards for his excellence in clinical service.
ConditionsTreated:
• Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia
  • Cancer: Adrenal, Bladder, Kidney, Penile, Prostate, Testis
  • General Urology: Circumcision, Infection, Hernia, Trauma, Varicocoele, Vasectomy
  • Men’s Health: Erectile Dysfunction, Premature Ejaculation, Subfertility
  • Urinary Stone Diseases
  • Urinary Incontinence: OAB
  • Urinary Tract Disorder: Pelvic-ureteric Junction obstruction, Ureteric strictures

MetaTitle: Prof. Dr. Amir S. Khir | Endocrinology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
OpenGraphDescription: Prof. Dr. Amir S Khir received his medical education at Edinburgh University and graduated with MBChB in 1973, followed by training in Internal Medicine in Edinburgh, Sheffield and Aberdeen, UK...
Recommendation:
Prof. Dr. Amir S Khir received his medical education at Edinburgh University and graduated with MBChB in 1973, followed by training in Internal Medicine in Edinburgh, Sheffield and Aberdeen, UK. He obtained his MRCP (UK) in 1977 and was elected fellow of the Royal Colleges of Physicians of Edinburgh (1990) as well as in Ireland (FRCPI) in 2004. He was awarded an honorary Doctor of Medicine at National University of Ireland in 2016.

Prof. Dr. Amir began a career in academic medicine in 1978 as lecturer at the University of Aberdeen, and subsequently joined University of Malaya (UM) as Associate Professor in 1986. At UM, he became Professor and later Deputy Dean before leaving to become the Foundation Professor of Medicine at Penang Medical College (PMC), where he was elected Dean in 2004 as well as President and Dean from 2013-2016. He now holds a fractional appointment as Professor of Medicine at PMC.

Prof. Dr. Amir received training in Endocrinology and Diabetes at Aberdeen Teaching Hospitals and became Consultant Endocrinologist at University Hospital Kuala Lumpur. Since 1999, he was Honorary Consultant Endocrinologist at Penang Hospital where he started the endocrine service. He is a trainer and examiner for the Ministry of Health Endocrine Fellowship Program. He also sits on the National Specialist Register Committee for Endocrinology.
ConditionsTreated:
Endocrine disorders

- Thyroid

- Diabetes mellitus

- Calcium and bone disorders

- Gonadal diseases

- Pituitary diseases

- And other endocrine and metabolic problems

MetaTitle: Dr. Anand Bhupalan | Gastroenterology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
OpenGraphDescription: Dr. Anand Bhupalan received his medical degree from University of Liverpool in 1984. In 1988 he obtained the MRCP (UK) and in 2006 he received his FRCP (UK)...
FacilityLocation: Suite 306, 3rd Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dr. Anand Bhupalan received his medical degree from University of Liverpool in 1984. In 1988 he obtained the MRCP (UK) and in 2006 he received his FRCP (UK).

Upon graduating from medical school, Dr Anand Bhupalan worked for the NHS in the United Kingdom for seven to eight years. In London, he also worked as a registrar in the Gastroenterology and General Medicine at the West Middlesex Hospital and Charing Cross Hospital.  On returning to Malaysia in 1992, Dr Anand Bhupalan joined the National University of Malaysia (UKM). He was actively involved in undergraduate and postgraduate education.  In 1996, he joined Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur (formerly known as Gleneagles Intan Medical Centre).  During his postgraduate training, Dr. Anand Bhupalan had the opportunity to practice interventional gastroenterology.

Dr Anand Bhupalan held the position of Treasurer for The Gastroenterology and Hepatology Society of Malaysia in year 1993 to 1994.  Dr. Anand Bhupalan has twice been the Chairman of the Medical & Dental Advisory Committee at Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur.

Dr.Anand Bhupalan has specialized in Interventional Endoscopy and has a special interest in Hepatology.

MetaTitle: Dr. Ananda Dharmalingam | Paediatrics | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
OpenGraphDescription: Dr Ananda graduated from the Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland in 1987.  He began his paediatric training in Dublin at the Temple Street Children’s Hospital and Rotunda Hospital before joining...
FacilityLocation: Suite 515, 5th Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dr Ananda graduated from the Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland in 1987.  He began his paediatric training in Dublin at the Temple Street Children’s Hospital and Rotunda Hospital before joining the Royal Children’s Hospital in Melbourne, Australia.  He did his neonatal training at the Royal Women’s Hospital in Melbourne before returning to join the neonatal department at Selayang Hospital.  He joined Gleneagles Hospital in 2004.  

Dr Ananda has extensive experience in neonatology with over 25 years in this field alone.  He introduced high frequency ventilation into Gleneagles Hospital, the first private hospital to acquire this technology.  He also introduced nitric oxide therapy (NO) therapy to Gleneagles Hospital which is one of a handful of hospitals in the country that continue to provide this treatment.

His expertise lies in the management of all sick newborn infants particularly extremely premature infants from 24 weeks and/or 500 grams upwards.  He also continues their follow up as out-patients.  He also admits and treats general paediatric conditions.

Dr Ananda is an accredited trainer for the Neonatal Resuscitation Program (NRP) and regularly provides training to hospital staff.  He is also actively involved in the neonatal training of the nursery staff in the hospital.
ConditionsTreated:
• All conditions related to the newborn infant.
  • Care of all sick term and premature infants including extremely low birth weight infants from 24 weeks gestation.
  • Newborn feeding issues, skin conditions.
  • General paediatric conditions.
  • Routine wellness checks and immunisations.

MetaTitle: Dr. Andy Low Kok Kwan | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
Recommendation:
Dr Andy Low graduated from the University of Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom in 1983. He became a member of the Royal College of Obstetricians & Gynaecologists of the United Kingdom in 1989 and a fellow of the same college in 2002.

Dr Low is an Obstetrician & Gynaecologist who subspecializes in Reproductive Medicine helping sub fertile couples to conceive using the appropriate methods ranging from simple medication to advanced technology including ICSI (special type of test-tube baby procedure). His first test-tube babies were a set of twin born twenty two years ago. Dr Low has special interests in the problems of recurrent miscarriages and polycystic ovary syndrome.

Dr Low is one of the pioneer doctors of Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur and has been the Head of the Department of Obstetricians & Gynaecologists of Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur since 2015.

Dr Low was a Lecturer in Obstetrician & Gynaecology at the University of Malaya from 1992 to 1996. He is now a Clinical Assistant Professor at Universiti Tunku Abdul Rahman.

Dr Low has contributed to public education in issues concerning women’s health and diseases by publishing numerous articles in both Chinese and English languages in newspapers, magazines and books and giving talks on television, radio and public forums.

Dr Low believes in the holistic approach in Medicine which means he would take into consideration both the body and mind of the patient in making diagnosis and formulating treatment.

MetaTitle: Dr. Ang Chin Yong | Cardiology | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
Dr Ang Chin Yong completed his undergraduate (Doctor of Medicine, MD) at Dalhousie University, Halifax, Canada in 2003. He subsequently underwent post-graduate training in internal medicine in New York, USA and obtained certification from American Board of Internal Medicine (ABIM) in 2007. Thereafter, he underwent his cardiology and interventional cardiology training at National Heart Centre Singapore. He received accreditation in Cardiology from Singapore Specialist Accreditation Board, MOH Singapore in 2012. He is a fully registered cardiologist by Singapore Medical Council and National Specialist Register Malaysia. He was elected a Fellow of Academy of Medicine Singapore in 2012. Dr Ang is also a Diplomate of National Board of Echocardiography, USA in transthoracic and transesophageal Echo.

His interest covers an extensive range of invasive as well as non-invasive cardiology services. Invasive cardiac procedures provided include coronary angiogram, right heart study, and percutaneous coronary intervention with stenting (PTCA), pericardiocentesis, temporary pacing wire and permanent pacemaker insertion. Non-invasive tests offered include exercise stress test, transthoracic and transesophageal echocardiogram, stress echocardiogram, and 24-hour Holter monitoring. Dr Ang is also a SCCT, USA level 2 certified cardiologist in coronary CT angiography.
ConditionsTreated:
• General Medical Access
• Coronary Heart Disease
• Arrhythmia
• Valvular Heart Disease
• Cardiomyopathy
• Heart Failure

MetaTitle: Dr. Arasa Raj Sinnathuray | Ear, Nose and Throat Surgery (ENT) | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 105, 1st Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
SpecialInterest:
1. Ear Implants such as Cochlear Implants 
  2. Rhinoplasty (nasal bone correction)
  3. Laser Ear Surgery
Recommendation:
Dr Arasa Raj Sinnathuray went to medical school at the Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland (Dublin) graduating in 1994 (MB BCh). He continued his surgical training in Northern Ireland, UK, and became a Fellow of the Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland in 1999 (FRCS in General Surgery and FRCS in ENT Surgery). He was then appointed to the 6-year Northern Ireland (United Kingdom) Type I Specialist Registrar rotation in ENT Surgery. He passed the Otorhinolaryngology, Head & Neck Surgery exit exam in the UK (FRCS (ORL-HNS)) at first attempt, was awarded a UK Certificate of Completion of Specialist Training (CCT) in ENT Surgery, and subsequently admitted to the ENT Surgery / Otolaryngology UK General Medical Council Specialist Register in 2009 (Roll No. 4557128). He also obtained a Doctorate in Medicine (MD) by thesis on Cochlear Implants and Genetics from Queen’s University Belfast (United Kingdom) in 2007. He also completed advanced Ear Surgery Fellowships in France (2009) and the United Kingdom (2010).

Dr Arasa Raj Sinnathuray returned to Malaysia in January 2011 as a Consultant Specialist ENT Surgeon and was appointed as an Associate Professor at the University Malaya Medical Centre. He has been an invited speaker at the Malaysian Society Of Otolaryngology Head & Neck Surgery annual meetings. In April 2012 he joined Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur (Resident) and Tropicana Medical Centre (Visiting) as a Consultant Specialist ENT Surgeon.

He is trained in advanced ear surgery and was the first surgeon in Malaysia to perform Electro Acoustic Stimulation Surgery (Cochlear Implant and Acoustic amplification for partial deafness), KTP Laser-Assisted Cholesteatoma Surgery, KTP Laser-Assisted Revision Stapes Surgery, Vibrant Soundbridge Middle Ear Implant Surgery with a Vibroplasty Coupler, and Surgical Reconstruction of the Posterior ear canal with a Titanium plate. Other complex operations he has performed which are rare in Malaysia include Bonebridge Implant Surgery, KTP Laser-Assisted Ossiculoplasty (using a Kurz titanium prosthesis) and Canalplasty. He has performed these operations at University Malaya Medical Centre, Tropicana Medical Centre and Gleneagles KL.

He has obtained advanced surgical training in the United Kingdom to a high standard in all aspects of Ear Nose and Throat Surgery. He is a ‘United Kingdom (UK) board- certified’ specialist, with a Certificate of Completion of Specialist Training (CCT) in Otorhinolaryngology, and is on the United Kingdom General Medical Council Specialist Register in Otolaryngology and Malaysian National Specialist Register in Otorhinolaryngology. He has sub-specialised in Otology involving cochlear implants, active middle ear implants, ossiculoplasty, and laser assisted stapes surgery. He also performs cholesteatoma surgery with the assistance of a laser, preserving the ear canal (reducing life-long cleaning and better for swimming) and preserving the ossicles where possible (with resultant better hearing)). He practises as a Consultant ENT Surgeon using the latest equipment, with a special interest in Otology & Rhinology.
ConditionsTreated: Ear infections, Hearing Loss, Tinnitus, Dizziness / Vertigo, Nose and sinus issues, Throat problems including throat pain, difficulty swallowing, and hoarseness, Snoring / Obstructive sleep apnea, Foreign body removal from ear, nose or throat.

ProceduresPerformed: Cochlear Implant, Middle Ear Implant, Bonebridge Implant, BAHA (Bone Anchored Hearing Aid), Laser Cholesteatoma Mastoid surgery, Laser Stapes surgery, Ossiculoplasty, Canalplasty, Ear Drum Surgery (Tympanoplasty), Snoring Surgery, Sinus Surgery, Facial Cosmetic Surgery ( Rhinoplasty & Pinnaplasty), Tonsillectomy and Adenoidectomy, Laser Myringotomy, Myringotomy with Grommet Insertion, Functional Endoscopic Sinus Surgery, Septoplasty, Turbinate surgery, Balloon Sinuplasty, Balloon Eustachian Tuboplasty

MetaTitle: Dr. Ashok Krishnan | Paediatric Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
Dr Ashok completed his Master of Paediatric Surgery in University Malaya, Malaysia in 2014 and was conferred his Fellowship from the European Board of Paediatric Surgery in 2019. His journey as a paediatric surgeon started in Sabah, state of East Malaysia, northern part of the great island of Borneo where he practiced in Sabah Women and Children Hospital, the only tertiary hospital for the entire state of Sabah.

He has extensive experience in paediatric surgery, with a special interest in Minimally Invasive Surgery (keyhole surgery) for children, a procedure that helps children experience less pain, recover faster & provides parents with a better peace of mind. His passion has always been to ensure his patients get the best quality of care which requires good communication with both parents and children while making the entire journey as pain-free as possible.

Dr Ashok also taught and mentored surgical inclined students and authored several international journals. His continued enthusiasm for paediatric surgery and his wide array of experience in this specialty will certainly bring value to patients locally and across the region.

MetaTitle: Dr. Azura Bt Deniel | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Oncology Centre, Ground Floor, Block A
Recommendation:
Dr Azura is a consultant clinical oncologist accredited to practice in Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur.

She obtained her MBBCh from the University of Wales College of Medicine, Cardiff, United Kingdom in 1997. She then completed her postgraduate training with a  Master of Clinical Oncology degree from University of Malaya in 2006. Dr Azura was the head of department of Radiotherapy & Oncology in Hospital Kuala Lumpur prior to leaving the government service.

Dr Azura was trained in prescribing chemotherapy, targeted therapy, immunotherapy, hormonal therapy and radiotherapy. She has wide experience in the treatment of breast, lung, colorectal, gynaecological and head & neck cancers.

Throughout her career, Dr Azura was actively involved in training, research and clinical trials. She was also involved the development of various cancer clinical practice guidelines  such as the Management of Cancer Pain 2010, the Management of Cervical Cancer 2015 and the Management of Colorectal Carcinoma 2017. She was the lead editor of the Ministry of Health Systemic Therapy Protocol 3rd Edition 2016.

Currently Dr Azura is a member of executive committee of the Malaysian Oncology Society, as well as being a member of the Academy of Medicine of Malaysia and the European Society for Medical Oncology (ESMO)
ConditionsTreated: Cancers of the breast, gynaecological, lung, colorectal, gastric, head & neck, and bone & soft tissue tumours

Recommendation:
Dr Ling is accredited as a Physician and Neurologist. She attained her primary degree at University of Wales, Cardiff, United Kingdom in 1990. Thereafter she worked in various hospitals in the United Kingdom which included rotations in General Medicine, Endocrinology and Regional Centres for Cardiology and Respiratory Medicine. She then returned to Malaysia where she continued with General Medicine and Neurology in Hospital Kuala. She has completed her fellowship in Neurophysiology at National Hospital for Neurology and Neurosurgery, Queen Square, London. This is the quartenary centre for Neurology in the United Kingdom.

 

She has learnt acupuncture at the China Nanjing International Acupuncture Training Centre, which is part of the Nanjing University for Chinese Medicine, and Changzhou Hospital, which is also affliated to Nanjing University for Chinese Medicine. This is a WHO Collaborative Centre for Traditional Chinese Medicine. 

 

She has also done an attachment in Neuroradiology at Royal Prince Alfred Hospital and Westmead Hospital, both in Sydney, Australia in recent years.

MetaTitle: Dr. Buvanesvaran Tachina Moorthi | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Buvan hails from Sungai Petani, Kedah. He graduated with a MBBS degree, University of Malaya in 1999. He then served as an intern and as a Medical Officer in Surgery for three years in Hospital Taiping, Perak. He subsequently trained in surgery under Dato Dr. RR Naidu in Hospital Alor Star, Kedah, and graduated with a Master’s in Surgery from University Kebangsaan Malaysia.

Dr. Buvan went on to serve as a General Surgeon at Hospital Sultanah Bahiyah, Alor Star, Kedah where he was actively involved in academic surgical activities, including being an Honorary Lecturer to the Medical Faculty of AIMST University and Facilitator to Surgical programmes of The Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland at Penang Medical College.

Dr. Buvan was subsequently admitted as Member of The Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland. He also obtained training in Laparoscopic Surgery at the Indian Institute of Laparoscopic Surgery (IILS) Coimbatore, India.

Dr. Buvan then enrolled in the Subspecialty Training Programme in Colorectal Surgery. He trained in the Colorectal Units of Hospital Sultanah Bahiyah, University Kebangsaan Malaysia and in Hull University, England where he was a Lecturer in Surgery and completed his Clinical Fellowship in Colorectal Surgery at The Hull & East Yorkshire NHS Trust. During this time, he had the opportunity to train under two renowned Colorectal Surgeons – Prof. Graemme Duthie and John Hartley.
ConditionsTreated: Entire spectrum of colorectal diseases specifically in cancer surgery and all general surgical procedures.

MetaTitle: Dr. Chan Kin Yuen | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 116, 1st Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dr Chan Kin Yuen is currently practicing as a Consultant Orthopaedic Surgeon in Gleneagles Hospital, Kuala Lumpur.

He have been in practice as an orthopaedic specialist surgeon since 1990 and have trained abroad at various centres of excellence. Dr Chan have a special interest in arthroscopic surgery which is  a technique that uses small key-holes to access joints for surgical treatment and also joint replacements involving the shoulder, elbow and knee. Arthroscopic surgery is one of the technique that is commonly used for the treatment of orthopaedic sports medicine conditions involving the shoulders, elbow, wrist, knees and ankle joints.

Dr Chan approach to treatment is to provide a personalized and individualized care. Not all patients with the same condition are treated the same way as there are many other factors that need to be taken into account that may have a major impact on the appropriate treatment offered. To achieve optimal results, your active participation and cooperation is essential especially after your surgery with the help of the physiotherapist in your rehabilitation.

Previously Dr Chan was involved teaching medical students at Monash University, Sunway, Selangor. Till today Dr Chan is very active in participating and organizing national and international conferences and courses involving health care professionals such as surgeon, nurses and general practitioners.  

Dr Chan is currently is the vice president of Malaysian Association of Sports Medicine (MASM) and he is also a member of Academy of Medicine Malaysia (AMM), British Elbow and Shoulder Society (BESS) and British Orthopaedic Association (BOA). Dr Chan is also very active in writing articles and occasionally appear on talk show or interview in radio or television.
ConditionsTreated:
1. Carpal Tunnel Syndrome

2. Hip Osteoarthritis

3. Joint Injuries

4. Knee Injuries and Disorders,

5. Knee Osteoarthritis,

6. Repetitive Strain Injury

7. Rheumatoid Arthritis

8. Shoulder Injuries and Disorders

9. Torn Cartilage

10. Torn Ligaments

Recommendation:
Dr Chang Choong Chor is a resident consultant dermatologist in Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur and the director of CC Chang Skin Specialist. He received his undergraduate medical degree from the University of Malaya in 1996. Having completed his internal medicine training and obtained the membership of the Royal College of Physicians (UK), he undertook dermatology training in the Department of Dermatology, Hospital Kuala Lumpur and obtained the Advanced Master of Dermatology from the Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia in 2006. He also completed a fellowship in dermatology at the National Skin Centre, Singapore.

Dr Chang is a member of the Dermatological Society of Malaysia, the Malaysian Medical Association, and an international fellow of the American Academy of Dermatology. He has been active in medical research, and has lectured in various local and international conferences. He has authored and co-authored numerous scientific publications in peer-reviewed journals. He is also a reviewer of several prestigious medical journals and an examiner of the Advanced Master of Dermatology examination. He has special interest in eczema, psoriasis, acne, skin tumours, drug allergy and pharmacogenetics.

Board-certified Consultant Plastic and Laser Surgeon Dr Charles Lee graduated from the University of Mysore in 1976. He was conferred a Fellow of the Royal Colleges of Surgeons of Edinburgh, Glasgow and Ireland in 1984. Dr Lee did his Postgraduate Plastic Surgery fellowship training at the Bangour General Hospital, Edinburgh, Scotland; Addenbrooke’s Hospital, Cambridge and Frenchay Hospital, Bristol, England. He was subsequently gazetted as a Clinical Specialist in Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery by the Ministry of Health, Malaysia in 1987 and worked at the General Hospital, Kuala Lumpur.

In 1989, Dr Lee was appointed by the Ministry of Health to establish the first Department of Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital (QEH) in Sabah. He also established the first Burns Unit at QEH and developed the Unit to become the primary Burns Referral Centre in Sabah. He was elected as the Vice-President of the Malaysian Association of Plastic, Aesthetic and Craniomaxillofacial Surgeons (MAPACS) in 2003-2005 and continues to be a current member of the association.

In 2008, Dr Lee received the prestigious Pinnacle Award by Thermage USA as the highest Thermage user for Facial Contouring in Malaysia, a further testimony of his passion for Aesthetics and Body Contouring. In 2010, Dr Lee is credited as the first plastic surgeon to bring the high-tech EndoVenous Laser Ablation treatment (EVLA) for varicose veins to the state of Sabah. His interest in this subspeciality led to the launching of the first Public Venous Disease Awareness Campaign in Sabah called ‘Jom Scan Kaki’ which includes free duplex ultrasound scanning of the lower limbs for varicose veins.

In 2011, he was awarded the Certificate of Achievement for Good Clinical Practice by the Clinical Research Centre, Ministry of Health, Malaysia. He was subsequently appointed as the Principal Investigator for the first clinical trial in Malaysia to determine the efficacy of Autologous Cultured Fibroblast Cells as a treatment for patients with facial contour defects thereby actively contributing to clinical research in Malaysia.

In 2015, Dr Lee founded a charity community initiative called ‘CLAP for Joy’ to provide excellence in well-timed surgical care, dentition, hearing, speech and language development for underprivileged Cleft Lip and Palate (CLAP) children born in Sabah from infancy to adulthood. A visionary project that has been well received by the public. Dr Lee has been a Consultant Plastic & Cosmetic Surgeon for 30 years. His brand ‘Just Get Gorgeous- Where Radiance Becomes Personal’ continues to embrace the concept of Beauty, Science and Experience. He looks forward to establishing the first Aesthetic Plastic Surgery & Medical Spa at Gleneagles Kota Kinabalu, a One-Stop Center for Medical Aesthetics and Cosmetic Enhancement. Dr Charles Lee is a pioneer with a difference. His websites include: www.sabahplasticsurgery.com
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Charles Lee | Plastic Reconstructive Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Title: Charles Lee

MetaTitle: Dr. Cheong Fook Meng | Ophthalmology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 312, 3rd Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
• Dr. Cheong is a comprehensive ophthalmologist with a predominant interest in refractive cataract surgery and specialty interest in glaucoma and external eye conditions such as pterygium.
  • He graduated from University College London (UCL). He started his ophthalmology training in Moorfields Eye Hospital and obtained his higher surgical training in the Guy’s and St. Thomas’ Hospitals training rotation in London.
  • He is one of the pioneers in Malaysia for sutureless small incision cataract surgery and sutureless conjunctival grafting in pterygium surgery, both performed under eyedrop anaesthesia.
  • He is the first in Asia-Pacific to implant the PanOptix trifocal intraocular lens (IOL) and first in Asia to implant the Clareon intraocular lens with a novel fully automated hand-held IOL delivery device.
  • He is also the first in Malaysia and among the first in the region to implant a variety of toric monofocal and multifocal intraocular lenses to reduce pre-existing astigmatism and spectacle dependence, for far and near vision, at the time of cataract surgery.
  • He is involved in the teaching of cataract surgery in the region and participates actively in international meetings. He is invited on a regular basis by industry partners to speak on advanced technology intraocular lenses and other aspects of cataract surgery.
ConditionsTreated: Cataracts, glaucoma, pterygium, diabetic retinopathy, refractive errors and squints, dry eyes and allergy, cornea and conjunctival conditions, eyelid conditions, retinopathy of prematurity
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Cheong Fook Meng | Ophthalmology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
ProceduresPerformed: Refractive cataract surgery, routine and complex cataract surgery, glaucoma surgery, conjunctival and pterygium surgery, eyelid surgery, laser treatment for cataract, glaucoma and retinal conditions, intravitreal injections
LanguageSpoken: English, Bahasa Malaysia, Cantonese, Mandarin, Hakka
Title: Cheong Fook Meng

MetaTitle: Dr. Cheong Wai Seng | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
Dr. Cheong graduated with MD from Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia in 2006. He started government service in Hospital Tuanku Jaafar, Seremban and was then transferred to Serdang Hospital. In 2010, he qualified as a general physician when he passed the MRCP(UK) exams. Subsequently, Dr. Cheong underwent nephrology training in Sultanah Fatimah Specialist Hospital (Muar), Sultanah Amina Hospital (Johor Bahru), Selayang Hospital and Kuala Lumpur General Hospital.

In 2015, he was awarded the fellowship of Nephrology by the Nephology Board of Malaysia. He was then appointed to become the head of medicine in Sultanah Nora Ismail Hospital (Batu Pahat). Dr. Cheong is well versed and experienced in various renal condition. These include nephritis, nephrotic syndrome, acute kidney injury, chronic kidney disease as well as end stage renal disease with therapeutic options of haemodialysis, peritoneal dialysis, and renal transplantation. He is also keenly interested in the control of non-communicable disease such as diabetes, hypertension, dyslipidaemia along with their complication.

Acute Kidney Failure
Chronic Kidney Disease, Glomerulonephritis

MetaTitle: Dr. Chin Kin Fah | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 712, 7th Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
• Prof. Dr. Chin graduated in medicine from the University of Aberdeen in 1993. He was awarded Intercollegiate Fellowship in General Surgery and Upper GI surgery  and Certificate of Completion of Specialist Training (CCST) in United Kingdom in 2005. He completed his Senior Fellowship in Upper GI and Laparoscopic surgery in Adelaide in 2006, following which he was appointed as a Consultant General Surgeon in Yorkshire UK. He returned to Malaysia in November 2008 and joined University Malaya as a Senior Consultant Surgeon and Professor in Surgery. He was the Lead Clinician in Upper GI, Bariatric and Clinical Nutrition until 2015 when he joined Universiti Tunku Abdul Rahman, and later a Head of School of Medicine, Taylor’s University in 2017.
  • Prof. Dr. Chin is currently a clinical professor of surgery in University of Tunku Abdul Rahman’s (UTAR), an adjunct professor in school of medicine of Taylor’s University and Inti International University, a visiting Professor of Yangon Medical University, and Defence Service Medical Academy in Myanmar.
  • Prof. Dr Chin is the pioneer of ‘SILENT MENTOR’ Program in Malaysia, a humanity program that promotes body donation for betterment and benefit of Medical Education, Training & Research. He launched the program in 2012 while he was a professor n University of Malaya. In 2017, he formed Academy for Silent Mentor which promotes the program to whole Malaysia, collaborate with various Universities and benefiting to more Malaysia’s medical students.  
  • Prof. Dr Chin has been elected to many committees & positions for various local and international medical bodies, such as Advisory Board Member of Asia Endosurgery Task Force,  Governor of Endoscopic and laparoscopic Surgeons of Asia, Governor of Asia Pacific Metabolic and Bariatic Surgery Society, Standing Committee Member of Asian Society of Cryosurgery, committee member of Malaysia Upper Gastrointestinal Surgeons Society, Former Council Member of College of Surgeons of Malaysia, Former Vice President of Parenteral and Entreral  Nutrition Society of Malaysia.
ConditionsTreated: Benign diseases (Gallstones, GORD, Haemorrhoids, Fistula) and Cancers of Gastrointestinal Tract (oesophageal, stomach, pancreatic, some liver, small bowel and colorectal); Obesity and Diabetes; Thyroid, Parathyroid and adrenal disease; Malnutrition; Nutrition support; Palliative care surgery; Hernia; skin lesions

MetaTitle: Dr. Chong Yew Thong | Dermatology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Chong was born and raised in Penang. He attended the Penang Free School before pursuing further studies in Universiti Sains Malaysia. He graduated with Diploma in Medical Laboratory Technology (MLT) in 1995 and Doctor of Medicine (MD) in 2000. He obtained membership of MRCP (UK) in 2005 and thereafter worked as Physician at Hospital Pulau Pinang for two years before undergoing sub-specialist training in Dermatology at Hospital Sultanah Aminah, Johor Bahru and Hospital Kuala Lumpur. He was awarded the Advanced Master of Dermatology from Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM) in 2010. He also trained in dermatologic laser surgery at Mahidol University, Bangkok.

Prior to joining Gleneagles Penang, Dr. Chong worked as a Consultant Physician and Dermatologist as well as Head of Department of Dermatology at Hospital Sultanah Nur Zahirah, Kuala Terengganu.

Dr. Chong was actively involved in teaching, especially house officers and medical officers in the Ministry of Health hospitals. He was also an honorary lecturer at Penang Medical College UCSI University. He regularly participates in medical Continuous Professional Development (CPD) programmes and was an invited speaker at various seminars. His dedication to the medical profession earned him an ‘Excellent Service Award’ from the Ministry of Health in 2006 and in 2011.
ConditionsTreated:
All types of skin disorders, adverse cutaneous drug reaction, sexually transmitted infections and leprosy.

Dr. Chong’s field of interest are psoriasis, acne, eczema, skin infections, and genito-urinary medicine.

MetaTitle: Dr. Chuah Kim Hua | Anaesthesiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Chuah received his early schooling at Kim Seng Primary School, and at SMJK Jit Sin in Bukit Mertajam, Penang.

Dr. Chuah graduated from the University of New South Wales, Australia, in 1991 and obtained his specialist qualification (Master of Anaesthesiology) from the University of Malaya in 2000.

He was appointed Clinical Specialist at the Department of Anaesthesiology, Universiti Malaya Medical Centre, Kuala Lumpur, in June 2000. In July 2001, he went for cardiac anaesthesiology training at the National Heart Centre, Kuala Lumpur until February 2003. He then resumed his post as Clinical Specialist at Universiti Malaya Medical Centre until he joined Gleneagles Penang in August 2006.

Dr. Chuah published his experiences in anaesthesiology as a series of case reports in the Asean Journal of Anaesthesiology and Malaysian Medical Journal. He is also a contributor to ‘A Handbook on Acute Care’ (UM Press 2005).

Dr. Chuah is a member of the Academy of Medicine, Malaysia, Malaysian Society of Anaesthesiology, a life member of Malaysian Medical Association (MMA) and Penang Private Medical Practitioner Society (PMPS) and a committee member of Koperasi Doktor Pulau Pinang Berhad.

Dr. Chuah is married and blessed with three lovely children – a girl and two boys. He enjoys reading and swimming during his free time.

Articles Published:

  1. Chuah KH, Rajeev Kishen, Chong Chee Siang, Siow Yew Siong, Tan Patrick. Anaesthesia for Scoliosis Surgery in Uncorrected Tetralogy of Fallot – Two Case Reports. ASEAN JOURNAL OF ANAESTHESIOLOGY. May 2004, Volume 5, Number 2, 22-26.
  2. K H Chuah, M Mansor, G Rajen, C Y Wang, Y K Chan. Technique of Anaesthesia in Pulmonary Hypertension and Thrombophilia in Early Pregnancy. Med J Malaysia, Vol 61, No 1, March 2006, Pg 114-116.
  3. K H Chuah, C L Thong, H Krshnan, L Chan. Low Dose Unilateral Spinal Anaesthesia for Lower Limb Amputation in Critically Ill Patients. Med J Malaysia, Vol 62, No 1, March 2007, Pg 81-82.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Chuah Kim Hua | Anaesthesiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed: Dr. Chuah has been trained to provide anaesthesia for various types of surgery, including neurosurgery, paediatric surgery and cardiac surgery.
Title: Chuah Kim Hua

MetaTitle: Dr. Chuah Uei Chyi | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation:
After obtaining his master’s degree in Orthopaedic Surgery, Dr Chuah continued his spine surgical training in Singapore General Hospital. He returned to serve as the Head of Spine Service for the State of Sabah, Malaysia from 2009 to 2015. He is currently the only surgeon from the state of Sabah who is recognized by Ministry of Health Malaysia to have completed a formal spine fellowship surgical training.

Dr Chuah is very competent in both advanced and general spine procedures. He introduced minimally invasive spine surgeries to Sabah and is a pioneer in promoting safe and personalized spine services by introducing the intra-operative spinal cord monitoring and spine navigation usage. He has special interest in pain intervention as part of his spine consultation, giving his patient alternatives and choices for their pathologies.

Dr Chuah is frequently invited as a guest speaker and spine educator for international spine surgeons in this region, promoting minimally invasive (Key-Hole) spine surgeries for the next generation of spine surgeons. He is the key opinion leader for various orthopaedics and pharmaceutical products and actively promoting osteoporosis awareness among the community.
ConditionsTreated: Neck Pain & Back Pain, Sciatica or Radiculopathy pain (Leg or arm Pain, Tingling, Numbness), Degenerative Disc Disease, Disc herniation/ Stenosis, Spinal Deformities (Scoliosis, Kyphosis), Congenital spine deformity, Soft Tissue and Bony Tumors of the spine, Traumatic spine injury, Unsteady gait, Spine Infection, Osteoporosis, Osteoarthritis
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Chuah Uei Chyi | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
ProceduresPerformed: Diagnosis & Cause determination counseling, Pain Intervention Therapy, Radiofrequency Denervation/ Ablation, Nerve Root / DRG Block, Annuloplasty, Discography, Facet Joint Injection, Discectomy, Spinal Decompression, Spine stabilization and Fusion, Spine Reconstruction, Surgical Intervention of spine tumors/ infection, Osteoporosis Management, Vertebroplasty / Kyphoplasty, Minimally Invasive Spine Procedure, Navigation Spine Surgery, Intra-Operative Spinal Cord Monitoring
Title: Chuah Uei Chyi

Registered with the National Specialist Register, Academy of Medicine of Malaysia, he was the past Malaysian Association of Plastic, Aesthetic and Maxillofacial Surgery and instrumental in the setting up of the Burns Unit in the University Hospital Petaling Jaya in 1985. Dr David Cheah specializes in blepharoplasty, rhinoplasty, facelift, double eyelid surgery, liposuction, cleft lip and palate repair and facial rejuvenation including thread lifts and lasers.

MetaTitle: Dato' Dr. Devan Pillay | Cardiology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 303, 3rd Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Received his early training in Interventional Cardiology at the National Heart Institute, Kuala Lumpur and subsequently completed his Fellowship training in Interventional Cardiology and subspecialisation in Coronary Intravascular Ultrasound and Intracoronary Pressure Wire assessment of coronary lesions, at Stanford University School of Medicine in Palo Alto, California.

Dr Devan is a fellow of 5 academies - the Royal College of Physicians of Ireland, the American College of Cardology, the European Society of Cardiology, the Society of Cardiac Angiography and Intervention and the National Heart Association of Malaysia.

His present field of interest is in Primary Angioplasty and Stenting in Acute Myocardial Infarction, Intravascular Ultrasound and the use of Intracoronary Pressure Wire in the assessment of coronary stenoses and Out Patient Transradial Angioplasty and Stenting.

For his achievements and dedication to the medical field, Dr. Devan was awarded The 'Darjah Indera Mahkota Pahang' which carries the title 'Dato' by His Royal Highness The Sultan of Pahang.
ConditionsTreated: Coronary and peripheral interventions.
OpenGraphTitle: Dato' Dr. Devan Pillay | Cardiology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
QualificationAndCertifications: DIMP, MBBS, FNHAM(MAL), FRCP(Ireland), FESC(Europe), FACC(USA), FSCAI(USA)
ProceduresPerformed: Full range of percutaneous coronary interventions including primary angioplasty & stenting for heart attacks and complex angioplasties, Transradial coronary angioplasty and stenting, Intravascular ultrasound (IVUS) assessment of the coronary arteries, Optical coherence tomography (OCT) assessment of the coronary arteries, Fractional flow reserve (FFR) assessment of the coronary arteries, Pacemaker implantation, Peripheral intervention including carotid, iliac, and renal arteries, Inferior vena cava filter insertion for deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism, Intracoronary stem cell injection for ischemic and dilated cardiomyopathy.
Title: Devan Pillay

MetaTitle: Dr. Devaraj a/l Pancharatnam | Neurosurgery | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
Graduate of the University of Malaya, with Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery, Dr Devaraj Pancharatnam began his medical career in the Island of Penang.

Upon completion of internship, his career in Neurosurgery began with the Northern Unit of Neurosurgery, Penang General Hospital. Spurned by interest in surgery, he embarked on undertaking the Masters of Surgery with the University of Malaya.

A complete trained general surgeon, He continued subspeciality training in neurosurgery with the Neurosurgical Unit at University Malaya. Dr Devaraj was subsequently offered further fellowship training at the prestigious Universtiy of Oxford in the fields of functional, neuro-oncology and Spine Surgery. He was conferred the fellowship of the Royal college of Surgeons of Edinburgh and Royal college of Surgeons of England in Neurosurgery(FRCSNeurosurgery).

Upon completion of training in the United Kingdom, realisation of the everchanging role of minimally invasive surgery, he embarked on a fellowship at the world renowned gammaknife center at Sheffield Uk.
ConditionsTreated:
Spine and head injury
Brain, head and spine tumor
Hidrocephalus
Spine Disc Protrusion
Haemorrhagic Stroke
Aneurysms of blood vessels in the brain and nervous system

Defect in Nervous system etc

MetaTitle: Dr. Devindran Arumugam | Anaesthesiology | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation:
Dr Devindran was awarded a government scholarship for him to pursue his MBBS (UM) in 1996 after completing STPM. He also got his Masters in Anaesthesiology (UM) in 2003.

He went on to have his houseman ship in Queen Elizabeth Hospital. After completing his houseman ship, he became an Anaesthetic Medical Officer in QEH, where he did anaesthesia including for neuro and paediatrics cases.

He then became a Resident Anaesthetic Medical Officer in UHKL for all sub-specialty including neuro, cardiothoracic and ICU. He went on to become a Specialist in KL General Hospital, an then he moved to Putra Specialist Hospital before working at Pantai Hospital, Batu Pahat. In summary, he does anaesthesia in general surgery, urology, orthopaedics/spinal surgery, ENT, Obstetrics & Gynaecology, eye, day care, and paediatrics cases.

MetaTitle: Dr. Doreen Lee Li Peng | Breast Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
Recommendation:
Dr. Doreen Lee is National Specialist Registered Surgeon for both General Surgery and Breast & Endocrine Surgery. She graduated in 1998 with the Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery Degree (MBBS) from Kasturba Medical College, Manipal Academy of Higher Education, India, followed by the Masters in Surgery (MS) in 2007 from Universiti Malaya. She received the Royal College of Surgeons Edinburgh Fellowship for Breast & Endocrine Surgery in 2012.

She gained expertise in Oncoplastic& Reconstructive Breast Surgery (ORBS) during her stint in United Kingdom with highly skilled Plastic and Oncoplastic Breast Surgeons from Glasgow, Sheffield and Nottingham. She has been a Consultant General, Breast & Endocrine Surgeon at Queen Elizabeth Hospital, Kota Kinabalu Sabah since 2013. She has been with the Ministry of Health Malaysia for the past 22 years.

She provides comprehensive consultations on disorders of the Breast & Neck. Her skill set includes versatility in an array of breast surgery procedures, tailored to fit the individual. As an endocrine surgeon, her expertise lies in focused, meticulous dissections in the neck which is of paramount importance to Quality of Life after surgery.

Her keen interest in various aspects of academic and research projects on Thyroid & Parathyroid disorders, high volume Oncoplastic & Reconstructive Breast Surgery (ORBS) work has won her several international accolades including a stint at Massachusetts General Hospital-Harvard University with the Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery Department.
ConditionsTreated:
1. Breast Remodelling & Reconstruction 
  2. Thyroid & Parathyroid Surgery
  3. Neck Dissections

Dr Edmund Lai received the Singapore Government Merit Scholarship for undergraduate (National University of Singapore) and Human Development Scholarship Singapore for Postgraduate Medical Studies.  He received his Advanced Surgical Training in Singapore and then accepted into Fellow of Academy of Medicine (Singapore). He was accredited (formerly) by Singapore Government in Assisted Reproductive Medicine and became the person in-charge of the National Sperm Bank (Singapore).

He held a teaching position in University Hospital (University Malaya) before going into private practice in 1998. Apart from Obstetric and Gynaecology, he is registered as a Subspecialist in Reproductive Medicine under Malaysia National Specialist Register.

MetaTitle: Dr. Eleen Chong Yun Yin | Rheumatology | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation:
Dr Eleen Chong received her basic medical training at the Kasturba Medical College, India and her sub specialty training in the field of rheumatology at Tan Tock Seng Hospital, Singapore and Selayang Hospital, Selangor. In 2009, the first clinical trial in rheumatoid arthritis in Sabah was initiated by Dr Eleen in collaboration with international pharmaceutical industry. Since then, she has conducted numerous other clinical trials in various rheumatic diseases including rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus and spondyloarthritis. Driven by the lack of clinical data in the local setting, Dr Eleen and her colleagues initiated the Queen Elizabeth Hospital Lupus Registry and a study on Rheumatoid Arthritis patients in Sabah based on the National Inflammatory Arthritis Registry.

Dr. Eleen’s scope of practice includes the evaluation and management of rheumatic conditions ranging from all form of arthritis, soft tissue rheumatism and osteoporosisto complex autoimmune diseases such as systemic lupus erythematosus, systemic sclerosis and systemic vasculitis. She has been an executive committee member of the Persatuan SLE Malaysia, Sabah Chapter since 2013 (as a Medical Advisor and currently the Vice President) and the Sabah Medical Association, Secretary since 2008.

MetaTitle: Dr. Fan Kin Sing | Nephrology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 613, 6th Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dr Fan Kin Sing graduated in 1980 from University of Malaya. He obtained MRCP from the Royal College of Physician of UK in 1981 and FRCP in 1987.  He received his training in Nephrology at HKL and subsequently at the Transplantation Unit of Western Infirmary, Glasgow in 1990.  

During his tenure at HKL he had expressed interest in the management of renal bone disease through introduction of intact PTH monitoring, serum Aluminium evaluation, desferrioxamine testing and ultrasound guided injection of enlarged parathyroid glands in patients unfit for surgery

He has been accredited as a Nephrologist with the Ministry of Health, Malaysia and is a member of the Academy of Malaysia.  He has been working as a Consultant Nephrologist in Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur Medical Centre since 1998.a

MetaTitle: Dato' Dr. Faridah Ismail | Endocrinology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 715, 7th Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dato' Dr Faridah Ismail graduated with MB ChB from Glasgow University in 1990. She worked in Scotland for 2 years after graduating, following which she returned to Malaysia. She joined University Kebangsaan Malaysia and completed her Masters Degree in Internal Medicine in UKM in 1997. She then completed her Endocrinology training in the similar institute and continued as Consultant Physician & Endocrinologist and Clinical Lecturer in Medical Faculty UKM, practicing clinical medicine and Endocrinology in Hospital UKM.

Dato' Dr Faridah Ismail joined Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur in 2000. She sees and manages a wide range of Endocrine disorders. Diabetes and thyroid disorders are the commonest cases seen.
ConditionsTreated:
In adults with:

1. Type 1/2/Gestational diabetes mellitus, Steroids induced diabetes

2. Diabetes insipidus

3. Hypothyroidism/Hyperthyroidism, Thyroiditis, Thyroid nodules/ Multinodular goitre/Hypokalaemia associated with thyroid disorders, Thyroid cancers

4. Cushing's syndrome - Pituitary or steroid induced

5. Pituitary disorders - hypopituitarism or overactive - Acromegaly, Micro/Macroprolactinoma, Hypogonadism, Empty sella syndrome

6. Adrenal disorders - adrenal adenomas, Conn's tumour, Phaeochromocytoma, Addison's disease, Partial/adrenal hyperplasia

7. Primary hyperparathyroidism, diseases associated with hyper/hypocalcaemia

8. Obesity with/without Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome

9. Premature ovarian failure/premature menopause

10. Andropause

11. Premature osteoporosis/steroid induced osteoporosis

12. Chromosome linked sexual development - Turner's Syndrome, Klinefelter's syndrome, Gonadal dysgenesis

13. Pancreatic tumours - insulinoma, glucagonoma

14. Management of patient pre/post bariatric surgery

In adolescent:

1. Weight management

2. Type 2 diabetes

3. Thyroid disorders

MetaTitle: Dr. Gan Hwa Wooi | Cardiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Gan had his basic education in Penang and furthered his medical studies at University of Malaya. Subsequently, he obtained his MRCP (UK), trained at the National Heart Centre of Singapore, board-certified as Cardiologist and sub-specialised in Interventional Cardiology. He then underwent a Fellowship Program with Dr. Chiung-Jen Wu at Chang Gung Memorial Hospital – Kaohsiung Medical Centre and obtained a Fellowship in Transradial Intervention and Interventional Cardiology.

Prior to joining Gleneagles Penang, Dr. Gan worked as a Consultant Interventional Cardiologist at Changi General Hospital in Singapore and as a Visiting Specialist at National Heart Centre of Singapore.

Dr. Gan’s endeavours to provide his patients with the best care and services were well acknowledged when he received the Service Quality – Bronze Award from National Heart Centre and Service Quality – Silver Award from Singhealth Group. He always upholds the vision – Patient at the Heart of All We Do.
ConditionsTreated: Dr. Gan manages a wide range of heart diseases and cardiovascular-related illnesses such as dyslipidaemia, resistance hypertension and diabetes mellitus. He is also an American College of Sports Medicine certified Clinical Exercise Specialist, who is able to counsel and give exercise prescription according to patient’s heart condition. His specific interest is in Interventional Cardiology and especially in Transradial Intervention.

MetaTitle: Dr. (Mrs.) Gan Kam Ling | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Gan was awarded a Singapore government scholarship to pursue her medical degree at University of Singapore. After her graduation, she worked at different hospitals in Singapore before returning to Penang to work at Penang General Hospital, where she had her basic training in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynaecology.

Dr. Gan then spent a year in the United Kingdom, initially at King’s College Hospital and subsequently at Derby City Hospital. She further attained her postgraduate training in Gynaecological Oncology at Mayo Clinic and University of California (Irvine) in the United States.

Dr. Gan joined Gleneagles Penang in 1990 and started laparoscopic surgery in 1992. In 2000, she was made a Fellow of the Royal College of Obstetricians & Gynaecologists.

Dr. Gan is active in voluntary social work. In 1993, Jaycees (Malaysia) awarded her the “Outstanding Young Malaysian Award” for her personal achievement. In 2005, she was awarded the “Outstanding Women Award” by Kwong Wah Yit Poh. She is the Patron of JCI Pearl Penang.

She is married and her happiest moments are spent with her family.

MetaTitle: Dr. Gavin Yong Kok Weng | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation: Dr. Gavin qualified with MBBS in 1996 and subsequently with the Masters in Obstetrics and Gynaecology from University Sains Malaysia (USM) in 2005. He has worked with the Ministry of Health in Hospital Queen Elizabeth, Kota Kinabalu; Hospital Papar, Sabah; Hospital Miri, Sarawak and Hospital Ampang in Selangor. He has helped to initiate the Obstetrics and Gynaecology Unit in Hospital Ampang in the year 2007-09, when it first started as a nucleus hospital in Selangor. In 2010, he moved on to join Metro Maternity Hospital in Klang, running its general O&G services and infertility unit., together with renowned infertility expert Dr. Tee SP. In 2013, the infertility unit in Hospital Wanita Metro took on a bigger role and became Metro IVF. Currently still training with Metro IVF, Dr. Gavin counsel’s infertility patients and initiates ovarian stimulations and intrauterine insemination.

MetaTitle: Dr. George Lee Eng Geap | Urology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 218, 2nd Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dr George Lee is a consultant urological surgeon with many years of experience. As a passionate educator, Dr George Lee is currently Clinical Associate Professor at Monash University.

Dr George Lee is qualified from Cambridge University in Pharmacology. He completed his medical degree at Fitzwilliam College & Addenbrooke’s Clinical School, Cambridge. Dr Lee Subsequently had his surgical training in Oxford & completed his Urological training from Imperial College London. Dr Lee obtained his CCST (United Kingdom) & FEBU (EUROPE) & served as a consultant urological surgeon in UKM before returning back to Malaysia in 2007.

Dr Lee served as Associate Professor in University Malaya & continued practicing privately treating Urological conditions. He is well regarded in his expertise in Men’s Health, Urological Cancers, Prostate Diseases, Sexual Dysfunction and Fertility.
