MetaTitle: Dato' Dr. Ghandhiraj Somasundram | Cardiothoracic Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 605, 6th Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dato' Dr. Ghandhiraj Somasundram was trained in the United Kingdom and was accredited by the General Medical Council of UK as a Consultant Cardiothoracic Surgeon, where he had worked as a Consultant before returning to Malaysia to work permanently.

He also trained in Cardiovascular Surgery at the University of Vienna, Austria. He was appointed as one of the pioneer Consultant Cardiothoracic Surgeons at Gleneagles Hospital in 1996, where he continues to have an advanced and busy practice. Dr. Somasundram is a specialist in coronary artery bypass surgery, heart valve repair and replacement, surgery for aortic aneurysms and dissections and left ventricular restorative surgery.

He also performs the full range of thoracic operations and video assisted thoracoscopic interventions for lung and mediastinal disease and chest trauma.

Most notably, Dr. Somasundram is an expert in surgical pulmonary thromboembolectomy for life-threatening acute massive pulmonary thromboembolism using his innovative technique which he has shared and presented his work in regional academic conferences.

Dr. Somasundram is an active member of many professional medical bodies including the American Society of Thoracic Surgeons (STS), European Association of Cardiovascular and Thoracic Surgery (EACTS), Asian Society of Cardiovascular and Thoracic Surgery (ASCVTS) and the Malaysian Association of Cardiovascular and Thoracic Surgery (MACTS).

Dr. Somasundram has attended and presented at numerous meetings and is currently an expert reviewer of academic journals. Besides that Dr.Somasundram has been a past Chairman and Deputy Chairman of the Medical Advisory Committee of the Hospital. He has also been involved with various administrative activities with the Management of the Hospital for its development.

He is currently the Head of Department of Cardiothoracic Surgery of Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur.
ConditionsTreated: Coronary artery surgery, valve repairs, Aortic surgery,  Lung Tumours
OpenGraphTitle: Dato' Dr. Ghandhiraj Somasundram | Cardiothoracic Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
QualificationAndCertifications: DBTJ, MBBS, FRCSI(Edinburgh), FRCS(Glasgow), CST (Cardiothoracic Surgery) UK, Diploma in Cardiovascular Surgery (Vienna)
ProceduresPerformed:
Cardiac Operations

1. Surgery for coronary artery disease and it's complications

2. Heart Valve repair and replacement

3. Surgery for thoracic aortic diseases, like aortic aneurysms and dissections

4. Left Ventricular Restorative procedures for Heart failure

5.Surgery for acute and chronic pulmonary thromboembolism

6. Surgery for Cardiac and Great vessel Trauma

7.Surgery for Pericardial diseases

8. Surgery for Cardiac Tumours

MetaTitle: Dr. Goh Heong Keong | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Goh graduated from University of Malaya in 2001 and subsequently obtained his MRCP from the United Kingdom in 2005. He was trained in Singapore before joining the Ministry of Health Fellowship in Nephrology in 2008.

Dr. Goh has worked in Hospital Selayang and Hospital Kuala Lumpur where he was actively involved in managing patients for general nephrology, dialysis, kidney transplantation and critical care nephrology. He is also an honorary lecturer at Penang Medical College and has participated in various national and international trials.

Besides his clinical work, Dr. Goh is also an author of a best-selling ebook entitled “Pass MRCP PACES in One Attempt!”. He is also a founder of “PassPACES.com – Your Gateway to MRCP”, a portal popular among junior doctors preparing for their postgraduate medical examination.
ConditionsTreated:
1. Diabetes mellitus / hypertension

2. Lupus nephritis

3. Vasculitis

4. Kidney transplantation

5. General medical problem

6. Dialysis – haemodialysis / peritoneal dialysis

7. Glomerulonephritis

8. Chronic kidney disease
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Goh Heong Keong | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed: Dr. Goh has a keen interest in interventional nephrology and kidney transplantation. He is experienced in conducting tunnelled / non-tunnelled catheter insertion, kidney biopsy, ultrasound assessment of native fistula and Tenckoff catheter insertion.

Title: Goh Heong Keong

MetaTitle: Dr. Gopinathan Raju | Pain Management | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
Recommendation:
Dr Gopinathan Raju obtained his MBBS degree from Kasturba Medical College, Mangalore, India. After he completed his postgraduate training in Anaesthesiology from University Malaya, he further subspecialised in the field of Pain Medicine in Australia where he worked at the Professor Tess Cramond Multidisciplinary Pain Centre, Royal Brisbane and Women’s Hospital, Greenslopes Private and Mater Private for 3 years.

Dr Gopi is the first doctor in Malaysia to be awarded the Fellow of the Faculty of Pain Medicine, Australia and New Zealand College of Anaesthetist by training and examination. He also completed the Pain Medicine Fellowship (Interventions) from Axxon Pain Medicine Australia and Certificate of completion for fellowship (sub specialty) training in Pain Management from the Ministry of Health, Malaysia.

He given numerous lectures and conducted pain symposiums both locally and internationally. He has special interest in treating pain of spinal origin utilizing latest interventional pain techniques to help alleviate pain.

Dr Gopi is also the president elect for Malaysia Society of Interventional Pain Practitioners (MSIPP).
ConditionsTreated:
• All types of painful conditions
  • Chronic Headache
  • Face Pain
  • Neck Pain
  • Shoulder Pint Pain
  • Elbow & Wrist Pain
  • Back Pain
  • Chest Wall Pain
  • Buttock Pain
  • Hip Pain
  • Knee Pain
  • Ankle Pain and Muscle Pain
  • Pelvic Pain
  • Groin Pain

Description: Dr. Grace Chan Pui Suan obtained her MBBS degree from King's College London in 2006, and subsequently earned the MRCP UK in 2009 and the Membership of the Royal College of Physicians of the United Kingdom in Gastroenterology in 2010. In addition, she acquired the MRCP Ireland in 2009 and the Certificate of Completion of Specialist Training from the Royal College of Physicians of Ireland in 2018. Dr. Grace Chan Pui Suan is also a certified FESBGH holder since 2019. Her latest academic achievement includes a Postgraduate Certificate in Leadership and Healthcare Management, which she acquired from the Royal College of Surgeons of Ireland in 2021. She is a National Specialist Registered for Internal Medicine (General) - Gastroenterology & Hepatology. Dr. Grace Chan Pui Suan has sub-specialized in Advanced Endoscopy and she has special interest in endoscopy, ERCP, hepatobiliary, pancreatology, IBD, H Pylori, Oesophageal disorders, and malabsorption. Prior joining GHKL, Dr. Grace Chan Pui Suan held the position of Consultant Gastroenterologist and Hepatopancreaticobiliary Lead at St. Mark's Hospital in London, where she also served as the Education Lead. Additionally, she served as the Educational Lead in Gastroenterology at London Northwest Hospital Trust and as an Honorary Consultant at Imperial College Healthcare Trust in London.

MetaTitle: Mr. Hafiz I. A. Law | Cardiothoracic Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Hafiz Law graduated with a medical degree from the University of Malaya and obtained his post-graduate Fellowship from the Royal College of Surgeons of Edinburgh, United Kingdom.

Mr. Hafiz Law was formerly Consultant Cardiothoracic Surgeon at the National Heart Institute (IJN) in Kuala Lumpur. He worked at the Birmingham Children Hospital in the United Kingdom and was trained by world-renown surgeons. He is active in the Malaysian Association of Thoracic & Cardiovascular Surgery (MATCVS) and had the privilege of serving as the Honorary Secretary.

Mr. Hafiz Law was the president and a life member of the Penang Medical Practitioners Society (PMPS), is a life member of Malaysian Medical Association (MMA), the College of Surgeons of Malaysia and Academy of Medicine of Malaysia.

MetaTitle: Dr. Harjit Kaur | Breast Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Breast Care Centre, 1st Floor, Block B
Recommendation:
Dr. Harjit Kaur is a consultant Breast & Endocrine Surgeon currently practicing at Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur.

 

She got her Masters in Surgery from UKM and went on to obtain her full fellowship from the Royal College of Suregons in Ireland. She worked at Putrajaya Hospital and did a full breast fellowship at the Royal Perth Hospital Australian in 2005 and was subsequently gazetted as a Consultant Breast& Endocrine Surgeon by the Director General of Health, Malaysia. She was also appointed to the Academy of Medicine of Malaysia.

 

She is a member of the College of Surgeons Malaysia, The Asian Association of Endocrine Surgeons and the International Surgical Society. She has published and presented many papers in peer reviewed journals both local and international and has written numerous articles in local newspapers and magazines. She has also presented many papers at international conferences and have received awards for some. She is the past vice president of the Breast Chapter of the College of Surgeons of Malaysia.

 

Dr. Harjit's main interest is the management of breast diseases in particular breast cancer. She is trained in oncoplastic breast surgery and performs breast reconstruction both immediate and delayed. She also has a keen interest int he management of thyroid and parathyroid disease.
ConditionsTreated:
Breast disease including Breast Cancers

Thyroid disease and Cancers

MetaTitle: Dr. Hazlita Dato' Mohd Isa | Ophthalmology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Eye Specialist Clinic, Ground Floor  Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dr. Hazlita Dato’ Mohd. Isa is a Consultant Ophthalmologist at Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur. She sub-specialises in Medical Retina (diabetic eye diseases, age related macular degenerations, retina vascular occlusion, etc) and Uveitis (ocular inflammation) as well as manages general eye problems such as cataracts, glaucoma, dry eyes, contact lens related eye diseases, lid lesions, refractive errors etc.

Dr. Hazlita graduated medicine (MBChB) from the University of Glasgow, Scotland, UK and subsequently obtained a Doctorate of Ophthalmology (DrOph) at University Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM), Malaysia. Thereafter she completed a PhD in Ophthalmology at the University College London (UCL), UK as well as a fellowship in Uveitis and Medical Retina at the prestigious Moorfields Eye Hospital, London, UK. Dr. Hazlita is also a member of the Academy of Medicine of Malaysia (AM Mal) and has been listed on the Malaysia Nasional Specialist Register (Ophthalmology) since 2013. She is certified as a Uveitis and Medical Retina sub-specialist by the Malaysian Ministry of Health.

Previously an Associate Professor and Consultant Ophthalmologist at the UKM Medical Centre (UKMMC), Kuala Lumpur and Head of the Uveitis and Medical retina unit in the Ophthalmology Department UKMMC, Dr. Hazlita has taught and mentored medical students and many young ophthalmologists who are now currently serving the nation. Dr. Hazlita is also regularly invited as a speaker at various international and local ophthalmology conferences and has also published numerous articles in both local and international journals. Apart from her deep passion in eye and patient care, Dr. Hazlita is also an ardent advocator for Autism awareness.
ConditionsTreated: Cataract, Pterygium, Diabetic Eye diseases, Diabetic macular oedema, Diabetic retinoptahy, Hypertensive retina diseases, Age macular degeneration, Polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy, Central serous chorioretinopathy, Retina artery and vein occlusion, various eye infection, Infective and non-infective uveitis and ocular inflammation, TB related eye diseases, HIV related eye diseases, Syphillis related eye diseases, Scleritis and Episcleritis, Optic neuritis, Hereditary retina and macular dystrophies, Minor lid lesions (chalazions and stye) and infection (blepharitis), Dry eyes, minor cornea infection, minor contact lens related eye diseases, glaucoma (non surgical).

General eye screening (children and adults), Diabetic Eye Screenings, Age Macular Diseases Screening, Glaucoma screenings, Systemic and Medical Related Eye Disease screenings

MetaTitle: Dr. Hoe Chee Hoong | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Hoe graduated from University of Science Malaysian in 2001. He obtained membership from Royal Colleges of Physicians United Kingdom in 2007 and further pursued fellowship training in Gastroenterology at Hospital Sultanah Bahiyah, Alor Setar and Hospital Selayang.

After completing his fellowship training in 2014, Dr. Hoe subsequently served as a Consultant Gastroenterologist at Hospital Pulau Pinang where he headed the Gastroenterology unit. He is a member of the Gastroenterology Fellowship Training Programme by the Ministry of Health and a trainer for new Gastroenterology trainees.

Dr. Hoe has been active in research and has published research papers in peer-reviewed journals and gave many presentations at national Gastroenterology conferences. He is also an honorary lecturer for Royal College of Surgeons Ireland & University College Dublin Malaysia Campus.

MetaTitle: Dr. Hon Sook Kit | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
Dr Hon graduated from University Putra Malaysia with the MMA gold medal award. She received her early O&G training in Hospital Kuala Lumpur before moving on to the National University Hospital (Singapore). She became a member of the Royal College of Obstetrician and Gynaecologists (MRCOG), UK in 2007. She obtained Advanced Ultrasound Training in in Kings College Hospital and University Hospital Bristol, UK and has worked in the UK before returning to Malaysia.

Dr Hon’s main field of interest is in Fetal Medicine and Infertility (including IVF). Dr Hon also offers a good range of gynecological treatment including advanced laparoscopic surgeries, urinary incontinence surgeries (such as tension free vaginal tapes) and vaginal repair surgeries for prolapsed. Dr Hon is one of the few female gynecologist in Malaysia who offers IVF treatment to help couples to fulfill their dream of parenthood.

MetaTitle: Mr. Jagdish Krishnan | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
SpecialInterest: Shoulder / knee arthroscopy and knee preservation surgery
Recommendation:
Mr. Jagdish was born in Penang. He did his secondary school education in Ibrahim Secondary School. He graduated with his M.B.B.S from M.S Ramaiah Medical College, Bangalore, India in 2002.

He was posted as a House Officer to Alor Setar General Hospital and subsequently served as an Orthopaedic Medical Officer in Hospital Sungai Petani, Penang General Hospital, Kota Bharu Hospital and Hospital Universiti Sains Malaysia.

He completed his Masters in Orthopaedics in 2014 and completed his fellowship in Shoulder and Knee Arthroscopy in 2018; under the tutelage of Prof. Kim Jae Hwa, CHA Bundang Hospital, South Korea.

Previously, he headed the sports and arthroscopy unit in Penang General Hospital. He is also well versed with all types of orthopaedic trauma surgeries and knee preservation surgeries.

MetaTitle: Mr. Jasjit Singh | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Jasjit is a Penang native. He attended his early and high school education at St. Xavier’s Institution Penang, before graduating with his M.D. from Universiti Sains Malaysia in 2003.

He was posted as a House Officer to Hospital Alor Setar and subsequently served in Hospital Jitra as a Medical Officer. It was during this tenure that his interest in Surgery surfaced and after completion of his compulsory district service, he managed to get placed in the prestigious Department of Surgery in Hospital Alor Setar.

He completed his membership to the Royal College of Surgeons and joined the Masters of Surgery Programme of Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia in 2008. In his training, Mr. Jasjit served in many tertiary training centres; Hospital Sultanah Bahiyah, Hospital Pulau Pinang, Hospital Kuala Lumpur and Pusat Perubatan Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia.

In 2012, he was appointed as General Surgeon in Hospital Pulau Pinang. Apart from clinical duties as a General Surgeon and Surgeon in Charge of the Paediatric Surgery Unit, he served in many capacities; House Officer Training Coordinator for the Department of Surgery, Deputy Chairperson of the Pain-Free Committee of Hospital Pulau Pinang and as Honorary lecturer of the Penang Medical College. He was also the Deputy Chairman of 2014 Penang Interdisciplinary Surgical Symposium.

In 2015, Mr. Jasjit enrolled in the Hepatobiliary surgery and Liver Transplant Fellowship Programme of the Ministry of Health Malaysia. His training involved placements in Hospital Sultanah Bahiyah Alor Setar, Hospital Selayang as well as the internationally recognized Liver Institute of Kings College London.
OpenGraphTitle: Mr. Jasjit Singh | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
QualificationAndCertifications: M.D. (USM), IMRCS (IRE), M.MED General Surgery (UKM), Dip.in Laparoscopic Surgery (Strasbourg), Fellowship in Hepatobiliary Surgery (Malaysia)
Title: Jasjit Singh

MetaTitle: Dr. Jason Chin Kuet Tze | Gastroenterology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 306, 3rd Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dr Jason Chin qualified from Liverpool Medical School in 1985. He completed his MRCP in 1988, and started subspecialty training in Gastroenterology and Hepatology in North West London.  He worked in Professor Roy Pounder’s Gastroenterology Unit, and later, in the Liver Unit with Dame Sheila Sherlock, and Professor Andrew Burroughs. Following his Registrar rotation, Jason was a Research Fellow under Professor Burroughs, during this time published several papers in peer reviewed journals. He returned to Malaysia in 1993 as a Clinical Specialist in the Department of Medicine, Hospital Kuala Lumpur.

In 1996 Jason left Hospital Kuala Lumpur to start a partnership with Dr Anand Bhupalan as gastroenterologist and hepatologist in Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur. The partnership has since grown to 4 (with Dr Ryan Ponnudurai and Dr Mandeep Singh joining the practice).

Since coming back from the United Kingdom in 1993, Jason has been heavily involved with professional socities. He was the Secretary of the Malaysian Society of Gastroenterology and Hepatology from 1995 to 1998, before becoming the President of the said Society in 2002. Jason was one of the founding members of the Malaysian Liver Foundation, which was registered in 1995. He was the first secretary of the Foundation, and later became a committee member until 2001.

Over the years, he had been involved with organising international meetings, including the bi-annual International Liver Updates, the annual GUT meetings, and International H pylori meetings.

He was also in the expert panel of various guidelines:

1. The 1st Asia - Pacific Consensus Statement on management of Chronic Hepatitis B (1995)

2. Clinical Practice Guidelines on management of Variceal Bleeding in Malaysia (2004)

3. Recommendation for sedation and analgesia by non-anaesthesiologists (2013)

MetaTitle: Dr. Jayendran Dharmaratnam | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation:
Dr Jayendran is a Malaysian doctor practicing as a Consultant Clinical Oncologist (Radiotherapy/Medical Oncology). He completed his MBBS at the University of Mysore (Kasturba Medical College) in India in 1979. After a period of in-service training in the Institute of Radiotherapy & Oncology, Hospital Kuala Lumpur, he subsequently went on to do his postgraduate training in United Kingdom. In 1993, he received the Diploma in Radiotherapy/Oncology (DMRT) from Royal College of Radiologists, London (Clinical Oncology/Radiotherapy), and in 1994 the Fellowship from the Faculty of Radiologists, Royal College of Surgeons of Ireland (FFR.RCSI in Clinical Oncology). He chose to actively pursue his interests in Sports Medicine and received a Diploma in Sports Medicine from Edith Cowan University, Perth in 1998.

During his 30 years as a doctor in the government service, he has served in three government ministries (Health, Education and Defense) in various capacities. Since the beginning of 2010, he has been in private practice.

MetaTitle: Prof. Dr. John Tharakan. K.J | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
Prof John Tharakan graduated his basic medical degree from University of Kerala India with FIRST RANK and GOLD MEDAL in the year 1974 . He completed his Master’s Degree in Internal Medicine also from the same university in the year 1978 and went on to do his Neurology training at All India Institute of Medical Sciences New Delhi- India’s premier National Medical Institute . He was awarded Doctor of Medicine – Neurology in 1981.

Prof John’s professional career started as a Lecturer in Neurology at the then newly started Sri Chitra Tirunal Institute – Trivandrum and he played a key role in developing this new institution into an Internationally renowned Institute for Neurosciences. He was awarded the prestigious COMMONWEALTH MEDICAL FELLOWSHIP IN 1987 and had further training in Neuroimmunology at world famous Guy’s Hospital London. He was elected as a FELLOW of American Academy of Neurology in 1998 and a Fellow of Royal College of Physicians of Ireland in 2002. In the year 2009 he was enrolled in the National Specialist Registry -Malaysia as a NEUROLOGIST. He was awarded the “ANUGERAH PERKIDMATAN CEMERLANG” by USM in the year 2004

Prof Dr John Tharakan spend his entire professional career spanning 40 years at various academic institutions- 14 years at Sri Chitra Tirunal Institute India, 11 years at Sultan Qaboos University Oman and the last 15 years at University Sains Malaysia. He has extensive experience in critical care neurology, stroke, movement disorders, epilepsy, neuromuscular disorders, and various neurodegenerative disorders. He is also highly experienced in clinical neurophysiological procedures like EEG,EMG and Nerve conduction studies. He was instrumental in establishing Epilepsy surgery and Deep Brain Stimulation procedures at USM Kelantan.

MetaTitle: Mr. K. Parameshwaran | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Parameshwaran had his medical education at University of Malaya. After graduation, he worked as a Medical Officer in the field of Orthopaedic Surgery for 8 years. In 1990, he returned to University of Malaya to continue his postgraduate education in Orthopaedic Surgery.

In 1993, Mr. Parameshwaran obtained his Masters Degree in Orthopaedic Surgery. He was then posted as the State Consultant Orthopaedic Surgeon at Malacca General Hospital. In 1998, he went for his one-year fellowship attachment in spinal surgery at Edinburgh, Scotland. Upon returning, he started his private practice at Gleneagles Penang as a Consultant Orthopaedic Surgeon (with special interest in spinal surgery). He is the first spinal surgeon in private practice in Penang. For over 20 years, he has been doing a wide scope of spinal surgeries of cervical, thoracic and lumbar spine. Besides spine surgery, he also does arthroplasty of hip and knee, and trauma surgery with special interest in pelvic fractures and fixation.

Mr. Parameshwaran is married with two children. In his spare time, he is involved in social and welfare activities.

MetaTitle: Mr. K. Ravindran Katheerayson | Neurosurgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Ravi graduated from University Science Malaysia (USM) in 1990 and obtained his postgraduate specialist qualification as a general surgeon from the Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland in 1999. He was attached to the government service for 18 years, including 2 years in the Armed Forces. He then received his general surgical and subspecialty training in various departments (General Surgery, Orthopaedics, Plastic Surgery, Breast & Endocrine and Vascular besides Neurosurgery) in Hospital Ipoh and Hospital Kuala Lumpur. He worked in Neurosurgery for about a year from 1997 to 1998 and decided to pursue Neurosurgery after his fellowship.

Mr. Ravi was gazetted a Neurosurgeon after 3 years of subspecialty training that included his one year of Clinical Fellowship at the Southern General Hospital in Glasgow, which is recognised as the birthplace of the Glasgow Coma Scale. His last posting was as the Head of Department of Hospital Pulau Pinang (formerly Penang General Hospital) where he served from 2004 until 2008. He managed to set up the first ‘Neurosurgical ICU’ that is independent from the General ICU, outside of Kuala Lumpur in 2006. The Neurosurgical ICU is 5-bedded and is still operating today.

During his training in Glasgow, Mr. Ravi was trained in the field of mainly spinal and vascular neurosurgery. While he was in Penang, he completed his training in the field of Radiosurgery in Berlin and was then actively performing Stereotactic Radio Surgery (SRS) and Stereotactic Radio Therapy (SRT) for patients with brain tumours at Mount Miriam Hospital. He continues his service, which is now available at Gleneagles Penang.

MetaTitle: Dr. Khamini Ramanujam | Paediatrics | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Khamini obtained her MBBS degree from Manipal Academy of Higher Education, India and pursued her interest in paediatrics, having attained her Membership of the Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health, United Kingdom.

Having served for many years in the Paediatric Departments of Hospital Sultan Abdul Halim, Sungai Petani and Penang General Hospital, Dr. Khamini has vast experience in treating diverse paediatric conditions involving premature babies, neonates and adolescents.

Dr. Khamini is a certified instructor for Neonatal Resuscitation Programme (NRP) and a provider for Advanced Paediatrics Life Support (APLS). Her services were recognised and she was twice awarded the ‘Excellence Service Award’ by the Ministry of Health, Malaysia, in 2013 and in 2017.

Dr. Khamini has been actively involved in teaching and training both undergraduates and postgraduates in Paediatrics. She is also a life member of both the Malaysian Paediatrics Association and the Malaysian Medical Association.

Dr. Khamini likes to unwind by listening to music, reading and spending quality time with family.
ConditionsTreated: Dr. Khamini treats various childhood diseases, assess growth and development, and administers vaccinations.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Khamini Ramanujam | Paediatrics | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Title: Khamini Ramanujam

MetaTitle: Dr. Khoo Eng Hooi | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Khoo earned his degree in Medicine at National University of Malaysia (UKM) in 1999 and later obtained his Master's degree in Orthopaedic Surgery at University Malaya in 200g. He was then posted to Penang General Hospital. He then pursued advanced orthopaedic trauma and completed his AO Fellowship at Geneva University Hospital, Switzerland in 2009.

At the time, there was a shortage of spine surgeons in Penang Hospital that propelled Dr. Khoo’s determination to take up the challenge to train as one. He completed the 3-year Subspecialty Training Programme under the Ministry of Health, where he was a fellow in various distinguished spine centres, notably Sarawak General Hospital, University Hospital of Basel, Switzerland and Schoen Klinikum in Munich, Germany. He also pursued a travelling fellowship under the Asia Pacific Spine Society at renown spine centre in Bangkok and Singapore.

Upon returning from his training Dr. Khoo led the Spine Unit in Penang General Hospital. This gave him the opportunity to treat a vast variety of spinal disorders from the commonest spinal trauma to the complex spinal deformity corrective surgeries. His role as a senior orthopaedic surgeon at Penang General Hospital has helped him forge a strong base in complex trauma surgery as well as various orthopaedic surgeries.

Since joining Gleneagles Penang in 2016, Dr. Khoo has pursued special interest in minimal invasive spinal surgery (MISS) and endoscopic spine surgery. He attended attachments at Wooridul Spine Hospital and Teun Tuen Hospital in South Korea to learn directly from the experts in the field.
ConditionsTreated:
Spine:

Spine Trauma/Fracture

Spine Deformity Eg.  Adolescent Idiopathic Scoliosis

Spinal Stenosis (Bone spur) - radiculopathy (Sciatica) and myelopathy

Degenerative Disc Disease i.e. Prolapsed Intervertebral Disc (Disc Herniation)

Spinal Tumour/ Metastases

Spine Infection, eg TB spine

Osteoporosis Vertebral Compression Fracture (OVCF)

 

General orthopaedic conditions:

Trauma and Fractures

Osteoarthritis

Osteoporosis Fractures

MetaTitle: Mr. Kirubakaran A/L Malapan | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Kirubakaran graduated with M.B.B.S. from Manipal Academy of Higher Education, India in 2000. His dream to pursue surgery brought him to University Sains Malaysia (USM) where he graduated with a Master in General Surgery in 2008. He then joined subspecialty training and completed his Fellowship in Bariatric & Metabolic Surgery from Taiwan in 2013 and Fellowship in Breast & Endocrine Surgery from Malaysia in 2014. His passion in clinical nutrition drove him to pursue the European ESPEN Diploma in Clinical Nutrition & Metabolism, which he completed in 2018.

Mr. Kirubakaran developed the Breast & Endocrine (B&E) Surgery Unit and Bariatric & Metabolic Surgery Services in Ipoh after he was posted there in 2014. He was instrumental in forming the HRPB Bariatric Support Group and served as its advisor. He has served with the Ministry of Health Malaysia (MOH) for almost 20 years at various hospitals including Hospital Raja Permaisuri Bainun (HRPB, Ipoh), Taiping Hospital, Hospital Raja Perempuan Zainab II (HRPZ II, Kota Bharu), Hospital Kuala Lumpur and Hospital Putrajaya and is the proud recipient of the Excellence in Service Awards in 2002, 2008 and 2015.

Mr. Kirubakaran has held various positions including Chairman of Malaysian Medical Association (Perak Branch) from 2017-2019 and Chairman of Special Area of Interest: Bariatric & Metabolic Surgery for MOH. He has also contributed to the field of academics as an Adjunct University Lecturer and has published numerous scientific publications in peer-reviewed journals as well as presentations in local and international meetings.
OpenGraphTitle: Mr. Kirubakaran A/L Malapan | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
QualificationAndCertifications:
MBBS (India), M.Med Surgery (Malaysia)
Fellowship in Breast & Endocrine Surgery (Malaysia)
Fellowship in Bariatric & Metabolic Surgery (Taiwan)
ProceduresPerformed:
Besides performing open & laparoscopic general surgical procedures, upper & lower gastrointestinal (GI) diagnostic and therapeutic endoscopy, Mr. Kirubakaran performs breast surgery including breast conserving surgery and Vacuum-assisted Breast (VAB) biopsy. He also performs endocrine surgeries related to the thyroid gland, parathyroid glands and adrenal glands, both open and via minimally-invasive approach.

 Mr. Kirubakaran has a special interest in managing people with obesity and weight-related issues. He performs endoscopic balloon insertion and various laparoscopic bariatric and metabolic surgeries.
Title: Kirubakaran A/L Malapan

MetaTitle: Dr. Kok Lai Sun | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Kok graduated from University of Malaya and obtained her postgraduate specialist qualifications as an internal medicine specialist from the Royal College of Physician of United Kingdom and National University of Singapore. She was later elected as a Fellow of the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh.

Dr. Kok did her internship and medical training at Hospital Kuala Lumpur. Her postgraduate subspecialty training in Nephrology was attained at Hospital Pulau Pinang and Hospital Kuala Lumpur.  She is actively involved in conducting Chronic Kidney Disease – CPG training courses for doctors and paramedics to promote the prevention and care of chronic kidney disease.

Apart from clinical work, Dr. Kok has performed clinical research and has presented at international and local meetings. She was awarded first prize at the Malaysian Transplant Society Meeting 2012 for her oral presentation on ‘Urinary Tract Infection in Renal Transplant Patients’. She has also published journals and abstracts in international nephrology journals. She was the author for the 21st Malaysian Dialysis and Transplant Report 2012 – Chronic Kidney Disease, Mineral and Bone Disorder Chapter, and the 5th Malaysian Renal Report 2011 and 2012 Secondary Glomerulonephritis Chapter.
ConditionsTreated: Dr. Kok is experienced in general nephrology, critical care nephrology, haemodialysis, peritoneal dialysis, interventional nephrology and renal transplant. Her expertise focuses on slowing the progression of chronic kidney disease with evidence-based medical and dietary intervention. Her other keen interest is in the care of Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) patients with kidney disease.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Kok Lai Sun | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed: Dr. Kok is specialised in renal biopsy, ultrasound surveillance of arteriovenous fistula, ultrasound-guided insertion of dialysis catheter and peritoneoscopic Tenchkoff catheter insertion.
LanguageSpoken: English, Bahasa Melayu, Mandarin, Bahasa Indonesia, Hokkien, Cantonese, Hakka

He has special interest in dialysis, kidney transplantation, prevention of kidney diseases, diabetic kidney disease and hypertension

MetaTitle: Dr. Lee Wei Ching | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Lee graduated with M.B.B.S. in 2000 from The University of The West Indies, Trinidad and Tobago and subsequently underwent housemanship training at Seberang Jaya Hospital. After housemanship, she continued to serve as medical officer in the same hospital for 3 years, mainly in medical and general surgery departments before being transferred to Bukit Mertajam Hospital. Besides working as a surgical medical officer, she was also in charge of the palliative care unit in the hospital.

Dr. Lee started her formal training in clinical oncology in 2007. In the course of her training, she has worked in University Malaya Medical Centre, University Kebangsaan Malaysia Medical Centre and Hospital Kuala Lumpur. She was awarded Master’s in Clinical Oncology by University Malaya in 2011, gazetted as Consultant Oncologist and Radiotherapist in December 2011 and formally registered in National Specialist Register in Clinical Oncology in 2014.

Dr. Lee worked as a Consultant Oncologist and Radiotherapist at Hospital Pulau Pinang since 2012, before joining Gleneagles Penang. She also serves as a Honorary Lecturer for School of Pharmacy, University Sains Malaysia and as a Visiting Oncologist at various hospitals of Ministry of Health in the Northern Region. She has major contribution in oncology services in the Northern Region of Malaysia
ConditionsTreated: Dr. Lee has vast experience in the non-surgical aspect of managing cancer patients in the field of radiotherapy and chemotherapy for various tumour sites in the human body.

MetaTitle: Dr. Leong Kin Wah | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Leong, a Penangite, graduated from the University of Malaya in 1988 and obtained his postgraduate specialist qualifications (MRCP) from United Kingdom in 1991. He was then appointed as a Lecturer in General Medicine and Haematology in the Faculty of Medicine, University of Malaya. Dr. Leong continued his training in the U.K. and Australia. He obtained his Diploma in Haematology in 1997, subsequently became a Fellow of the Royal College of Physicians (Edinburgh) in 1999 and is a member of the American Society of Clinical Oncologists and American Society of Haematology. He is a member of the Malaysian Oncological Society and the Malaysian Society of Haematology.

Dr. Leong joined Gleneagles Penang in 1998 and practises as a Haemato-Oncologist and Physician. He is involved in research work and continues to publish in local and international journals. He is particularly interested in clinical research with new medications, as this may bring tremendous benefits to patients. He pioneered bone marrow / stem cell transplantation at Gleneagles Penang in 2004.

In his spare time, Dr. Leong writes and have written a science and medical-based novel entitled ‘Regenesis: New Beginnings’ on alternative energy and cancer treatment.
ConditionsTreated: Dr. Leong specialises in treating cancers and blood disorders. He has a keen interest in breast cancer, lung cancer, colorectal cancer, lymphomas and leukaemias

Autologous Stem Cell Transplant

Bone marrow examination

MetaTitle: Dr. Leslie Charles Lai Chin Loy | Endocrinology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 709, 7th Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dr Leslie Lai obtained his medical degree from the University of London (United Medical Schools of Guy’s and St. Thomas’ Hospitals) in 1983. He was a Lecturer and Honorary Senior Registrar at St Mary’s Hospital Medical School, Imperial College, University of London from January 1996 till September 1990. He then moved up to Newcastle upon Tyne, UK as a Senior Lecturer and Consultant in Clinical Biochemistry and Metabolic Medicine from October 1990 till December 1996 at Freeman Hospital and the Medical School, University of Newcastle upon Tyne, UK where he was also the Head of Department at Freeman Hospital. He then took up a position as Professor of Clinical Biochemistry and Metabolic Medicine and Deputy Dean for Academic Affairs at the Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences, University Putra Malaysia from January 1997 till August 2001. In September 2001, he joined the International Medical University as Professor of Medicine and Dean of the Postgraduate Medical School and served in this position till February 2004. Dr Leslie Lai has been a Consultant at Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur on a part-time basis from 2001 till February 2004 and commenced fulltime private practice at Gleneagles in March 2004.

Dr Leslie Lai was President of the APFCB from 2010 till 2016 and is the Chair of the IFCC Education and Management Division from 2015 till 2020. He serves on several national and international committees/Task Forces, Editorial Boards of seven scientific journals, either as Associate Editor or member, and has won several awards including Top Young Malaysian for Academic Leadership and Accomplishment in 1999. He was the APFCB Travelling Lecturer on Diabetes and the Metabolic Syndrome for the Asia-Pacific Region from 2006 till 2007 and has been an IFCC Visiting Lecturer to the Philippines on several occasions. He is a member of the Malaysian Endocrine & Metabolic Society, Diabetes Malaysia, Malaysian Medical Association, Malaysian Association of Clinical Biochemists, Society for Endocrinology UK, Association for Clinical Biochemistry and Laboratory Medicine UK, American Association for Clinical Chemistry, Endocrine Society (USA) and the American Association of Clinical Endocrinologists.
ConditionsTreated:
Diabetes

Hypoglycaemia

Thyroid disorders

Adrenal disorders

Pituitary disorders

Calcium disorders

Metabolic bone disease

Hyponatraemia

MetaTitle: Dr. Liau Kui Hin | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation:
Dr Liau Kui Hin is the director & senior consultant surgeon of Nexus Surgical Associates in Mt Elizabeth Hospital and Mt Elizabeth Novena Hospital Singapore. His expertise and specializations include hepatobiliary and pancreatic surgery, laparoscopic and endolaparoscopic surgery, surgical oncology, neuroendocrine oncology, surgical infection and acute surgical care. He also belongs to the teaching faculty with the Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine, National University of Singapore. From 2004 to 2010, Dr Liau was the Chief of Hepatobiliary and Pancreatic Surgery Unit in the Department of General Surgery and concurrently, from 2008 until 2010, the Deputy Head of Department of General Surgery at Tan Tock Seng Hospital. Dr Liau has received numerous accolades in academic, research and service awards. Notably, he was the recipient of consecutive years, 2008- and 2009-Star Excellent Service Awards from SPRING Singapore. The Singapore Public Service Commission also honored him in 2009 with the PS21Star Service Award in healthcare service sector. Dr Liau has authored more than 40 articles in local and international journals. Dr Liau served in the council of the College of Surgeons of Singapore, Academy of Medicine from 2010 to 2014 and the council of the Asian-Pacific Hepato-Pancreato-Biliary Association from 2004-2009.

He is one of the founders of Hepato-Pancreato-Biliary Association of Singapore. In addition, he is the secretary of the Carcinoid & Neuroendocrine Tumour Society of Singapore and member of the European Neuroendocrine Tumour Society and International Neuroendocrine Cancers Alliance. His other contribution is the formation of the new International Surgical Infection Society known as Oasis Global.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Liau Kui Hin | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu

MetaTitle: Dato' Dr. Lim Lay Hooi | Plastic Reconstructive Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dato’ Dr. Lim received her MBBS from the University of Malaya, Kuala Lumpur in 1984 and proceeded to train in general surgery in Malaysia, before qualifying as a general surgeon upon passing her FRCS examinations in Edinburgh in 1988. She went on to complete her training in Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery in Adelaide and Sydney, Australia. In 1993, she passed the exit examinations in Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery of the Royal Australasian College of Surgeons.

Subsequently, after working as a locum Consultant Plastic Surgeon in the United Kingdom, Dr. Lim returned to Penang, Malaysia, to serve the Ministry of Health as the first Resident Plastic Surgeon at Penang General Hospital, establishing the Department of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery from scratch in 1995. She is currently the Head of Department and for nine years (2005-2014) also served as the National Head for Plastic Surgical Services within the Malaysian Ministry of Health, having trained several plastic surgeons, many of whom now independently head plastic surgery units in the rest of the country. Aside from training, she is also involved in the maintenance of professional standards and regulation of practice.

Dr. Lim has served as a member of the Plastic Surgery Specialty Subcommittee of the National Specialist Register from its inception in 2005 and continues to do so. From 2004, she was involved as a key member of multiple Ministry committees and task force on the regulation of aesthetic medical practice. Following the formalisation of the practice guidelines in 2013, she also served on the Main Credentialing and Privileging Committee in Aesthetic Medical Practice of the Ministry of Health until 2016.
OpenGraphTitle: Dato' Dr. Lim Lay Hooi | Plastic Reconstructive Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
QualificationAndCertifications: DSPN, DJN, MBBS (Malaya), FRCS (Edinburgh), FRACS (Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery)

MetaTitle: Dr. Lim Wye Keat | Ear, Nose and Throat Surgery (ENT) | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 601, 6th Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
In the arena of otolaryngology I consider myself a general otolaryngologist with a strong interest in the subspecialty of Paediatric Otolaryngology.  As far as I know I am the only Malaysian to have gone overseas to work in a paid job in a paediatric otolaryngology unit for hands on experience, not in a mere “observer attachment” capacity.

The outstanding part of my experience in Universtiy Malaya Medical Centre over four years was the development of expertise in the paediatric airway.  I worked very closely with the Paediatricians of University Malaya Medical Centre, in particular the Paediatric Intensive Care Unit and Respiratory Paediatric Medicine.  I also work closely with Paediatricians involved in Gastroenterology and children with voice problems and delayed development.

Academic experience

I was in Universtiy Malaya for four years from 2003 to 2007 as a senior lecturer, teaching undergraduate and postgraduate students.  I was involved in some minor innovations in methods of teaching and assessment/evaluation.

Since then, I have been invited for the last three years to teach undergraduates at Monash University Malaysia and at Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia for their Masters in Family Medicine.
ConditionsTreated: All general ENT and Paediatric ENT conditions treated.

MetaTitle: Dr. Loo Kwong Sheng | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
Dr. Loo Kwong Sheng is a Consultant Obstetrician, Gynaecologist and Gyanae-Oncologist at Gleaneagles Medini Hospital.
He obtained his Medical Doctor Degree from University Sains Malaysia (USM) in 2005 with a
Dean List honours and Membership of Royal College of Obstetrician & Gynaecologist in 2012.

He worked as a medical officer in the Department of Obstetric & Gynaecology from 2006 to 2011 in Sabah and served as
clinical specialist from 2012 to 2015 in Johor. Further on he underwent sub-speciality training in
Gynaecological Oncology under Ministry of Health Malaysia in 2016. He also
completed a year of gynaecological oncology clinical fellowship training in KK Woman's & Children's Hospital Singapore in 2018.
His area of interest includes minimal invasive surgery (laparoscopic surgery) and complex gyanaecological cancer surgery.

</style>
Dr Lua was born in Kota Bharu, Kelantan in 1980. He obtained his Bachelor of Medicine degree (MBBS) at University of Malaya in 2005 and subsequently served in both urban and rural areas of Sabah under Ministry of Health (MOH) Malaysia. After gaining his Membership of the Royal Colleges of Physicians of the United Kingdom (MRCP, London), he joined the MOH fellowship programme in gastroenterology and hepatology at Hospital Queen Elizabeth, Sabah. During his final year of fellowship training, he pursued further advance endoscopy training at Second Military Medical University (SMMU) of Chang Hai Hospital, Shanghai, China. The renowned endoscopy centre is accredited as one of the Asian Pacific Society Training Centre for Digestive Endoscopy.
ConditionsTreated:
Gastroenterological disorders

Hepatological disorders                       
Stomach disease

ProceduresPerformed:
Gastrointestinal and Hepatology procedures:

1. OGDS (Esophagogastroduodenoscopy) and Colonoscopy, including removal of polyps, detection of early gastrointestinal cancers ,treatment of acute ulcer and non-ulcer bleeding
2. Percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy (PEG) feeding tube placement
3. ERCP (Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiography), including biliary drainage, stone removal and stenting
4. EUS (Endoscopic Ultrasound), including fine needle aspiration, injection and drainage
5. EMR (Endsoscopic Mucosal Resection)

8. Video Capsule Endoscopy for small bowel diagnostic evaluation
9. Enteral dilatation and stenting (including that of oesophagus, stomach, duodenum, colon, biliary tree)
10 .Fibroscan of liver, assessment of liver steastosis and fibrosis
Title: Lua Guan Way

MetaTitle: Dr. M. Amir Shah | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Amir is a Malaysian, a Penangite, and has served the community in the field of Oncology for more than 15 years.

He was a bright student at the Penang Free School and has obtained a scholarship to pursue Medicine at the University of Leicester, United Kingdom. Upon graduation, he returned to Penang, and completed his internship and subsequently served as a medical officer in various departments at the Penang General Hospital, where he found special interest in serving cancer patients. He then worked and pursued Clinical Oncology postgraduate training as a Specialist Registrar at the Christie Hospital in Manchester, United Kingdom, which is one of the largest cancer centres in Europe.

Dr. Amir completed his training in the UK and obtained Clinical Oncology Fellowships from Royal College of Radiologists London and Royal College of Surgeons Ireland.

He then returned to Penang and served as a Consultant Oncologist & Radiotherapist in Mount Miriam Cancer Hospital for 2 years. He joined Loh Guan Lye Specialists Centre as a Consultant Oncologist & Radiotherapist for a further 2 years before joining Gleneagles Penang.
ConditionsTreated: All cancers of the body
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. M. Amir Shah | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed: Dr. Amir has vast experience in the latest Radiotherapy treatment modalities including IMRT, IGRT, SRT, SRS and Brachytherapy. He offers the latest evidence-based targeted therapies and chemotherapies to patients in order to enhance survival and optimise cure.
LanguageSpoken: English, Bahasa Melayu, Hokkien, Bahasa Indonesia, Hindi
Title: M. Amir Shah

MetaTitle: Dr. M. Mahadaven | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 302, 3rd Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dr. Mahadaven Murugiah or  ”Dr. Maha’  as he is popularly called, is a trained General Surgeon with special interest in Hepatobiliary surgery and Keyhole Surgery. He is a pioneer surgeon at Gleneagles KL and has worked here since the hospital’s inception.

 

Dr. Maha’s Surgical training was in Malaysia and in Edinburgh, Scotland. He holds the Fellowship of the Royal College of Surgeons of Edinburgh and was a Commonwealth Scholarship holder for training in Hepatobiliary Surgery at the the Edinburgh Royal Infirmary, Scotland.

 

He initially served in Government Service and the Malaysian Army before joining Gleneagles KL in 1996 as a Resident Surgeon. He has been very active in academic societies and was a Council Member of the College of Surgeons. He is also a member of the Academy of Medicine. During his Government Service he trained doctors to become surgeons and was instrumental in setting up the Surgical Skills Laboratory for Laparoscopic Surgery at the Institute of Medical Research, Kuala Lumpur

 

He has considerable experience in Surgery of the gastrointestinal system and also does surgery of the Thyroid Gland and the Breast. His special interest however, is in Laparoscopic (Keyhole) Surgery and Hepatobiliary Surgery including liver, gall bladder and the pancreas.
ConditionsTreated:
• Gallstones
  • Liver, Bile Duct And Pancreatic Cancers & Infections
  • Breast Diseases
  • Thyroid Disorders
  • Hernia Surgery
  • Stomach and Intestinal Cancers, Haemorrhoids , Fistula & Fissures
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. M. Mahadaven | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
ProceduresPerformed:
• Biliary Surgery including keyhole gallstone surgery
  • Liver and Pancreas Surgery
  • Breast and Thyroid Surgery
  • Colorectal Surgery including surgery for cancer of colon and haemorrhoids
  • Gastric Surgery
  • General Surgery including lumps and skin lesions
Title: M. Mahadaven

MetaTitle: Dr. Manamohan a/l Chandrarajan | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
• Dr. Manamohan obtained his MBBS in Manipal, India in 1996. He became an Associate Fellow of the Royal College of Surgeons, Ireland in 2002, completed the Master in Medicine in Orthopaedic Surgery, from the National University of Singapore in 2004. He then obtained his Master in Surgery (Orthopaedics) from Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia in 2005, and became a Malaysian government, board certified Orthopaedic Surgeon in November 2005.

• He joined Hospital Sultanah Aminah in JB, and did a wide spectrum of General Orthopaedic work, including surgeries in all sub-specialities of Orthopaedics and Trauma surgery. He treated a large number of Paediatric Orthopaedic patients during that time. He also developed a fondness for disorders of the knee, and did a large number of sports related procedures, including knee arthroscopies and knee joint replacement surgeries for knee Osteoarthritis.

• In 2010, Dr. Mohan joined the Ganga Hospital in Coimbatore and trained in Hand & Microsurgery with Dr. Rajasabapathy. He returned to JB to further hone his skills in Hand Surgery, before joining the Hand Surgery Dept in Tan Tock Seng Hospital, Singapore in 2011. He completed his Hand Fellowship in 2012 and returned to Malaysia to start a Hand Surgery service in HSAJB. He then served as a Senior Consultant in HSAJB before leaving in 2015 to join Gleneagles Medini.
ConditionsTreated: Orthopaedic Conditions
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Manamohan a/l Chandrarajan | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
QualificationAndCertifications: MBBS (M'pal), Assoc. FRCS (Ireland), M.Med. Ortho (S'pore), MS. Ortho (M'sia), Fellowship in Hand
ProceduresPerformed:
• Minimally-Invasive Adult and Paediatric Trauma surgery, Complex Trauma and Reconstruction surgeries, Sports surgery, Knee and Shoulder Arthroscopy.
• Hip and Knee joint replacement surgeries
• Paediatric Orthopaedic Surgery.
• Trigger point therapy, facetal and nerve blocks for painful conditions of the spine. Laminectomy and Discectomy surgeries for the spine.
• Hand Surgery- Simple and Complex Trauma. Hand fractures and Reconstruction, including Microsurgery and Soft Tissue cover with Flaps. Excision of Hand Tumours, Ligamentous Reconstruction of the Hand & Wrist, Wrist Arthroscopy, Congenital conditions of the Finger and Hand, including Paediatric Hand reconstruction (Syndactaly, Duplication, Brachydactaly).
• Peripheral nerve surgery including arthroscopic release of Ulnar and Median nerves (carpal tunnel).
• Arthroplasty of the Finger and Wrist joints, including joint replacement.
• Treatment of Degenerative and Painful conditions of the upper limb-Dupuytren's, Trigger finger, DeQuervain's, Tennis & Golfer's Elbow, Rotator cuff tears, etc.
Title: Manamohan a/l Chandrarajan

MetaTitle: Dr. Marzida Binti Abd Latib | Plastic Reconstructive Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Specialist Clinic, 7th Floor, Block B, Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur
Recommendation:
Dr. Marzida obtained her MBBS in 2001 from Universiti Malaya and her Master of Surgery (Plastic Surgery) in 2010 from Universiti Sains Malaysia. She completed her Plastic and Reconstruction Surgeon (gazzettment) in May 2011 at Hospital Kuala Lumpur and continued her career as Plastic and Reconstruction Surgeon at Hospital Kuala Lumpur until end of 2019. Previously, she had teaching experiences at Universiti Sains Malaysia as Honorary Lecturer in Master of Surgery (Plastic Surgery) and Trainer for Advanced Diploma in Perioperative Nursing (Plastic Surgery) at the Ministry of Health Malaysia.

She is currently the treasurer for Malaysian Society of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery (MSPRS). She is also a member of Cleft Lip & Palate Association of Malaysia (CLAPAM) and Oriental Society of Aesthetic Plastic Surgeons (OSAPS).

MetaTitle: Dr. Masjudin bin Tumin | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
Dr Masjudin Tumin passed his MBBS examination from University of Malaya in 1998 and completed one-year housemanship in 1999. He started working as Orthopaedic and Trauma Medical officer at Hospital Sultanah Aminah (HSA) Johor Bahru in 1999. He obtained his Master in Orthopaedic Surgery degree in 2006 from University of Malaya and continued to serve in busy Othopaedic and Trauma Department in HSA.

Dr Masjudin was awarded the Malaysia MOH Arthroplasty fellowship in 2009 to train for 4 years in local as well as oversea arthroplasty centers. During his training Dr. Masjudin did attachment for a year in South Korea at Joint Centre, Chonnam National University Hospital, Gwangju and Joint Centre, Hyundae Hospital, Seoul to further develop his skills in Arthroplasty Surgery and also Hip Joint and Knee Joint Reconstruction Surgery.

Dr Masjudin has keen interest in care of patient with orthopaedic trauma. He was also awarded the AO Trauma fellowship from International AO Foundation in 2013 for training with esteemed Prof Tim Pohlemann, a trauma surgeon and his team of surgeons in Trauma, Hand and Reconstructive Department, Saarland University Hospital, Germany. He is a member of Malaysian Medical Association, Malaysian Orthopaedic Association and International AO Trauma.
ConditionsTreated: Orthopaedic Conditions
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Masjudin bin Tumin | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
QualificationAndCertifications: MBBS (Malaya), MS Orth (Malaya), CMIA (NIOSH), Fellowship in Joint Replacement (South Korea & Malaysia), Fellowship in Hip and Knee Surgery (South Korea), Fellowship in AO Trauma (Surgery)
ProceduresPerformed:
Core Procedures

• Close reduction of fractures and dislocations
• Application of skin and skeletal traction – Steinman pin insertion; cervical tongs and skull traction; halo cervical application; application of POP and other casts.
• Open reduction and internal fixation of fractures of long bones / fractures involving joints
• External fixation or fractures of long bones
• Wound debridement and fixation of open fractures
• Fasciotomy; amputation of mangled limbs; soft tissue reconstruction
• Basic hand and foot trauma surgery
• Pelvic fracture stabilization and fixation – external and internal fixation; clamp stabilization
• Skin harvesting and grafting; bone harvesting and grafting
• Simple local flap surgery to cover defects
• Basic nerve and vascular trauma surgery
General Orthopaedics
• Biopsies
• Incision and drainage of abscess / sequestrectomy of osteomyelitic bones
• Soft tissue release / reconstruction in congenital deformities
• Arthrodesis of joints
• Amputation
• Soft tissue procedures and reconstruction; nerve decompression; tendon surgery
• Joint surgery – Arthrotomy, diagnostic & therapeutic arthroscopy; joint aspiration; core decompression for osteonecrosis
• Basic osteotomy procedures, pinning for SUFE
• Basic bone lengthening & shortening procedures
• Primary Arthroplasty
• Arthroscopy Surgery – menisectomy, removal of loose bodies, debridement of knee, open ACL repair, menisci repair, diagnostic shoulder arthroscopy.
• Excision of long bone or soft tissue tumours with minimal reconstruction.
Title: Masjudin bin Tumin

MetaTitle: Mr. Mohana Rao | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Mohana Rao is one of the pioneer Foot and Ankle surgeons in the country. He is a founding member of the Malaysian Orthopaedic Foot and Ankle Society (MOFAS) as well as a life member of the Indian Orthopaedic Foot and Ankle Society.

Mr. Mohana completed his medical degree in Karachi at Dow Medical College as a JPA scholar. He worked as a medical officer in Kelantan and Sabah. He then ventured into orthopaedics, his passions, and completed the Masters degree at University Science Malaysia (USM) in 2006. Upon completion of his studies, he worked in Penang as an orthopaedic surgeon. He has a special interest in the budding sub-specialty of foot and ankle surgery and attained his training and fellowship in this field in 2009 at the Singapore General Hospital Institute of Higher Learning.

Mr. Mohana successfully set up the Foot and Ankle Unit in Penang Hospital where he pioneered foot and ankle reconstructive surgery.
ConditionsTreated: Mr. Mohana is actively involved in the management of difficult diabetic foot wounds and has worked closely with many medical officers in public health clinics in the state of Penang to help provide better wound management and care.

MetaTitle: Dr. Mohd Roslan Bin Haron (AMN) | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
After his graduation in Clinical Oncology, Dr. Mohd Roslan started his Specialist career at Hospital Kuala Lumpur from 1989 to 2005. Together with his other colleagues, he headed the planning and design of the Institut Kanser Negara at Putrajaya as well as the Pusat Rawatan Oncologi of Hospital Sultan Ismail Johor Bahru, where he became the first Head of Department.

In 2006, he became the National Head of Oncology for the Ministry of Health as well as the State Advisor in Oncology for Johor until his retirement in 2016.

Whilst in Johor, he helped to reorganize the Oncology services by initiating the opening of two Clinical Oncology Units at Hospital Sultanah Nora Ismail at Batu Pahat and Hospital Pakar Sultanah Fatimah at Muar. He is also currently the Head of the Technical Unit of the Tunku Laksamana Johor Cancer Foundation, reaching out to help the less fortunate cancer patients undergo treatment.
ConditionsTreated:
• Breast cancer
• Lung cancer
• Head and neck cancer
• Colon cancer
• Prostate cancer

MetaTitle: Dr. Mohd Shafeeq Hasan | Dental Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 102, 1st Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
• Dr. Shafeeq is a registered specialist in orthodontics in the National Specialist Register and accredited to practice in Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur. He has additional training in orthodontics related to the management of patients with cleft lip and palate as well as patients with dentofacial deformities.
  • Dr. Shafeeq offers a wide range of orthodontic diagnosis and treatment for all ages.  His special focus is on preventive, interceptive orthodontics and conservative or minimalist approach to orthodontic treatment.  He is particularly interested in non-extraction approach to orthodontics and facial soft tissue harmony.
  • He is accredited by Invisalign Australia Pty Ltd to provide treatment with Invisalign. He is also accredited in using Incognito Lingual Aesthetic Appliance and Insignia Custom-Designed Appliance.
  • Dr. Shafeeq has previously served in the Specialty Subcommittee in Orthodontics in the National Credentialing Committee. Furthermore, he has also served as Assistant Secretary and Treasurer for the Malaysian Association of Orthodontist. He is a member of Academy of Medicine of Malaysia, Malaysian Association of Orthodontists, Malaysian Dental Association and Malaysian Private Dental Practitioners Association.
  • Dr. Shafeeq obtained his specialist training in Glasgow Dental Hospital and School and attained his Masters in Medical Science in Orthodontics from the University of Glasgow, Scotland in 1998. He then acquired his Membership in Dentofacial Orthopaedics from The Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Glasgow in 1999. He was then attached to the Oral Orthopaedic Unit, Glasgow Dental Hospital and School. The British Orthodontic Society awarded him a commendation at the Optident Prize 1999 for two most outstanding treated cases as judged by an expert panel.
  • Prior to joining Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur, Dr Shafeeq was attached to the Department of Children’s Dentistry and Orthodontics, Faculty of Dentistry, University of Malaya where he held the position of lecturer and clinician.  He was involved in teaching both undergraduate and postgraduate students. He also conducted research and presented in various dental-related conferences, both as oral and invited speaker.
ConditionsTreated: Crowding of teeth and alignment problems, increased overjet and overbite, reverse overjet, anterior open bite, disorders of teeth eruption and exfoliation, dental and skeletal crossbites and asymmetries, multidisciplinary orthodontics related to dental trauma, unerupted teeth particularly canines, ectopic eruption of teeth, multiple missing and abnormally shaped teeth, infraocclusion, avulsed incisor, thumb sucking habit, cleft lip and palate,  skeletal jaw discrepancies, TMJPDS, obstructive sleep apnea.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Mohd Shafeeq Hasan | Dental Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
ProceduresPerformed: Orthodontic treatment with conventional and self-ligating fixed braces,  Invisalign, removable braces, customized lingual orthodontics and tip-edge braces.  Growth modification with functional orthopaedic braces and headgear, preventive and interceptive orthodontics, exposure and traction of unerupted  teeth, bonded and removable retainers, splinting of teeth following dental trauma, pre-alveolar bone grafting orthodontics in relation to cleft lip and palate,  pre- and post-surgical orthodontics in relation to orthognathic jaw surgery, oral orthopaedics in relation to cleft lip and palate.
Title: Mohd Shafeeq Hasan

MetaTitle: Dr. Muhammad Azrif Bin Ahmad Annuar | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Oncology Centre, Ground Floor, Block A
Recommendation:
Dr Muhammad Azrif graduated from the Royal Free Hospital & University College London School of Medicine, London, UK in 1997. After completing his training in internal medicine and obtaining his MRCP (UK) in 2000, he entered the specialist training programme in Clinical Oncology at the Christie Hospital, Manchester, UK. He became a Fellow of the Royal College of Radiologists (Clinical Oncology) in 2005 and attained his Certificate of Completion of Specialist Training (UK) before admission to the UK General Medical Council Specialist Register in 2006.

He was awarded a one year Clinical Research Fellowship to the Department of Radiation Oncology, University of Toronto, Canada in mid 2006. He returned to Malaysia in 2007 and served at the National University of Malaysia Medical Centre (UKMMC) as a Consultant Clinical Oncologist for 5 years before joining private practice in 2012. He has served on various national oncology committees, published in peer-reviewed journals as well as participated in numerous clinical trials, cancer advisory boards and expert panels.

He is a member of the European Society of Therapeutic Radiation Oncology (ESTRO), European Society of Medical Oncology (ESMO) and has been the honorary President of the Malaysian Oncological Society since 2018.
ConditionsTreated: Adult cancers such as breast, lung, gastrointestinal, head and neck, sarcomas, and urological cancers
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Muhammad Azrif Bin Ahmad Annuar | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
QualificationAndCertifications: MBBs (London), MRCP (UK), FRCR (UK), CCT (UK), Fellowship Radiation Oncology (Toronto)
ProceduresPerformed: Chemotherapy, Immunotherapy, Endocrine therapy, Targeted therapy,  3D conformal radiotherapy, Intensity Modulated Radiotherapy (IMRT), Stereotactic body radiotherapy, Stereotactic radiosurgery (Gammaknife)

Recommendation:
Dr. Kumar obtained his Master’s in Surgery from Osmania University, Hyderabad, India in 1983. He then served in the Middle East, Iran for about 13 years as a Consultant Surgeon/Endoscopist. In December 1995, he joined Ministry of Health, Malaysia and served under MOH until April 2015. He was previously attached with Queen Elizabeth Hospital, Kota Kinabalu and Duchess of Kent Hospital, Sandakan.

Dr Kumar is a life member of the Association of Surgeons of India. He is a fellow of the Royal College of Surgeons of Edinburgh, Glasgow, England and Republic of Ireland. He is also a fellow of American College of Surgeons, a member of American College of Gastro-Enterologists and Independent Medical Examiner.

Dr Kumar is a true general surgeon to the core. He has great interest in Minimal Access Surgery and Endoscopy (advanced). A special interest of him is minimizing minimal access surgery for the next frontier.

MetaTitle: Mr. Nadesh Sithasanan | Paediatric Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Nadesh acquired most of his paediatric surgical training at tertiary centre of excellence overseas. His formative years were at the Royal Hospital for Sick Children, Glasgow, Scotland, where he was exposed to advanced training in all branches of paediatric surgery and paediatric urology, as well as intensive care of surgical neonates. He also spent valuable years in Nottingham, England, and successfully obtained his FRCS (Paediatric Surgery) qualification.

Mr. Nadesh achieved an advanced degree in Paediatric Surgery from the United Kingdom. He is also formally trained in advanced Laparoscopic Surgery, acquiring this experience after spending a year at the Women’s and Children’s Hospital in Adelaide, South Australia.
OpenGraphTitle: Mr. Nadesh Sithasanan | Paediatric Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed:
Apart from performing the entire range of paediatric surgical procedures, Mr. Nadesh also performs advanced laparoscopic gastrointestinal and colorectal procedures, laparoscopic biopsies of tumours and laparoscopic appendicectomies. He is an expert in dealing with intra-abdominal testis laparoscopically. He also has vast experience in dealing with infective conditions of the chest cavity (empyemas) thoracoscopically.

His expertise also extends to paediatric urology for which he has been formally trained overseas and deals extensively with the entire spectrum of this field, e.g. reconstructive procedures for vesico-ureteric reflux, pelvi-ureteric junction , bladder augmentation, obstruction and hypospadias surgery with good results. His skills in endoscopic surgery of the urinary tract is commendable.
Title: Nadesh Sithasanan

MetaTitle: Dr. Nahulan Thevarajah | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation:
Dr. Nahulan Thevarajah is a General Orthopaedic and Trauma surgeon whose expertise is in Foot and Ankle surgery. He obtained his Fellowship in surgery from The Royal College of Surgeon, Edinburgh in 1999 and was gazetted as an Orthopaedic surgeon in 2002. He pursued his interest in Foot and Ankle surgery in Taiwan in 2008, under a Malaysian Government Scholarship. Subsequently, he did a Fellowship in Foot and Ankle Arthroplasty and Arthroscopic surgery in the Republic of Korea.

He was the head of Foot and Ankle Service, Ministry of Health, Malaysia and was responsible for the development of these services in Malaysia as well as the training of Orthopaedic surgeons in Foot and Ankle surgery. He is also a member of Malaysian Orthopaedic Foot and Ankle Society and has given numerous professional and public talks on foot and ankle problem.

Dr. Nahulan is a strong advocate of prevention of loss of lower limb due to complications of diabetic foot and was responsible for setting up the Diabetic Foot Clinic in Queen Elizabeth Hospital, Kota Kinabalu. His present interest is reconstruction of complex foot and ankle trauma and also treatment of sports injuries to the foot and ankle region.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Nahulan Thevarajah | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
QualificationAndCertifications: MBBS (Mangalore), RFCS (Edinburgh), Fellow Foot and Ankle (Kaoshiung, Taiwan), Fellow Foot and Ankle (Gwangju, Rep. of Korea)

MetaTitle: Dr. Neoh Eu Bryan | Anaesthesiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Neoh completed his basic medical degree in Ukraine in 2002. He then returned to Malaysia and commenced his government service at Hospital Alor Setar, Kedah. After undergoing 6 rotations during his housemanship, he joined Anaesthesiology at Hospital Sungai Petani, Kedah as a Medical Officer. Later, he was accepted into the Master programme in Anaesthesiology at Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia in 2007 where he was trained in cardiac anaesthesia, respiratory medicine and others.

In 2011, Dr. Neoh had the privilege as serving as an Anaesthesiologist and Head of Department at Hospital Langkawi, Kedah for a year. Subsequently, he joined Hospital Seberang Jaya, Penang and also provided coverage for Hospital Bukit Mertajam and Hospital Kepala Batas, Penang.

Dr. Neoh has participated in providing Basic Life Support (BLS) and Advanced Life Support (ALS) training. At Hospital Seberang Jaya, he was in charge of Acute Pain Service (APS) for perioperative pain management in the form of patient-controlled analgesia (PCA), epidural and regional nerve blocks, as well as the Tissue-Organ Procurement (TOP) team.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Neoh Eu Bryan | Anaesthesiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed: Dr. Neoh has special interest and has undergone training in ultrasound-guided proceures, which include regional anaesthesia, vascular access and basic level of echocardiography. He is also trained in Target Controlled Infusion (TCI), Total Intravenous Anaesthesia (TIVA) and bronchoscopic procedures that include awake fibreoptic intubation, bronchioalveolar lavage and bedside percutaneous tracheostomy.
Title: Neoh Eu Bryan

MetaTitle: Dr. Neoh Eu Rick | Cardiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Neoh graduated with First Class Honours at Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College, Belgaum, India, in 1998. He obtained his MRCP (UK) in 2003 and Master of Medicine (Internal Medicine) from the National University of Singapore in 2004.

Dr. Neoh started his training in non-invasive Cardiology and Echocardiography in Queen Elizabeth Hospital, Kota Kinabalu in 2004. In 2005, he joined Sultanah Aminah Hospital, Johor Bahru, where he commenced his training in Invasive Cardiology. He obtained Fellowship in Interventional Cardiology at Institute Jantung Negara (IJN) in 2007.

He Is also fully trained in Cardiac CT (Computed Tomography) with a Level 3 expertise. He also performs cardiac CT coronary angiography for coronary stents and coronary bypass graft studies

MetaTitle: Dr. Ng Jit Beng | Cardiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr.Ng graduated with M.B.B.S. from University College London, UK, in 2006. He completed his House Officer and Medical Officer training in Medicine in Glasgow, UK and Singapore. Due to his interest in the field of General Medicine and Cardiology, he pursued his Membership of the Royal Colleges of Physicians UK under the Royal College of Physicians, United Kingdom. He obtained his M.R.C.P. in 2011.

Dr. Ng completed his training in Cardiology in Singapore and Malaysia. Upon completed specialist training in Cardiology in 2016, he completed a fellowship in Electrophysiology and Pacing at the National Heart Centre Singapore in 2018. He also obtained certification by the International Board of Heart Rhythm Examiners (IBHRE) as a Certified Electrophysiology Specialist – Adult (CEPS-A) in 2018.

In addition to his work as a Cardiologist, Dr. Ng is also passionate about teaching and educating medical students, and has served as Lecturer and later Senior Lecturer at Penang Medical College (now Royal College of Surgeons Ireland and University College Dublin Malaysia Campus) since 2013.

MetaTitle: Dr. Ng Sui Yin | Paediatrics | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 116, 1st Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
Dr Ng Sui Yin graduated from University of Bristol, UK in 1994. She was trained in both Paediatrics and Paediatrics Neurology in UK. Her UK Paediatric Neurology subspecialty training in London included working in tertiary Neurology Units at Royal London Hospital, Great Ormond Street Hospital and Hammersmith Hospital. She returned to Malaysia in the year 2000 and was a lecturer in Paediatrics/Paediatric Neurology in Universiti Putra Malaysia and was providing clinical services in Hospital Kuala Lumpur. She was also a Visiting Paediatric Neurologist to Selayang Hospital appointed by MOH. In 2004 she did an Epilepsy Fellowship in the world renowned Epilepsy unit in The Hospital for Sick Children, Toronto, Canada. 

Dr Ng has been working as Consultant Paediatrics and Paediatric Neurologist in Gleneagles Hospital since 2005. For the last 10 years, she also developed a special interest in Biomedical Interventions for autism. With a deep conviction that autism isn't just a developmental and behavioral disorder but underlying gut, metabolic and immunological disturbance, she has attended many conferences/ seminar/training programs to equip herself to help this group of children.

Dr Ng is currently in the credentialing committee for Paediatric Neurologists in Malaysia under the National Specialist Register. She served as the National Delegate for Malaysia in the Asian Oceana Child Neurology Assoication form 2002-2007. She had also been the Secretary and Committee member in the past of the Chapter of Child Neurology and Developmental Paediatrics, under the umbrella of the Malaysian Society of Neurosciences and remains active in the Chapter now.

Biomedical approach to autism

MetaTitle: Dr. Nick Chong Chung King | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Specialist Clinics, 6th Floor, Block B (New Block)
Recommendation:
Dr Nick Chong completed my undergraduate medical training at the University College London and The Royal Free Hospital in 1999, gained full registration with the General Medical Council UK after my housemanship. He continued to train in General Internal Medicine in teaching and district general hospitals around London, United Kingdom between 2000 and 2004.

Dr Nick Chong obtained his  postgraduate certification in General Internal Medicine from the Royal College of Physicians of London in 2004. After which, he  gained entry into specialist training in Internal Medicine as Specialist Registrar at St Mary’s Hospital Imperial College London, The Royal Free Hospital London and East Surrey Hospital. It was during that time he discovered my special interest in cancer pain and symptom management. Upon completing my postgraduate training in Internal Medicine, he proceeded to subspecialty training in Palliative Medicine in internationally renowned cancer centres, The Royal Marsden Hospital London and Mount Vernon Cancer Centre in Northwood, United Kingdom.

Dr Nick chong left London in 2009. Upon returning to Malaysia he took up the position as Palliative Medicine Physician at Hospital Selayang's Palliative Care Unit and at the same time continued to be an integral senior team member of the acute General Internal Medicine team. Dr Nick was awarded Specialist Accredition in General Internal Medicine and Palliative Medicine by the Ministry of Health Malaysia in November 2010 and became a member of the Academy of Medicine in 2011.

Dr Nick Chong currently works in Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur. He treats a wide range of acute medical conditions ranging from dengue fever to complex conditions associated with advanced cancer. Dr Nick Chong special interest is in management of cancer pain and other symptoms associated with cancer such as breathlessness, lethargy, bowel disorder, nausea and vomiting and the lack of appetite. He is also actively involved in providing people with incurable cancer with best supportive and palliative care. Dr Nick Chong is always caring towards patients even towards the advanced stages of disease, needs to be professional and credible.

Membership

1. Royal College of Physicians London, United Kingdom

2. Academy of Medicine Malaysia

3. International Association of Hospice and Palliative Care

4. General Medical Council United Kingdom

5. Malaysian Medical Association
ConditionsTreated: Palliative medicine, Cancer supportive care, Internal medicine.
