Description: Dato’ Dr Nik Ritza Kosai Nik Mahmood graduated from University of St. Andrews, Scotland with Bsc Med Sci and MBChB from Manchester University. He underwent Basic and Higher Specialist Surgical training in the North West of England Deanery rotation leading to FRCS Gen Surgery. In January 2011, he joined Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia (The National University of Malaysia) and is currently the Head of Upper Gastrointestinal, Metabolic and Bariatric Surgical unit at the Faculty of Medicine. Since then, he has established the UGI and Bariatrics unit at Hospital Canselor Tuanku Muhriz, PPUKM making it the country premier and the main referral centre for treatment for Upper Gastrointestinal Cancers and Obesity Disorder. This centre has performed more than 1700 Bariatric and Metabolic surgeries, the most in Malaysia. He is currently very active in research in particular obesity, Upper GI cancers and helicobacter Pylori including international collaborations to which he has published over 100 peer reviewed publications, book chapters, expert opinion catalogues, magazines and newspapers articles has been published. Presently, he holds several notable positions in various organisations. He is the President of the Malaysian Metabolic and Bariatric Surgical Society, Vice president of Malaysian Upper GI Society and President of Malaysia chapter of IFSO (International Federation of Surgery for Obesity). He sits in the committee for the Subspecialty Upper GI training in Malaysia and the national Guidelines for Bariatric surgery and the National Obesity Guidelines. He is also the examiner for the MRCS (Royal College of Surgeons of Edinburgh), Conjoint Masters of Surgery and External Examiner at Universiti Sains Malaysia. As being one of the key opinion leaders in his field, he has been invited as a speaker and faculty at numerous national and international conferences and surgical workshops. He has even made several appearances on Radio and Television shows.
Title: Nik Ritza Kosai Nik Mahmood

MetaTitle: Dr. Nivashinie Mohan | Psychology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
Recommendation:
Dr Nivashinie Mohan is a consultant clinical neuropsychologist who has extensive experience in neuropsychological assessment, mental capacity assessment, cognitive rehabilitation and intervention. She has particular expertise in adolescents and adult brain injury recovery and rehabilitation.

Dr Nivashinie conducts comprehensive assessment for attention and concentration, speed of information processing, learning and memory, as well as more complex skills such as problem solving, reasoning, and planning. She also provides specialized intervention services. She is also a certified Clinical Psychologist and works with a range of psychological disorders.

Neuropsychological evaluation involves administration of a broad battery of cognitive tests to help diagnose and treat a variety of neurological or neuropsychiatric conditions. Testing can contribute helpful information about a person’s cognitive function, such as how a person thinks, remembers information, or carries out daily tasks, all of which can inform diagnosis and help with treatment planning.
ConditionsTreated:
Perform tests that can help diagnose or rule out cognitive impairment related to numerous conditions, including:

  • Brain trauma
  • Cognitive changes following surgery
  • Memory loss
  • Mild cognitive impairment
  • Multiple sclerosis
  • Depression
  • Anxiety
  • Stress
  • Interpersonal problems
  • Marriage counselling
  • Psychiatric or neuropsychiatric disorders
  • Seizure disorder
  • Stroke and other cardiovascular disorders
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Nivashinie Mohan | Psychology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
QualificationAndCertifications: B.Psy (Aus), Hons (Aus), G.Cert (Aus), Masters ClinPsy (Mal), Doctor of Philosophy (Aus)
Title: Nivashinie Mohan

MetaTitle: Dr. Nor Azham Hakim Darail | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Breast Care Centre, 1st Floor, Block B
Recommendation: Dr Hakim graduated with a MBChB from Dundee University Medical School, Scotland in 1997. He returned to Malaysia in 1998 and served in the Ministry of Health in Hospital Raja Permaisuri Bainun, Ipoh; and subsequently in Hospital Kuala Lumpur. He completed his general surgical training with a Master in Surgery (General Surgery) degree from University Kebangsaan Malaysia in 2005. He then pursued further training in Breast & Endocrine Surgery with the Ministry of Health followed by a 1-year Fellowship in Endocrine Surgery in Yonsei University, Seoul, South Korea. Dr Hakim trained in endoscopic and robotic thyroidectomy with Professor Woung Youn Chung who popularized robotic surgery for thyroid diseases. On his return, he continued to serve as a consultant Breast & Endocrine Surgeon in Hospital Kuala Lumpur where he started the endoscopic and robotic thyroid surgery services.
ConditionsTreated: Breast Cancer, Benign Breast Diseases, Thyroid Diseases including Thyroid Cancer, Hyperparathyroidism, Adrenal Tumours

Her special interest is in palliative medicine which specialising in care of the terminally ill patient not only in advance cancer but also in advance stages of medical problem and end of life care. She has been actively invited to give lectures in various scientific and public forums.

MetaTitle: Dr. Oh Choo Eng | Radiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Oh’s basic education was in Penang and her medical education was at University of Malaya, Kuala Lumpur. She continued her postgraduate training in Radiology at University Hospital for four years and received her Master in Medicine (Radiology) from UKM.

Dr. Oh worked as a lecturer at University Hospital, following which she decided to continue her training and work experience in London and Glasgow. She subsequently received her Fellowship from the Royal College of Radiology, London.

Upon her return to Malaysia, Dr. Oh worked at Medicare Specialist Centre, Bukit Mertajam, and subsequently at Lam Wah Ee Hospital, Penang, before joining Gleneagles Penang.

Dr. Oh is married with four children. She enjoys reading, playing tennis and listening to music.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Oh Choo Eng | Radiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang

MetaTitle: Dr. Ong Choo Khoon | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Ong is a former student of Jit Sin High School, Bukit Mertajam. She graduated from Universiti Sains Malaysia in 2002 and subsequently obtained her MRCP (UK) and Master in Internal Medicine (National University of Singapore) in 2007 and then joined the Malaysian Ministry of Health Fellowship Training in Respiratory Medicine in 2008.

During her fellowship training, Dr. Ong underwent attachments at Cleveland Clinic, Ohio, USA in advanced diagnostic and therapeutic bronchoscopy, Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Centre, John Hopkins Medical Centre, Baltimore, USA, Sleep Disorder Unit at Singapore General Hospital and Chang Gung Memorial Hospital, Taipei, Taiwan in pulmonary rehabilitation.

Dr. Ong is actively involved in a number of international clinical trials for non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) as a principal investigator. She also pursues her own research (investigator-initiated research) in her spare time. Her focus is on an important cohort study of 11 Asia-Pacific countries looking at the heterogeneity of COPD since 2009. She publishes and presents locally as well as internationally. She is also an Honorary Lecturer and Examiner at Penang Medical College and Penang International Dental College.
ConditionsTreated: Dr. Ong diagnoses and manages various respiratory-related disorders. Her areas of interest include lung cancer, airway diseases, pulmonary infection, tuberculosis, interstitial lung diseases and interventional pulmonology.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Ong Choo Khoon | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
QualificationAndCertifications:
MD (USM), MRCP (UK), MMed (Int. Med) (Singapore)

Fellowship in Respiratory Medicine (MOH)
ProceduresPerformed: Dr. Ong is proficient in all care and specialised respiratory procedures like flexible bronchoscopy (both diagnostic and therapeutic), pleuroscopy, pleural biopsy and pleurodesis, chest tube insertion, lung function test (spirometry) and sleep study.  In addition, she is also experienced in various aspects of interventional pulmonology such as endobronchial ultrasound (EBUS) for mediastinal sampling, navigational bronchoscopy, rigid bronchoscopy and tunnelled pleural catheter insertion for malignant pleural effusion.
LanguageSpoken: English, Bahasa Melayu, Mandarin﻿, Hokkien, Cantonese, Hakka
Title: Ong Choo Khoon

MetaTitle: Dr. Ong Keh Oon | Radiology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
Recommendation:
Dr Ong commenced his medical undergraduate training at University Malaya before he was subsequently offered a full scholarship by the Australian government for pursuit of the Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery course at the University of Melbourne, graduating in 1996.

His postgraduate training in Surgery/Orthopaedic and Radiology was in the UK. He became a member of the Royal College of Surgeons of Glasgow (2000), member of the Royal College of Surgeons of Edinburgh (2001) and fellow of the Royal College of Radiologists (2005). He has then undertaken 9 months’ subspecialty training in Musculoskeletal Radiology and 9 months’ subspecialty training in Body/Oncology Imaging in the UK. He was awarded the Certificate of Completion of Training and achieved UK specialist accreditation in 2007. This was followed by 1 year's Musculoskeletal Radiology fellowship at the University of Alberta Hospital, Canada. At the end of his fellowship in 2008, he was appointed a consultant at University of Alberta Hospital and was sent for 3 months’ Musculoskeletal (Ultrasound) fellowship in Oxford.

Before returning to Malaysia in 2016, he has practised as a consultant for 6 years in both the public and private sectors in Singapore, including 3 years at Singapore General Hospital as an Interventional Musculoskeletal Radiologist.

He subspecialises in Musculoskeletal, Sports and Body/Oncology Imaging including Intervention and Pain Management.
ConditionsTreated: All aspects of Radiology with subspecialty interest in Musculoskeletal, Sports and Body/Oncology Imaging including Intervention and Pain Management.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Ong Keh Oon | Radiology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
QualificationAndCertifications: MBBS (Melbourne), MRCS (Glasgow), MRCS (Ediburgh), FRCR (London), CCT (UK), CCFT (Canada), Musculoskeletal Fellowship (Oxford)
ProceduresPerformed:
Nerve root and Epidural block. Facet & SI joint injection. Vertebra, disc, bone and soft tissue biopsy. Joint and bursa injection and aspiration including arthrography. Tendon, tendon sheath, morton’s neuroma and plantar fasciitis injection. Barbotage for calcific tendinosis.

US and CT guided biopsy, liver and lung biopsy, abscess, pleural effusion and ascites aspiration/drainage, cholecystostomy. Thyroid FNAC.
Title: Ong Keh Oon

MetaTitle: Datin Dr. Ong Mei Lin | Cardiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr Ong Mei Lin joined Gleneagles Penang as Consultant Cardiologist in 1994. Prior to this, she was Consultant Cardiologist and Associate Professor in the Department of Medicine, University of Malaya Medical Centre, Kuala Lumpur. She is a Fellow of the Royal Colleges of Physicians of London, Edinburgh and Glasgow, the American College of Cardiology, the European Society of Cardiology and the National Heart Association of Malaysia.

Dr Ong has published in international and local scientific journals, presented papers at international symposiums and lectured extensively in Malaysia. She is a member of the Expert Panel (Writing Committee) for the Malaysian Clinical Practice Guidelines for Appropriate Use Criteria for Investigations and Revascularization in CAD (2015), Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease in Women (2nd  Edition, 2016), Heart Disease in Pregnancy (2016), Management of  Dyslipidaemia (5th  Edition, 2017), Primary and Secondary Prevention of Cardiovascular Disease (2017), Stable Coronary Artery Disease (2nd  Edition, 2018) and ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction (4th  Edition, 2019).

She enjoys teaching and regularly contributes to Continuing Professional Development Programmes both as Organizer and Speaker. She is also an Instructor of Advanced Cardiac Life Support for the American Heart Association.
ConditionsTreated: Prevention of and health screening for heart disease. Treatment of cardiovascular diseases including coronary artery disease, high blood pressure, lipid disorders, heart failure, abnormal heart rhythms and adult structural heart diseases.
OpenGraphTitle: Datin Dr. Ong Mei Lin | Cardiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
QualificationAndCertifications: MBBS(Mal), FRCP(Lond), FRCP(Edin), FRCP&S(Glasg), FESC, FACC, FAsCC, AM, FNHAM

MetaTitle: Dr. Ooi Chong Chien | Urology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Ooi graduated from University of Malaya in 1999 and obtained his postgraduate specialist qualification as a general surgeon from the Royal College of Surgeons of Edinburgh in 2003. He subsequently obtained his degree in Master of Surgery from University of Malaya in 2007 and served as a General Surgeon under the Ministry of Health at Hospital Selayang for a year.

In 2008, Dr. Ooi furthered his subspecialty training in urology at Hospital Selayang, Hospital Pulau Pinang and Hospital Kuala Lumpur and completed his subspecialty in urology with the Board of Urology, Malaysia. He obtained his FRCS Urology from the Royal College of Surgeons of Glasgow in 2011 and was elected Fellow of the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Glasgow.

In 2012, Dr. Ooi completed a one-year fellowship in Uro-Oncology in Adelaide, Australia. Upon returning to Malaysia, he worked as a Consultant Urologist at Hospital Selayang, which is a tertiary referral centre for urology in Malaysia.

Dr. Ooi Chong Chien is registered with the Malaysian National Specialist Register as a Consultant Urologist. He is also a Certified Member of the Board of Urology, Malaysia.

MetaTitle: Dr. Ozlan Izma Muhamed Kamil | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Specialist Clinics, 6th Floor, Block B (New Block)
Recommendation:
Dr. Ozlan earned his MD degree from the Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia in 1993. Subsequently, he pursued orthopaedic surgery training at the Hospital Kuala Lumpur and at the Hospital Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, obtaining his Masters of Surgery (Orthopaedics) degree from the Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia in 2000. He earned the N. Subramaniam Gold Medal Award for the best post-graduate student in that university.

Dr Kamil underwent Orthopaedic Trauma, Arthroplasty and Arthroscopy training at the Flinders Medical Centre, Adelaide, Australia, in 2002; Adult Spine Fellowship training at the King Chulalongkorn Memorial Hospital, Bangkok, Thailand, in 2004; and Spine Fellowship training at the Auckland City Hospital, Auckland, New Zealand, in 2005. In 2014, he was awarded the designation of Fellow of Interventional Pain Practice (FIPP) by the World Institute of Pain, USA. Recently in May 2018, he was awarded Certified Interventional Pain Sonologist (CIPS) also by the World Institute of Pain, USA.

Dr. Ozlan served as Consultant Orthopaedic and Spine Surgeon at Hospital Kuala Lumpur, the largest hospital in Malaysia, until 2010 when he left for private practice. He is a clinician who is passionate in treating patients with back pain and chronic pain. His practice focuses mainly on pain management, interventional pain procedures and endoscopic spinal surgery, particularly in degenerative conditions of the spine.

Dr. Ozlan is a member of the Malaysian Orthopaedic Association, the Malaysian Spine Society, the Malaysian Society for Interventional Pain Physicians and the College of Surgeons, Academy of Medicine Malaysia. He is also a member of the World Institute of Pain and the American Society of Regional Anaesthesia and Pain Medicine.

He was a member of the working group which formulated the first Malaysian Low Back Pain Guidelines published in 2009. He is an invited speaker of numerous international and national scientific meetings, and is actively involved in teaching and training seminars in pain management, interventional pain procedures and spine surgery. He had served as an Advisory Board Member to Pharmaceutical Companies and is also actively involved in giving lectures in seminars organized by those companies.
ConditionsTreated:
• Acute Back Pain
  • Chronic Back Pain
  • Cervicogenic Headache or Dizziness
  • Disc Herniations
  • Non-operative treatment of back pain or joint pain
  • Non-operative treatment of nerve compression – spinal or non-spinal
  • Persistent Post-operative Pain Syndrome post-surgery or post-percutaneous Injection Procedures
  • Persistent (Chronic) Pain Syndrome
  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome
  • Cancer Pain
  • Fibromyalgia

MetaTitle: Dr. P. Srinivas | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. P. Srinivas had his basic education in Penang and in Klang. He then pursued his medical studies at Kasturba Medical College, University of Mysore, India. Upon his return to Malaysia in 1978, he served in various government hospitals in Melaka and Kelantan before leaving in 1987 for post-graduate training in Ireland. He worked as a Registrar in General and Geriatric Medicine in Dublin, Galway, Tullamore and Waterford before returning to Malaysia in 1990. He then worked as a Lecturer and later as Associate Professor of Medicine at the Department of Medicine, University of Malaya, Kuala Lumpur. He specialised in Chest and Geriatric Medicine in the Department of Medicine at Universiti Malaya where he was actively involved in clinical work, teaching medical students and research.

Dr. P. Srinivas is married with two children and enjoys reading, listening to music, and playing table tennis.
ConditionsTreated: Dr. P. Srinivas specialises in the care of elderly patients with multiple problems including Alzheimer’s disease. His special interests include the care of patients with respiratory problems especially chest infections, asthma and chronic obstructive airway disease.

MetaTitle: Dr. Paul Selvindoss | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
Recommendation:
Dr.  Paul Selvindoss graduated with honours from Mangalore University on 1993.  

He proceeded to do his surgical training in UKM which he was awarded with Masters in Surgery in 2000.

The following year he did his subspecialty training in colorectal surgery in Malaysia.

In 2005 he was awarded a scholarship to do his colorectal fellowship in USC, USA where he did both research and clinical work.

Following that stint, he went on to become the Head of Surgery for the state of Negeri Sembilan from 2006 till 2010. 

He was instrumental to set up the anorectal lab in Hospital Seremban and also develop laparoscopic colorectal training in Seremban Hospital. He is competent in endoanal ultrasound.

He went on to develop Seremban Hospital as a colorectal training center with the largest volume of laparoscopic colorectal resections in the country at that moment. He also actively promoted single port surgery in his hospital.

He had further training in advanced laparoscopic training both in Queensland’s Australia (2006) and Bordeaux, France (2009).

He is a member of both national and international bodies. He was a founding member of the national colorectal training committee in Malaysia from 2006.

He is also a founding member of the Malaysian Society of Colorectal Surgeon.

He was an invited lecturer and examiner to IMU (International Medical University from 2000 till 2010.

Dr Paul has done presentations both locally and abroad in the field of laparoscopic colorectal surgery, deep vein thrombosis prevention in colorectal surgery and surgical pain management.

He is an invited reviewer of Malaysian Medical Journal

He is actively involved in promoting laparoscopic colorectal surgery in Malaysia including running silent mentor workshop.

 

His research interest is in the field of laparoscopic GI surgery, Single port Surgery, Notes surgery, Robotic Surgery and Anorectal Surgery.
ConditionsTreated: Fistula in ano, Haemorroids, Anal fissure,Anal warts,pilonidal sinus and abscess, colitis,Colonic polyps, Colon cancer, Rectal Cancer, Inguinal Hernia and incisional hernia. All abdominal wall hernia. Thyroid disease, breast disease

MetaTitle: Dr. Poh Ban Chung | Anaesthesiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Poh graduated from Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM) in 2005 and subsequently underwent housemanship training at UKM Medical Centre. After his housemanship, he started working at Kajang Hospital, where he briefly served as a Medical Officer at the Department of Internal Medicine, before ending up as a Medical Officer at the Department of Anaesthesiology & Intensive Care.

Dr. Poh started his formal training in Anaesthesiology & Intensive Care in 2010. In the course of his training, he has worked at Selayang Hospital, Kuala Lumpur General Hospital, National Heart Institute and UKM Medical Centre. He was awarded Doctor of Anaesthesiology and Critical Care by UKM in 2014.

Subsequently, Dr. Poh worked as an Anaesthesiologist at Seberang Jaya Hospital. He is a gazetted specialist and is registered with the National Specialist Register (NSR). Besides his clinical work, he is also involved in the training of house officers, medical officers, as well as paramedics in the field of anaesthesiology & intensive care.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Poh Ban Chung | Anaesthesiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed: Dr. Poh is experienced in providing general anaesthesia and regional anaesthesia to adults as well as children in general surgery, orthopaedic, obstetrics & gynaecology, ENT surgery, neurosurgery, cardiac surgery, oral-maxillofacial surgery, plastic surgery, and other fields of surgery.
LanguageSpoken: English, Bahasa Melayu, Mandarin, Hokkien, Teochew﻿, Cantonese

MetaTitle: Dato' Dr. Pua Kin Choo | Ear, Nose and Throat Surgery (ENT) | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dato’ Dr. Pua graduated from Lady Hardinge Medical College, University of Delhi, India. She was a Medical Officer in Johor Bahru before completing her Masters in Otorhinolaryngology at Universiti Malaya. She worked at Penang General Hospital as Head of Department and Consultant. She was also actively involved in teaching and training postgraduate doctors from UKM, UM and USM.

In between, Dato’ Dr. Pua pursued her subspecialty fellowship in Head and Neck Oncology at University of Pittsburgh Medical Centre, USA under the mentorship of renowned E.N.T. Surgeon, Dr. Eugene Myers. Upon her return, she established the Head & Neck Surgery Unit at Penang General Hospital to treat complicated head and neck conditions and to train doctors within the subspecialty.

Dato’ Dr. Pua is one of the pioneers in the field of sialendoscopy in Malaysia and in Asia. She underwent her training in sialendoscopy under Dr. Francis Marchal at the European Sialendoscopy Training Centre (ESTC), Geneva, Switzerland. She is actively conducting sialendoscopy and has become a trainer for sialendoscopy courses locally and abroad.

She has been a lecturer and subsequently Adjunct Associate Professor at the Penang Medical College, teaching medical students for the past fifteen years.
SpecialtyName: ##Ear, Nose and Throat Surgery (ENT)##;##Head & Neck Surgery##
ConditionsTreated: Dato’ Dr. Pua’s particular expertise focuses on the multi-modality treatment and oncological resections of head and neck cancers

MetaTitle: Dr. Rabin Gonzaga | Psychiatry | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
Recommendation:
Dr Gonzaga did his undergraduate training in Ireland and graduated in 1990. He then did his internship in Ireland for one year before leaving to pursue postgraduate training in the UK. He underwent psychiatric training at the Birmingham University training scheme in psychiatry. On completion and on obtaining his MRCPsych qualification, he was offered a locum consultant job in the North Birmingham Mental health Trust for 2 years before returning to Malaysia in 1999.

When returning to Malaysia, Dr Gonzaga worked at the University Malaya Medical Centre (UMMC) as a Lecturer in Psychiatry and was responsible for looking after a busy outpatient clinic and taught both undergraduate and postgraduate students. He also started the Psychiatric day hospital programme and a sheltered workshop for clients with chronic mental illness.  He worked at the UMMC for 3 years before leaving to join Gleneagles Hospital in 2003.

In addition to his academic and private practice, he was also the president of the Malaysian Mental Health Association (MMHA) for two terms. Dr Gonzaga is also practices Buddhist meditation (Vipassanna or insight meditation) and is happy to introduce secular meditative practices in addition to his clinical work.
ConditionsTreated: Assessment and treatment of all general adult and adolescent (over 12 years of age) psychiatric disorders such as schizophrenia, depression, anxiety, OCD, substance abuse, ADD/ADHD.

MetaTitle: Dr. Rachael Khong Kit-Tsan | Oncology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Oncology Centre, Ground Floor, Block A
Recommendation:
Dr Rachael Khong is a London-trained Clinical Oncologist and has been the Resident Clinical Oncologist at Gleneagles since 2013. 

 

She  qualified in Medicine with Honours from Leeds University, United Kingdom in 1999. She gained full registration with the General Medical Council UK after her housemanship in 2000. She continued her training in General Internal Medicine as Senior House Officer in teaching and district general hospitals in London and Sheffield, United Kingdom between 2000 and 2004.

 

She obtained her postgraduate degree in General Internal Medicine, MRCP from the Royal College of Physicians London in 2004. After which, she gained entry into Specialist Training in Clinical Oncology in London. She worked as a Specialist Registrar at University College London Hospital, Royal Free Hospital London, Mount Vernon Cancer Centre London and North Middlesex University Hospital London.

 

She obtained her fellowship in Clinical Oncology, FRCR from the Royal College of Radiologists London in 2008. She was awarded the Certificate of Completion of Specialist Training (CCT) by the Postgraduate Medical Education and Training Board, United Kingdom in 2009 and gained entry into the Specialist Register in the United Kingdom General Medical Council in 2009.

MetaTitle: Dr. Rajesh Kumar Muniandy | Anaesthesiology | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation:
Dr Rajesh Kumar graduated from National University of Malaysia (UKM) in 2002. He completed his internship in Queen Elizabeth Hospital and Hospital Tawau. Dr Rajesh completed his Masters in Anaesthesia in USM and later obtained his Fellowship in Interventional Pain Management (FIPM). He is a certified Hyperbaric Medicine Specialist, Basic Life Support (BLS) & Advanced Life Support (ALS) Trainer, and High-Fidelity Medical Simulation Trainer.

Dr Rajesh has a special interest in non–surgical intervention for chronic pain and is experienced in the management of back pain, cancer pain, knee and other joint related pain. He assisted in the setup of the current Pain Clinic in Queen Elizabeth Hospital.

He has presented papers at international and national medical conferences and has multiple publications in medical journals. He is a life member of Malaysian Association for the Study of Pain (MASP), member of Malaysian Society of Anaesthesia (MSA) and Malaysian Medical Association (MMA).

MetaTitle: Dr. Rajesh P. Shah | Cardiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Shah is a Penang native, having been born and brought up here. After his secondary education at the Penang Free School, he continued to study medicine at the National University of Singapore. He pursued Cardiology as his primary interest and after completing his training overseas, he returned to Penang as an Interventional Cardiologist. His parents still live in Penang and his father is a general practitioner. Dr. Shah joined Gleneagles Penang in 1999.

In the course of his studies and training, he has received numerous fellowships of major international institutions such as the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh (FRCP, Edin), European Society of Cardiology (FESC) and the American College of Cardiology (FACC) in addition to the Malaysian (FNHAM) and Singaporean (FAMS) accreditations to attest to his competency.

Dr. Shah is now having a partnership with Dr. Lee Li Ching, who is accomplished cardiologist and echocardiologist. They see all the patients and manage them together so that patients get the superior benefits of both cardiologists. The combined clinic is called the ‘Integrated Heart Care Clinic’ and was set up to further enhance patient care and treatment outcomes and success.

Despite his busy private practice and involvement in academic research and development, Dr. Shah finds times to contribute to society by regularly providing free consultations and treatment at charity clinics.

Dr. Shah is a third generation local Gujarati Jain, who is married with two children. He is a vegetarian as well as an avid musician and  a great supporter of the Penang Island Jazz Festival.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Rajesh P. Shah | Cardiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
QualificationAndCertifications: PKT, MBBS(S'pore), M.Med(Int Med)(S'pore), FAMS(Cardiology), FNHAM, FRCP(Edin, UK), FESC(Eu), FACC(USA), AM, FSCAI(USA)

MetaTitle: Dr. Ravi Chandran | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 202, 2nd Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
After graduating from the University of Malaya in 1982, Dr Ravi Chandran furthered his training in Obstetrics & Gynaecology in the UK and obtained his postgraduate qualification from the Royal College of Obstetricians & Gynaecologists in London in 1988. 

He then proceeded to subspeciality training in Maternal Fetal Medicine at the King's College Hospital in London and the John Radcliffe Hospital at the University of Oxford as a Research Fellow under the prestigious Commonwealth Medical Fellowship.

Upon returning to Malaysia in 1991, he set up the Prenatal Diagnostic Unit at the National University of Malaysia and was appointed Associate Professor in 1994. He was active academically and has 65 publications to his credit.

He is one of the pioneer doctors since the inception of Gleneagles in 1996. He is a past President of the Perinatal Society of Malaysia, the Ultrasound Society of Malaysia and the Obstetrical & Gynaecological Society of Malaysia. He was also the President of the Asia Oceania Federation of Obstetrics & Gynaecology from 2017-2019 and currently serves on the Strategic Planning Committee of the International Federation of Obstetrics & Gynaecology (FIGO).

MetaTitle: Datin Dr. Rohamini Sibin | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation: Datin Dr Rohamini Sibin graduated from National University of Malaysia (UKM) in 1996 and obtained her Master’s in Surgery in 2003 also from UKM. She is a Sabahan and the only female surgeon from Papar. She is a certified Advance Trauma Life Support Provider and a certified Medical Impairment Assessor (CMIA). She attended IRCAD Taiwan General Surgery Course and Laparoscopic Colorectal Surgery Attachment in Vietnam. She has 16 years’ experience as a general surgeon in Queen Elizabeth Hospital (QEH) where she is currently the Head of Surgical Department. She is also a President of Sabah Surgical Society based in QEH. She is an invited UMS lecturer, Ministry of Health (MOH) trainer for Master of Surgery students in UKM, UM and also an invited lecturer for post basic Endoscopy (MOH).

MetaTitle: Datuk Dr. Ryan Ponnudurai | Gastroenterology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 306, 3rd Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
• Dr. Ryan Ponndurai received his undergraduate training at the Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland before embarking on a residency program in Internal Medicine at The Cleveland Clinic Foundation in Ohio, USA. After successfully obtaining his US Board certification in Medicine, he spent 3 years at the Scripps Clinic and Research Foundation in La Jolla, California, training in Gastroenterology and receiving his Board Certification in the subspecialty. He then decided to further specialize in advanced endoscopy and entered a one-year fellowship at the Wellesley Hospital in Toronto, Canada. After honing his skills in complex endoscopic procedures, he pursued further training in Endoscopic Ultrasound (EUS) with Professor Soehendra in Hamburg, Germany.
  • Dr. Ponnudurai returned to Malaysia in 2001 and joined the Liver unit at Selayang Hospital. He dedicated his time to train and build a regional referral centre for advanced endoscopy. He pioneered the use of Endoscopic Ultrasound in South East Asia, training local and international endoscopists. Live workshops were conducted including live transmissions to the Harvard group of hospitals in the USA. One of his major contribution is launching the Asia Pacific task force in Endoscopic Ultrasound (EUS TAP) with the aim of to teach EUS in countries in the Asia Pacific region. He has been invited as faculty in over 120 live endoscopy workshops all over the world.
  • Dr. Ponnudurai joined Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur in year 2005. His main interest is in pancreatobiliary disease and with the latest equipment available in Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur Endoscopic Center he hopes to decrease the burden of GI malignancies and giving patients world class care.
ConditionsTreated: Internal medicine, Gastroenterology.
OpenGraphTitle: Datuk Dr. Ryan Ponnudurai | Gastroenterology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
ProceduresPerformed: Upper gastrointestinal (GI) endoscopy , Colonoscopy, Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP), Endoscopic ultrasound (EUS).
Title: Ryan Ponnudurai

MetaTitle: Mr. S P Palaniappan | Ear, Nose and Throat Surgery (ENT) | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Palaniappan pursued his basic medical education, on a scholarship, at the Stanley Medical College, Madras. Upon completion of his studies, he was posted to Sabah. He then underwent training at the Charing Cross Hospital in London and at the Royal National Throat, Nose and Ear Hospital, London, qualifying with a Diploma in Otolaryngology of the Royal College of Surgeons of England and a Fellowship at the Royal College of Surgeons, Edinburgh.

Subsequently, Mr. Palaniappan continued training as Registrar and did a short stint as Senior Registrar during which period he took up additional training in maxillofacial trauma surgery and endoscopic sinus surgery. He then returned home to serve initially at the Kuala Lumpur General Hospital as clinical specialist and then at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Sabah, followed by some years at the Penang General Hospital as an ENT surgeon and Head of Department.

Mr. Palaniappan was a lecturer at the Penang Campus of the Medical Faculty of the University Science Malaysia and a tutor to the medical students at Charing Cross Hospital Medical School, London. While at Kuala Lumpur General Hospital, he was actively involved in teaching and training Master’s Degree students of the UKM. He is currently an Examiner at the Penang Medical College.
ConditionsTreated: Mr. Palaniappan’s surgical interest include nasal allergies and its prevention and control, as well as hearing conservation.
OpenGraphTitle: Mr. S P Palaniappan | Ear, Nose and Throat Surgery (ENT) | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed: Endoscopic sinus surgery, maxillofacial trauma surgery along with other general ENT surgical procedures
Title: S P Palaniappan

MetaTitle: Dato' Dr. Sahabudin Raja Mohamed | Urology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Suite 216, 2nd Floor, Medical Consultation Suites Block
Recommendation:
• Dato’ Dr Sahabudin is a Consultant Urologist at Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur and Prince Court Medical Centre. I served as the Head of Department of urology Hospital Pulau Pinang from 1990 to 1997 and Hospital Kuala Lumpur from September 2000 to 2007. I helped establish the Board of Urology and Chairman of the Board since 2000 to 2007. I was Adjunct Professor UKM since 2000 to 2005 and UITM since 2005.
  • I served as President of the Malaysian Urological Association from 2000 to 2004, and as President of the Urological Association of Asia from 2002-2004.I have been Organizing Chairman for more than 10 International Conferences in Urology, have served on various Committees in the Ministry of Health, and was a Member of the Steering Committee of the World Health Organization for 3 years on International Consultation and new developments in Prostate Cancer and Prostate Disease.
  • My special interests are Prostate Disease, Prostate Cancer and Minimally Invasive Surgery in Urology. I pioneered and served as Director of the Robotic Surgery Program in the Ministry of Health and was instrumental in successfully establishing Robotic Surgery in Malaysia.

MetaTitle: Dr. Saiful B Kassim | Endocrinology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
Recommendation:
Dr Saiful Kassim graduated with honours in multiple specialities in Medicine from National University of Ireland Galway in 1997 and completed his specialist training in Endocrinology & Diabetes at the Regional Centre of Excellence in Belfast, United Kingdom (UK) in 2008. He obtained dual accreditation with certificate of completion of training (CCT) in Endocrinology & Diabetes and General Internal Medicine from the Royal College of Physicians (UK). He obtained his membership of Royal College of Physicians (Edinburgh) in 2002. He became a Consultant in Endocrinology & Diabetes in 2008 and has over 20 years working experience in the UK. Dr Saiful is an accredited specialist in both Malaysia and UK.

He was the head of Department of Diabetes & Endocrinology in Causeway Hospital and Clinical Lead for the Northern Health and Social Care Trust for Diabetes Foot Disease. He was a senior Clinical Lecturer in Queen’s University Belfast, UK. He became the Royal College of Physicians (UK) College Tutor as well as Undergraduate and Postgraduate Lead for the NHS Trust. He was actively involved in the MRCP (UK) examinations as well as undergraduate medical examinations in Queen’s University Belfast, UK.

He was awarded the Fellowship of Royal College of Physicians of both London and Edinburgh Colleges in recognition of his work above. His medical expertise encompasses resistant hypertension, adrenal disease, pituitary disease, thyroid disorders as well as male andropause and testosterone replacement, PCOS, early stages of Diabetes of impaired glucose tolerance. He has a special interest in dynamic testing of pituitary and adrenal function, type 2 Diabetes, insulin resistance and Obesity.
ConditionsTreated:
Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes, MODY & LADA, Gestational Diabetes, secondary Diabetes.

Endocrinology: Pituitary disease including acromegaly and Cushing’s disease; Adrenal disease including special interest in resistant hypertension; Male andropause and female reproductive Endocrinology including PCOS and Obesity.

MetaTitle: Dr. Saiful Razman Mohd Noor | Neurosurgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
Recommendation:
Dr. Saiful Razman has been managing various neurosurgical cases from simple to complex cases (traumatic brain and spinal injuries, oncological cases, superficial to deep seated tumors, vascular cases, developmental abnormality cases and paediatrics to adult cases) since year 2004.

Currently, Dr. Saiful Razman have operated hundreds of complex cases which include skull base, spine, pituitary, ventricular/intraventricular, posterior fossa, petroclival, cerebellopontine angle, parasaggital and falx, sphenoid wings, orbital, cavernous sinus, superficial tumour and vascular cases by means of open standard cranial and spine surgeries, endoscopic surgeries, stereotactic surgeries and minimally invasive surgeries.

He has been conducting minimally surgical technique (supraorbital craniotomy) for excision of intracranial tumours including pituitary adenomas and aneurysms clipping since 2010.
ConditionsTreated: Brain tumours, hydrocephalus, cerebral aneurysms, arteriovenous malformation (AVM), cavernoma, brain abscess, Chiari malformations, pituitary tumours, strokes, spine tumours, spine trauma, brain and spine infections, congenital malformations, paediatrics neurosurgeries, degenerative spine diseases.

MetaTitle: Dr. Sandip Kumar a/l Mahendra Kumar | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
Dr Sandip Kumar graduated from University of Manchester in 2000 with MBChB (Honours). He served as an intern before completing his basic surgical training in North West of England and obtaining his membership of The Royal College of Surgeons of Edinburgh in 2003. Subsequently, he returned to Malaysia after a stint as colorectal clinical research fellow in University of Manchester under the guidance of Professor James Hill and served as surgical registrar in Hospital Seberang Jaya, Penang for three years. He then undertook his training in University of Malaya before graduating with Masters of Surgery in 2010.

He went on to serve as a General Surgeon at Hospital Pakar Sultanah Fatimah, Muar, Johor before his appointment as Senior Lecturer within the Department of Surgery of University Malaya in 2011. He subsequently enrolled in the National Colorectal Fellowship. Dr Sandip Kumar trained in the Colorectal Units of University Malaya and University Kebangsaan Malaysia. He completed his Senior Clinical Fellowship in Colorectal Surgery at the prestigious Cambridge University NHS Trust where he had the opportunity to train under eight colorectal surgeons in the field of laparoscopic (keyhole) colorectal surgery and inflammatory bowel disease. He has also obtained training in Laparoscopic Surgery in General Surgery and Advanced Laparoscopic Colorectal Surgery at IRCAD. He was then awarded the Fellowship in Colorectal Surgery by the Malaysian Colorectal Surgery Training Board. He is a member of the Association of Coloproctology of Great Britain and Ireland (ACPGBI), member of the European Society of Coloproctology (ESCP), member of the Malaysian Society of Colorectal Surgeons (MSCRS) and member of Academy of Medicine of Malaysia.

MetaTitle: Dr. Sathindren Santhirathelagan | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Sathindren had his early education in Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia and obtained his MBBS (first class honours) in 1993. He commenced his house-officership at Penang Hospital and subsequently served in the government service in various hospitals, including Hospital Bahagia, Ulu Kinta, Perak, where he gained psychiatric experience, as well as Ipoh Hospital.

Upon obtaining his MRCP (UK) in 2001, Dr. Sathindren served as Physician at Taiping Hospital. From 2002, he commenced his neurology training at various hospitals – Penang Hospital, Kuala Lumpur Hospital, University Hospital, and culminated his training at the Western General Stroke and Neurology Centre, Edinburgh, UK where he obtained his fellowship. It was from this centre that he gained exposure and experience in managing stroke and other neurological diseases.

Dr. Sathindren returned from the UK and was appointed Head of Department of Neurology, Penang Hospital, in 2005. In March 2006, he commenced private practice as a Resident Consultant Neurologist & Physician at Loh Guan Lye Specialist Centre, Penang.

Dr. Sathindren has also been involved in research and has participated as an investigator in medical trials, both in Malaysia and in the UK.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Sathindren Santhirathelagan | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
QualificationAndCertifications: DJN, MBBS(Mangalore), MRCP (UK), CLINICAL FELLOW STROKE/NEUROLOGY (Edin), CMIA
ProceduresPerformed: As an experienced practising Neurologist, Dr. Sathindren is well versed in various medical and neurological investigations and procedures, including Nerve Conduction Study, Electromyography, Evoked Potentials, Lumbar Puncture, Thrombolytic Therapy and Rehabilitative Care.
LanguageSpoken: English, Bahasa Melayu, Bahasa Indonesia, Tamil, Hokkien
Title: Sathindren Santhirathelagan

MetaTitle: Dato' Dr. See Ewe Beng | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. See was a Sesquicentenary Scholar of Penang Free School and a Federal Scholar in Medicine at University of Malaya. He did his early training in medicine at Penang General Hospital where, with an early interest in Obstetrics and Gynaecology, he passed his Part One examination of the Royal College of Obstetrics & Gynaecology of London within 12 months after his housemanship. Due to a shortage of manpower at Penang General Hospital. He was posted to do Anaesthesiology for one year, during which he passed the Part One examination of the membership of the Royal College of Physicians of London.

Dr. See then applied and received his formative training in Obstetrics & Gynaecology at University of Malaya and thereafter at University College London, where he passed the final examination of the Royal College of Obstetrics & Gynaecology, London.

After one and a half years of working in London, Dr. See returned to Malaysia and re-joined the government service. He worked in Sabah where he was the acting State Obstetrician & Gynaecologist and then in Penang.

Dr. See was the first Consultant Obstetrician & Gynaecologist at Lam Wah Ee Hospital where he did pioneering work in Gynaecological Oncology, Laparoscopic Gynaecology operations, and Infertility.
ConditionsTreated:
• Gynaecological surgery
  • Gynaecological cancer surgery
  • Laparoscopic Gynaecology operations
  • Hysteroscopic surgery in infertility
OpenGraphTitle: Dato' Dr. See Ewe Beng | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed:
• Colposcopy
  • Hysteroscopy
  • Amniocentesis
Title: See Ewe Beng

MetaTitle: Dr. Shahridan Bin Mohd Fathil | Anaesthesiology | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation: <style type="text/css"><!--td {border: 1px solid #ccc;}br {mso-data-placement:same-cell;}--></style>Dr Shahridan bin Mohd. Fathil obtained his MBBS from the University of Malaya in 1996. He underwent initial anaesthesia training in Kuala Lumpur, and then furthered his training in Dublin,Ireland and Birmingham,UK. He obtained his Fellowship of the Royal College of Anaesthetists (FRCA) in 2003. He has also completed a Regional Anaesthesia fellowship in Royal Perth Hospital, Western Australia in 2007/08. He was a clinical specialist and senior lecturer in UKM Medical Centre from 2005 until 2011. Subsequently he was appointed as a consultant and later senior consultant with JurongHealth, Singapore for nearly 6 years until April 2017.
ConditionsTreated:
• Provide general anaesthetic/ regional for operative procedures
• Pain relief for poor operative pain and trauma
• Ventilation in ICU when medicated

Description: Dr. Shalena is a highly qualified physician, specialized in Internal Medicine (General) and Endocrinology. MetaTitle: Dr. Shalimar Abdullah | Hand & Microsurgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Hand & Microsurgery Center, 1st Floor, Block B
Recommendation:
Dr Shalimar graduated from Nottingham University, England, UK in 1998 with double Bachelors of Medicine Surgery and Bachelors of Medical Science (Hons). She subsequently returned to Malaysia for her housemanship and early training. She was fast tracked into the lecturer programme and Masters in Orthopaedic Surgery in UKM, Malaysia followed by a 1.5 year Fellowship in Hand and Microsurgery at the prestigious Kleinert Institute, Louisville, Kentucky, USA in 2010. A year later, she obtained the Diploma in Hand Surgery issued by the FESSH (Federation of European Societies for Surgery of the Hand).

She is also currently an Associate Professor with the Department of Orthopaedics, Faculty of Medicine, UKM. To date, she has up to 50 publications and is actively involved in numerous research activities. She is  also an active committe member in the Malaysian Society of Surgery of the Hand.
ConditionsTreated: Traumatic Hand, Brachial Plexus

Shantini Vanniasingham is a Chartered Clinical Psychologist with nearly 30 years experience in the field having trained and worked with the National Health Service (NHS) in the United Kingdom. She also worked in Singapore prior to starting her private practice here in Kuala Lumpur. Having qualified in Child Development and Clinical Psychology her focus is on
working with Adults, Adolescents, Children and Couples. She is a passionate advocate of refugees and works with them on a voluntary basis. She is a Chartered Member of the British Psychological Society and a Member of the Malaysia Society of Clinical Psychology. She was made an Associate Fellow of the British Psychological Society three years ago.

MetaTitle: Mdm. Sherine Ann Selvarajah | Psychology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mdm. Sherine graduated from University of Leeds in 1996 with a BSc. Psychology. She then pursued her Masters at University of Hertfordshire and graduated with a MSc. Developmental Psychology in 1999. She did her student placement at a tertiary-based clinic in Watford, UK under the supervision of Dr. Patricia Rios.

Upon her return to Malaysia, Mdm. Sherine joined the Department of Psychiatry at HUKM as a research assistant. During this time, she was invited to give an oral presentation and a poster presentation of her past research papers conducted in the UK at the Asia Pacific Regional Conference of the International Federation of Psychiatric Epidemiology in 2001.

In June 2001, Mdm. Sherine joined the HELP Institute’s Centre for Psychology as a Lecturer and Trainer. She was also practising part time at Pantai Medical Centre, Bangsar. In 2003, Mdm. Sherine moved to Penang and worked alongside a paediatrician in a home-based setting, offering psychological services to children with special needs, mainly those with autism.
ConditionsTreated: Mdm. Sherine’s area of interest is in children with learning disabilities and developmental disorders.
OpenGraphTitle: Mdm. Sherine Ann Selvarajah | Psychology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
QualificationAndCertifications: BSc.Psyc.(Leeds,UK), MSc.Devl.Psyc.(Herts, UK), Registered Test User (BPS, UK)
ProceduresPerformed: Mdm. Sherine carries out various assessments on children from the ages of 12 months to 17 years old. She conducts intelligence testing, developmental assessments, screening for autism, screening for learning disabilities (dyslexia) and behavioural assessments. All assessments are written up as a report for the child’s medical file, parents and the doctor who referred. Based on the assessment, the necessary needs are addressed through individualised intervention.
Title: Sherine Ann Selvarajah

MetaTitle: Dr. Shimatul Aida Bt Yusoff | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation: Dr Shima graduated from UKM in 2002. She became a house officer at Queen Elizabeth Hospital from 2002 until 2003, before becoming a medical officer (internal medicine, paediatric, obstetrician and gynaecology) in Duchess of Kent Hospital, Sandakan. After obtaining her Masters in O&G from HUKM, she served as a specialist in Sabah Women and Children Hospital in 2014 before joining Gleneagles Kota Kinabalu Hospital in 2017. She has been giving clinical teachings to third- and fifth-year medical students in UMS, as well as nursing midwifery students.

Dr. Shrina Devi graduated Medical Doctor (MBBS) from Melaka Manipal Medical College in 2005. She obtained her Master in Radiology from University Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM) in 2012. She has special interests in breast imaging including Ultrasound guided breast biopsy and aspiration as well as Stereotactic Biopsy.

Dr. Shrina Devi worked as a consultant radiologist in Hospital Kuala Lumpur from 2017 to 2021. MetaTitle: Dr. Shunmugam Rajah | Paediatric Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation: DR.S.Rajah (Shunmugam Rajah) graduated MBBS from University of Madras, then proceeded to specialise in General Surgery M.S, and higher specialisation Mch Paediatric Surgery during 1977 to 1983. He worked as Assistant Professor of Paediatric Surgery at Madras Medical college and Paediatric Surgeon at the Institute of Paediatrics and Hospital for Children, one of the premier institutions in India. Dr Rajah successfully completed the Advanced Fellowship training in Paediatric Surgery in Brisbane during 1989 to 1990 which was recognised and Certified by The Royal Australasian College of Surgeons. Dr. Rajah joined the Ministry of Health Malaysia as Specialist Paediatric Surgeon and started the first Paediatric Surgery centre for Sabah in 1992. As a single Paediatric Surgeon for the entire state for over 20 years he treated a vast spectrum of major surgical problems in children with results comparable to international standards. Dr. Rajah was invited to present and chair scientific sessions at various National and International Conferences and presented over 70 scientific papers and some are published in major scientific journals. Dr.Rajah has trained many doctors, surgeons and Paediatric Surgeons and was invited by University Malaya as Postgraduate degree Examiner for Paediatric Surgery. Dr. Rajah was elected as Fellow of The Royal College of Surgeons of England FRCS (Paediatric Surgery) and member of Indian Association of Paediatric Surgeons, Asian Association of Paediatric Surgeons, British Association of Paediatric Surgeons and Pacific Association of Paediatric Surgeons. Dr. Rajah received Excellent service award from Rotary International for organizing major surgical projects for the benefit of less fortunate people in the interior parts of Sabah and received awards from the Head of State of Sabah (ADK) and from the King of Malaysia (KMN) for his services to the people of Sabah. He has special interest in Neonatal Surgery, Reconstructive surgery for Ano-rectal malformations, Hirschsprungs disease, Hepato biliary surgery, thoracic surgery and Paediatric Urology.
ConditionsTreated:
Head and Neck: Cystic Hygroma/ resection, Thyroglosal cyst/ Branchial cyst/ Fistula, External angular Dermoid, Tumors of Thyroid, Haemangioma and other Tumors

Chest and Thorax: Tumors of the chest wall/ Mediastinum, Thoracoscopic or Surgical Drainage of plural effussion/ Emphyema/ Lung abscess, Surgical resection of congenital / inflamatory leisions and Tumors of Lungs, Decotication of pleura

Abdomen: Appendicitis/ acute and complicated, Intussusception/ Non-surgical U S Guided enema reduction/ Surgical, Intestinal obstruction/Perforation/Peritonitis, Tumors of the GI tract and Retro-peritoneum

Hepato-billiary Surgery: Operative Cholangiogram/Liver biopsy/ Choly cystectomy, Hepato-porto-enterostomy (Kasai procedure) for Biliary atresia, Resection of Cholydoctal cyst and hepatico-jejunostomy, Resection of Liver tumors

Genito-urinary surgery: Resection of Renal tumors (Wilms’s tumor)/Bladder tumors, Pyeloplasty for Hydro-nephrosis, Bladder clossure/ reconstruction for Extrophy malformations, Single stage or staged repair of Hypospadias, Genital reconstruction for Ambiguos genitalia, Organ preserving surgery for tumors of Testis/ Ovaries in children

Neonatal Surgery

Ano-rectal malformations: Primary reconstruction of Anus without colostomy for 50% of babies at day 2 to 6 weeks of life, Colostomy formation, Posterior Sagital Ano-rectoplasty/ Anterior Sagital ano-rectoplasty, Clossure of Colostomy

Hirschsprungs disease: Rectal suction biopsy, Single stage Recto-sigmoidectomy without colostomy, Leveling Colostomy/ Ileostomy/ Recto-sigmoidectomy/ extended colectomy and repair, Primary repair of Atresias of Intestine/ Mal-rotation/Valvulus/ Peritonitis, Repair of Gastroschisis/ Exomphalos, Repair of Diaphragmatic Hernia/Eventration, Thoracotomy and repair of Esophagial atresia/Tracheo-Esophageal fistula, Tumors of Abdomen/ Chest/ Limbs, Resection of Sacro-coccygeal tumors and other congenital tumors

MetaTitle: Dr. Sim Bee Fung | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang

Dr. Sim obtained her basic degree in medicine from University of Malaya, Kuala Lumpur. After passing her MRCP examination, she pursued her neurology training in different neurology centre in Malaysia as well as in overseas. She has acquired extensive experience in managing neurology cases and performing neurophysiology tests while serving in Penang Hospital, Kuala Lumpur hospital, University Malaya Medical Centre and Royal Melbourne Hospital, Australia.

 In addition, Dr. Sim had enhancement training in acupuncture in Shanghai, China in 1997.

In her spare time, Dr. Sim enjoys aerobic dance, swimming, reading, watching movies and travelling.

MetaTitle: Dr. Sim Pek Eng | Ophthalmology | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation:
Dr. Sim Pek Eng obtained her medical degree (MBBS) from the University of Malaya in 1998. She began to develop an interest in Ophthalmology while she was serving her compulsory service at Queen Elizabeth Hospital. After passing the International Council of Ophthalmology examination in 2002, she continued to pursue her passion in Ophthalmology by joining the Master Program in Ophthalmology at Hospital University Kebangsaan Malaysia. She did her residency in the Eye Department of Hospital Selayang, one of the leading hospitals in providing tertiary and sub-specialty eye care services in the country. Dr. Sim was accredited as a qualified eye surgeon in 2006. She returned to serve the people of Sabah as a comprehensive Ophthalmologist performing a variety of eye surgeries including, cataract, glaucoma, squint and eyelids surgeries. Dr. Sim has a special interest in Refractive Surgery. In 2008, she obtained a Certificate of Lasik Surgery from Mumbai, India. Since then, she has performed numerous advanced refractive surgeries, including, Laser Refractive Surgery, Phakic intra-ocular lens and piggyback lens implantation, refractive lens exchange with implantation of toric, multifocal and toric-multifocal lenses. As a certified VISIAN ICL (Implantable Collamer Lens) Surgeon, she is the first surgeon to conduct VISIAN ICL implants in Sabah since 2011.

Dr. Sim is also a highly skilled cataract surgeon who has performed thousands of successful cataract surgeries; mostly the modern SICS (Small Incision Cataract Surgery). Dr. Sim is not only fluent in the three official languages; Mandarin, Malay and English, but she is able to converse in multiple dialects including Hokkien, Fookchow, Cantonese and Hakka. As such, her patients can communicate with her at ease.
ConditionsTreated:
Eyelids disorder, Corneal Eye Disease, Cataract,

Pterygium, Glaucoma, Uveitis, Retinal disorder: Diabetic Retinopathy, Hypertensive Retinopathy, Age Related Macular Degeneration, Retinal Occlusive Vasculopathy, Central Serous Chorioretinopathy, retinal hole and etc, Eye disorder in Kids - refractive error and amblyopia (lazy eye)
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Sim Pek Eng | Ophthalmology | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
ProceduresPerformed:
Eyelids Surgery (double eyelids surgery, Ptosis surgery to correct droopy eyelid, entropion/ectropion/epiblepharon correction),

Cataract Surgery (phacoemulsification with monofocal, multifocal/toric multifocal intraocular lens implantation), Pterygium Surgery (pterygium excision with conjunctival grafting), Glaucoma Surgery (Trabeculectomy and MIGS- Minimally Invasive Glaucoma Surgery), Laser therapies for Glaucoma and retinal diseases, Refractive Surgery for correction of all forms of refractive error, Laser Refractive Surgery (LASIK and Advanced Surface Ablation), Implantable Contact lens, Refractive lens exchange
Title: Sim Pek Eng

MetaTitle: Dato' Dr. Simon Lo | Cardiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Lo received his medical undergraduate (MB. BCh.) and postgraduate (MRCP & MD) training in the United Kingdom. He started as a Senior Medical Officer in Cardiology in 1986 and became a specialist Cardiology Registrar in 1990 in several teaching hospitals in London, including the Westminister Hospital, St. Mary’s Hospital and the Royal Brompton National Heart Hospital. In 1995, he was appointed Consultant Cardiologist to the London Chest Hospital and the Harley Street Private Clinic in London.

His training in London covered all aspects of adult Cardiology. He holds a Proficiency Certificate in Echocardiography from the British Society of Echocardiography. He pioneered the introduction of Endovascular Reconstruction Therapy for Aortic Aneurysm and Dissection in Penang.

Dr. Lo was awarded the Geoffery Holt Prize in Cardiovascular Research by the British Medical Association in 1991 and conferred Doctor of Medicine (MD) in 1995 in recognition of his research work in diabetic heart disease. He has published over 30 papers in several international cardiology journals and presented his research work in national and international cardiology conferences in America, Britain, Europe and Asia. He has worked at the Mayo Clinic and University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia in the U.S.A. He was invited, as a Visiting Consultant, to teach interventional cardiology in Pakistan, Banglabesh, India and China.
ConditionsTreated: Aortic Aneurysm, Diabetic Heart Disease

MetaTitle: Dr. Somaskandar Sivasuntharam | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Somas was born and brought up in Penang. After completing his secondary education at Cheltenham College in United Kingdom, he was enrolled at Kasturba Medical College, Mangalore, India, where he graduated as a doctor in 1991.

Dr. Somas commenced his training in Obstetrics and Gynaecology in 1995 at Ipoh General Hospital and subsequently obtained his postgraduate qualification from University Malaya in 2002. He returned to Penang General Hospital in 2002 as a Clinical Specialist. Subsequently, he undertook further training in Gynaecologic Endoscopic Surgery at the Indian Institute of Laparoscopic Surgery Research & Training Centre, Coimbatore, India, as well as in In-Vitro Fertilisation (IVF) at Bangalore Assisted Conception Centre and at National University Hospital, Singapore.

In 2007, Dr. Somas joined Penang Medical College as a Senior Lecturer in Obstetrics and Gynaecology and was responsible for teaching 4th year medical students. He had conducted research projects with the college’s twinning colleges – Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland and University College Dublin, as well as National Maternity Hospital, Dublin. He had presented the research at international conferences as well as published in local and international journals. He is currently an Honorary Senior Lecturer and Examiner at Penang Medical College.
ConditionsTreated:
Obstetric & Pregnancy-related Services:

  • Pre-conception counselling / pre-pregnancy counselling

  • Routine antenatal / pregnancy care

MetaTitle: Mr. Soon Lean Ee | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Soon did his medical education at University of Singapore, graduating with MBBS in 1974. He pursued his postgraduate training in General Surgery in Singapore and obtained his Fellowship in General Surgery (FRACS) in 1979. He worked for three years as a Consultant General Surgeon at various hospitals in Singapore and subsequently returned to Malaysia to join the government medical service. In 1990, he joined Gleneagles Penang as a Consultant General Surgeon.

Mr. Soon is married with two children. He enjoys reading, gardening and travelling.

MetaTitle: Dr. Suhaeb Abdulrazzaq Mahmod | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
Dr Suhaeb Abdulrazzaq Mahmod started his journey in medical by gaining a Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBChB) from Baghdad University in 2000. Since after he started his internship and completed in 2003. Then, he commenced his career in orthopaedic surgery by joining as medical officer in Al-karama hospital Baghdad. Then he was selected to be one of the international-candidate masters’ students in department of Orthopaedic Surgery, university of Malaya June 2007. He completed his master program as the second top student and directly after he joined Tissue Engineering Group at Department of Orthopaedic, he helped to publish few researches during this period. He also enrolled in hand and microsurgery clinical fellowship and trauma fellowship for seven months each during the same period.

Following this, Dr Suhaeb joined University of Malaya Medical Centre in October 2012 as a clinical specialist leading the yellow orthopaedic trauma team and starting his subspecialty training in advance orthopaedic trauma managing all orthopaedic-trauma conditions ranging from primary to tertiary referral.

In October 2014, he joined University of Malaya as a medical lecture for three years during which he guided master students orthopaedic-trauma training and was the representative for conjoint board of orthopaedic committee since November 2015. His passion for clinical works continued and his skill emerged to be one of the main orthopaedic-trauma surgeon at University Malaya Medical Centre and Specialist Centre managing more than 2000 patients a year as UMMC considered one of the major tertiary referral centre. With all his busy schedules, he was able to publish few papers during his last three years.

DR Suhaeb have a special interest in complex trauma condition including road traffic accident and fall from height. Also, he had work with hand and micro-constructive surgery team managing all hand trauma and he was in charge of arterio-venous fistula creation for patient with end-stage renal failure helping them to get easier access for haemodialysis. His interest and passion directed him to start a new era of Minimally Invasive Surgery (MIS) especially for elderly patients.
ConditionsTreated: Orthopaedic Conditions

MetaTitle: Dr. Suresh Kumarasamy | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Suresh Kumarasamy obtained his postgraduate qualifications in Obstetrics & Gynaecology from both University of Malaya and Royal College of Obstetricians & Gynaecologists. He obtained further sub-specialty training at the Northern Regional Gynaecological Oncology Centre, United Kingdom under gynaecological cancer surgeon J. M. Monaghan, as well as at the Department of Cancer Medicine at University of Sydney, Australia. He then went on to train in Infertility and Assisted Conception (including IVF) at St. James’s University Hospital, Leeds, one of the most successful IVF units in the U.K.

Following his return from the United Kingdom in 1996, Dr. Suresh established a subspecialty referral service for gynaecological surgery receiving and treating patients both with cancer as well as non-cancerous gynaecological conditions, locally and from abroad. He worked with the National Health Service, United Kingdom and the Ministry of Health, Malaysia for over 18 years before commencing private practice at Gleneagles Penang in 2002.

Dr. Suresh has given over a hundred lectures at national and international meetings on his areas of expertise. He has trained gynaecologists locally and abroad in specialised procedures. He also teaches at Penang Medical College and has been an examiner in obstetrics & gynaecology for the National University of Ireland for several years. Dr. Suresh was Chairman of the Malaysian Medical Association, Penang Branch and has been a member of the editorial board of the Medical Journal of Malaysia. He has been Chairman of the Gynaecological Oncology Sub-committee of the Obstetrical & Gynaecological Society of Malaysia for many years.
ConditionsTreated:
Cervical Cancer

Ovarian Cancer

Uterine Cancer

Vulval Cancer

MetaTitle: Dr. Tan Bee Eng | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Prior to joining private practice in 2017,  Dr Tan Bee Eng served as a senior Consultant Rheumatologist and the Head of Rheumatology Unit in Penang General Hospital (PGH). 

Dr Tan graduated with M.D. (UKM) from National University of Malaysia in 1997 and obtained physician qualification from Royal College of Physician of United Kingdom (MRCP UK) in 2001.  She spent four additional years of rheumatology training in various hospitals in Malaysia and Tan Tock Seng Hospital (Singapore) before credentialed as a Consultant Rheumatologist by Ministry of Health Malaysia in December 2005.    

Dr Tan has published scientific papers in many prestigious peer-review medical journals, as well as posters in local and international meetings.   She was a development committee of the first Malaysian Clinical Practice Guidelines in Rheumatoid Arthritis (2017) and Osteoarthritis (2011).  She is instrumental in developing PGH as one of the biggest tertiary referral centre for rheumatology service in Malaysia.  A certified trainer for Malaysia Rheumatology Fellowship Program, she has nurtured many enthusiastic young doctors into good rheumatologists.

Dr. Tan’s interest in rheumatology sprouted in her early career as a Medical Officer and Junior Physician.  She encountered many young female patients who suffered disability and death due to difficult autoimmune rheumatic diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus and systemic vasculitides. Rheumatology service was almost non-existence in most parts of Malaysia back in those days. The determination to help this group of patients has inspired Dr. Tan to pursue to subspecialty training in rheumatology in 2002.

Married and blessed with a daughter, Dr. Tan finds work-family-life balance by reading, jogging and hiking. As a way of giving back to society, she contributes to local and international charity organisations and NGOs, in the form of monetary or giving free medical talks.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Tan Bee Eng | Internal Medicine | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
LanguageSpoken: English, Bahasa Melayu, Mandarin, Hokkien, Cantonese
Title: Tan Bee Eng

MetaTitle: Dr. Tan Wei Chean | Neurosurgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation:
Dr. Tan Wei Chean graduated from China Medical College, Taiwan in the year 2002 and obtained the Best Intern Award during his internship. After graduation, he completed the required training in Chung-Shan Medical University Hospital, Taiwan and was consecutively certified by the National Board (Taiwan) for Specialists of General Surgery (2006) and Neurosurgery (2008). Dr. Tan pursued further sub-specialty training and continued to qualify as specialist of Neurospine (Taiwan) in 2008, specialist of Surgical Critical Care (Taiwan) in 2010 and specialist in Pain Management (Taiwan) in 2011. After graduating, he worked as an attending physician at Chung-Shan Medical University Hospital, Taiwan until 2013. Then he joined Yumin Hospital (branch of Chang-Hwa Christian Hospital), Taiwan and was appointed as Chief of Neurosurgery Department. Dr. Tan returned to Malaysia under the REP program in 2017.

He has great interest in endoscopic spine surgery (PETD, PEID, UBE), minimal invasive spine surgery (TLIF, MIDLF, OLIF), interventional pain management and endoscopic neurosurgery. He also regularly attends conferences and training courses abroad about the newest advances in the field of vascular neurosurgery, endoscopic neurosurgery and spine surgery, intervention pain management and minimal invasive spine microsurgery.

Dr. Tan also contributes work in medical education. He was a clinical lecturer and PGY clinical teacher in Chung-Shan Medical University Hospital, Taiwan for several years. Dr. Tan has successfully developed several teaching programs for junior residents, interns, and nurse. He is registered as a Neurosurgeon with the National Specialist Register (NSR) of Malaysia. He is a Member of the Congress of Neurological Surgeon (CNS), USA and America Association of Neurological Surgery (AANS), USA. He is a current member of Taiwan Neurological Society (TNS).
ConditionsTreated: His neurosurgery services cater to the following groups of patients: - Cerebrovascular microsurgery (bypass, aneurysm, AVM surgery) l Spine Microsurgery (mini TLIF, MIDLF, OLIF) and Endoscopic Surgery (PELD, UBE) for Slipped Discs. l Spinal disc surgery (instrumentation, spinal fusion, arthroplasty). - Interventional pain management (transforaminal steroid injection, implantable pump, spinal cord stimulation implantation, Vertebroplasty). l Neuroendoscopic surgery (transphenoidal pituitary surgery, endoscopic third ventriculostomy, hemorrhagic stroke). l Neurotrauma surgery and critical care. l Skull base surgery for tumor or aneurysm. l Stereotactic Surgery and Stroke Microsurgery. - Bilateral Endoscopic Sympathectomy (Sweaty Palm, Sweaty Armpit, Sweaty Face, Facial Blushing). - Peripheral nerve surgery.

Returned to Malaysia in 1996 and worked as lecturer (1996 – 2000) and then associate professor (2000 – 2003) at University Malaya before joining  Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur as  consultant.  Subspecialty interest: feto-maternal medicine since 1994.

MetaTitle: Dr. Terry Wong Jun Yet | Paediatrics | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation:
<style type="text/css">

Dr Terry graduated from Manipal University in 2008 and successfully obtained his MRCPCH from UK in 2012 . He went on to work in a busy tertiary hospital in JB ( HSAJB ) where he managed different kind of patients from emergency cases to very sick children including premature babies and ventilated patients in Paediatric ICU . He had the opportunity to acquire knowledge in managing paediatric cardiology cases and able to perform diagnostic procedure such as ECHO while he was doing his paediatric cardiology rotation . Notably , He is a certified neonatal resuscitation program instructor and advanced paediatric life support provider . As he always keeps himself updated , he later on obtained graduate diploma in family practice dermatology from National University of Singapore . So that he can manage his commonly encountered patients with dermatological conditions in his day to day practice better .
ConditionsTreated: General pediatric conditions

MetaTitle: Mr. Timothy Khor | Urology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Timothy Khor is from Penang and is married with two daughters. He graduated from University of Wales, U.K., in 1987 and obtained his Fellowship from the Royal College of Surgeons, Ireland, in 1994. He received his surgical and urological training in both the United Kingdom and Australia.

Upon returning to Malaysia, Mr. Timothy Khor served for three years as Urologist at the Ministry of Health, Malaysia, before commencing private practice at Gleneagles Penang in 2000. He is a full member of the British and Malaysian Urological Associations and is registered with the National Specialist Register.
ConditionsTreated: Mr. Timothy Khor’s work covers all aspects of open and endo-urological surgery for prostate, stone, urological malignancies, male infertility etc.

MetaTitle: Dr. Too Seng Chin | Radiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Too’s basic education was in Terengganu and his basic medical degree was from University of Malaya, Kuala Lumpur in year 1999.

Upon graduation, he moved to Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, to serve as a house officer and a medical officer at Queen Elizabeth General Hospital. He worked at the hospital for 4 years and obtained his early radiological training and exposure in the Radiology Department during the last 2 years of his service. He continued to pursue his 4-year postgraduate degree at University Hospital (PPUM) and obtained his Master in Radiology from University of Malaya in 2007. He also obtained Distinctions in Part 1 and Part 3 of the postgraduate examination.

Dr. Too worked for a year as a Lecturer and Clinical Radiologist at University Hospital (PPUM). He was exposed to Interventional Radiology during his service at PPUM. Subsequently, he moved to Penang and worked at Lam Wah Ee hospital. He later received his Fellowship in Radiology (FRCR) from London, UK in 2010.

 Dr. Too always keeps himself up-to-date with current Radiology knowledge and development by attending local and international conferences and workshops.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Too Seng Chin | Radiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed:
Apart from diagnostic imaging work with CT scan, MRI and Ultrasound (including Doppler examination and Shear Wave Elastography), mammography and Fluoroscopic studies, Dr. Too also performs a vast number of

interventional procedures including percutaneous guided procedures with CT, Ultrasound or Fluoroscopy as well as angiographic / venographic studies.
LanguageSpoken: English, Bahasa Melayu, Mandarin, Hokkien, Cantonese
Title: Too Seng Chin

MetaTitle: Datin Dr. Vasanthie Balakrishnan | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Vasanthie graduated from Ramaiah Medical College, India in 1997. She obtained her Master’s degree in Orthopaedic Surgery from Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia in 2006. She joined and trained for Paediatric Orthopaedic Fellowship in 2009. She currently works as a Senior Lecturer at Penang Medical College since 2011 and she is appointed as the Vice Dean of Student Affairs.

Dr. Vasanthie practises her consultation and surgeries at Hospital Pulau Pinang and at Hospital Tengku Ampuan Rahimah Klang. She then joined Gleneagles Penang in 2013 as a Visiting Consultant Orthopaedic Surgeon with special interests in paediatric orthopaedics.

Dr. Vasanthie is actively involved in community and social service especially for needy patients by liaising with various NGOs. She is also the Visiting Consultant Orthopaedic Surgeon for the Penang Spastic Centre. She has published a few papers and initiates poster presentations as well as publications for postgraduate students.

Dr. Vasanthie is married with a daughter. She enjoys cooking, reading and gardening.
