MetaTitle: Mr. Vimal K. Vasudeavan | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Vimal completed his medical education at Karnatak Medical College, Hubli, India, in 1991, after which he underwent his housemanship at Alor Star Hospital. He worked as a Medical Officer at Alor Star Hospital, Sungai Petani Hospital and Penang Hospital. Upon completion of his postgraduate studies and after obtaining his Masters in General Surgery in 2000, he was posted to Taiping Hospital in 2001. He was appointed Chief of Surgery at Taiping Hospital in 2002. It was then that he developed an interest in the area of laparoscopic (‘keyhole’) surgery. He obtained his Fellowship in Minimal Access Surgery from India in 2006 and also completed his Fellowship in Advanced Laparoscopy at the Institute of Laparoscopic Surgery, Bordeaux, France. He joined Gleneagles Penang in 2009 as a resident Consultant General Surgeon with a special interest in Laparoscopic Surgery.

Mr. Vimal is married with two children and is a passionate Liverpool supporter (YNWA).
ConditionsTreated: Mr. Vimal provides treatment for the entire spectrum of general surgical diseases and performs operative procedures relating to the thyroid gland, salivary glands, breasts, the entire gastrointestinal tract (including the stomach, small and large intestines, rectum, and anus), abdominal wall hernias, skin and subcutaneous skin lesions, etc. He also has a special interest in laparoscopic surgery for all kinds of hernias, gallbladder diseases, benign and malignant colorectal diseases, splenectomy and gastroesophageal reflux diseases.
OpenGraphTitle: Mr. Vimal K. Vasudeavan | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed: Mr. Vimal performs high-end advanced laparoscopic bariatric surgery (weight reduction) such as gastric banding, sleeve gastrectomy and gastric bypass for patients with obesity-related complications such as diabetes mellitus, hypertension and sleep disorders. Part of his routine work is diagnostic and therapeutic endoscopic surgery of the gastrointestinal tract.
LanguageSpoken: English, Bahasa Melayu, Bahasa Indonesia, Tamil
Title: Vimal K. Vasudeavan

MetaTitle: Dr. Vinodh Suppiah | Anaesthesiology | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation:
After graduating with an MBBS degree from Universiti Malaya in 1996, Dr Vinodh Suppiah was posted to Kota Kinabalu, Sabah where he worked for nearly 4 years. In 2000, he moved to work in the United Kingdom for specialist training, initially in North London then as a registrar at Addenbrookes Hospital, Cambridge. He obtained his FRCA in London in 2003 and then decided to pursue Paediatric Anaesthesia and Intensive Care as a subspecialty. To this end, he underwent a years fellowship at Great Ormond Street Hospital for Children in 2005.

In 2007, he was awarded a Certificate of Completion of Training (CCT) at Cambridge and returned to Sabah under the Returning Expert program of the Ministry of Human Resources to help set up children’s anaesthesia services in the new Sabah Women and Children’s Hospital, Kota Kinabalu where he was a Consultant Paediatric Anaesthetist until April 2015.

He has set up the childrens Acute Pain Service and introduced epidural analgesia into paediatric service in Sabah. He chaired the transplant committee and is active with charity work including six Operation Smile missions to Cambodia and many operations in rural Borneo.

He has spoken nationally and at ASIAN level on childresn anaesthesia and helped prepare the new national paediatric pain guidelines on epidural analgesia. He helped set up the paediatric surgical intensive care and regional burns unit in Kota Kinabalu. He has facilitated paediatric difficult airway workshops at the MSA meeting in 2010 and 2011, PAM and OSRA in 2013 and ACA in 2009. He was also scientific committee chair for PAM 2013. He is the current convenor for the SIG Paediatric Anaesthesia, College of Anaesthetists from 2013 to 2015.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Vinodh Suppiah | Anaesthesiology | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
ProceduresPerformed: General anaesthesia, regional anaesthesia/analgesia, intrapleural analgesia, clinical management of an unconscious patient, pain management, management of cardiac and respiratory resuscitation, clinical management of various fluid, electrolyte and metabolic disturbances, immediate post-anaesthetic management.
Title: Vinodh Suppiah

MetaTitle: Dr. Vivian Gong Hee Ming | Ophthalmology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Vivian Gong completed her early primary and secondary education at mission schools. She went on to pursue her primary medical degree at Mangalore University, India and graduated in 1992. She returned to Malaysia in 1993 and completed her housemanship at Penang General Hospital. She went on to serve as medical officer at Taiping Hospital between 1994 to 1996.

Dr. Gong pursued her primary specialty in Ophthalmology in 1996 by enrolling in the Master of Surgery for Ophthalmology at UKM under the open system and was posted to Penang General Hospital for 3.5 years as well as to Hospital UKM for a 6-month attachment. She completed her specialty training in 2000 and was posted as Clinical Specialist to Melaka General Hospital in 2001 and to Telok Intan Hospital between 2002 and 2004.

Subsequently, Dr. Gong went on to pursue fellowship in Glaucoma under the Ministry of Health’s 3-year fellowship programme where she underwent attachments with Dr. Ahmad Saad in Alor Setar and with Professor James E. Morgan at University Hospital of Wales, Cardiff. Upon completion of her fellowship in 2007, she worked as an Ophthalmologist with special interest in Glaucoma at Hospital Raja Permaisuri Bainun, Ipoh.

Aside from her clinical work in Ophthalmology and Glaucoma, Dr. Gong also participated in various teaching and outreach programmes, as well as research activities.
ConditionsTreated: Glaucoma

Title: Vivian Gong Hee Ming

MetaTitle: Dr. Wam Boon Leng | Orthopaedic & Trauma Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Medini Johor
Recommendation: Dr. Wam Boon Leng graduated from University Malaysia with his MBBS on 2002. He continued his post-graduate studie further and successful completed his Master in Surgey (Orthopaedic) in Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia in 2011. He has served in several government hospitals including Ipoh Hospital, Taiping Hospital, Hospital Kuala Lumpur, Hospital UKM, Hospital Teluk Intan prior to joining us in the private hospital. He has special interest in Spine and Sports Surgey (Knee and Shoulder).

ProceduresPerformed:
Core Procedures

  • Close reduction of fractures and dislocations

MetaTitle: Dr. Warren Lo Hwa Loon | Urology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: OPD Specialist Clinic 7th Floor, Block B
Recommendation:
Key Expertise

Dr Warren Lo Hwa Loon is a Consultant Urologist whose main area of practice covers a broad range of urological issues including urinary stones, urinary tract cancers and recurrent urinary tract infections. He sub-specializes in female urological matters such as overactive bladders and urinary incontinence as well as men’s health problems which include erectile dysfunctions and prostate diseases. He performs urological implant surgeries such as sling and artificial urinary sphincters for patients with urinary incontinence problems and penile implants for patients with erectile dysfunction. He also performs various oncological procedures both open and minimally invasive for kidney, bladder and prostate cancers.

Dr. Lo conducts various neuro-reconstructive procedures for patients, both adult and paediatric, with bladder dysfunction commonly seen in those with spinal injuries or in patients with stroke, Parkinson’s and Alzhiermer’s diseases. He has delivered the largest series of Botox injections in patients with overactive bladders in Malaysia and is the only Urologist in Southeast Asia who performs sacral neuromodulation procedures (bladder pacemaker) for bladder dysfunctions and artificial urinary sphincters for female patients with severe urine leaks.

Academic Background & Training

Dr. Lo was trained in Malaysia and overseas. He underwent subspecialty fellowship training in Neuro Reconstructive Urology and Female Urology in the United Kingdom at the Queen Elizabeth University Hospital, Glasgow and had a fellowship attachment in functional urology at the University Hospital California Davis in California, United States.

He is also a highly trained and Europe-certified robotics surgeon, specializing in various complicated robotic surgeries for prostate and kidney cancers. He obtained his fellowship training in Robotic uro-oncology at the Peter Mc Callum Cancer Centre in Melbourne and at Guy’s Hospital & St Thomas Hospital, London. He also trained at Pitie Salpetriere Hospital, Paris in robotic functional urology. Dr. Lo is a recipient of the prestigious Tun Suffiah Foundation scholarship which supported his robotics training at Guy’s Hospital in London.

Intellectual Pursuits

He delivers various oral and poster presentations locally and internationally and has published research papers in domestic and international journals. He has chaired various neuro urology and uro-oncology symposiums across Asia Pacific and is a regular speaker at European and American Urological Conferences. He is currently the principal investigator in a few international multi-centric studies and takes part in health awareness programmes and workshops in Malaysia, Indonesia, Vietnam, Korea and Australia. He is also an examiner for the Malaysian Urological Board Examinations.
ConditionsTreated:
• Urinary incontinence and prostates
  • Stone disease (endourology/uninary)
  • Cancer (prostate/kidney/penile/bladder)
  • Erectile dysfunction/men’s health BPH, infertility, premature ejaculation, cancer
  • Hypospadia, Vesicoureteral reflux, pelviureteric junction obstruction· Urinary incontinence and prostates

MetaTitle: Dr. Wong Hon Seng | Ophthalmology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
FacilityLocation: Eye Specialist Clinic, Ground Floor, Medical Consultation Suites
Recommendation:
Dr. Wong is a consultant ophthalmic surgeon with sub specialist interest in cataract, medical retinal diseases and intraocular inflammatory diseases/uveitis. He graduated with Medical Doctor (MD) from the National University of Malaysia in 2001.He completed ophthalmology specialist training and was conferred Master of Surgery (Ophthalmology) at the National University of Malaysia (UKM), in 2009. He is registered the National Specialist Registry Malaysia for ophthalmology.

He has extensive work experience at leading medical institution, Sydney Eye Hospital, Australia, where he was offered and completed double subspecialty trainings in Medical retina and the extinguish Professorial Fellowship in Uveitis.

Upon returning from Australia, Dr. Wong served as senior Lecturer at the ophthalmology department of Medical faculty of National University of Malaysia. He also led the Medical Retina and Uveitis service at UKM Medical Centre, Kuala Lumpur. There, he established the Electrophysiology service and was actively involved in the Masters in Ophthalmology Specialist Training Program, mentoring and tutoring specialists and doctors. He also teaches students of Medical undergraduate and Optometry graduates of National University of Malaysia.

As an avid medical researcher, he has published numerous scientific articles in international medical journals and has actively involves in lectures and presentations at local and international ophthalmic meetings. He is also the committee member of the Malaysian Society of Ophthalmology of the term 2015-2017.

In addition to managing complex uveitis diseases, Dr. Wong has special interest in diabetic retinopathy, age-related macular degeneration and retinal vascular disease.Dr. Wong also performs cataract and pterygium surgeries.
ConditionsTreated: Cataract, Pterygeum, Diabetic eye disease, Diabetic macular edema, Diabetic retinopathy, Hypertensive retinal diseases, Age-related macular degeneration, Polypoidal choroido vasculopathy, Central Serous Chorioretinopathy, Retinal artery and vein occlusion, Various type of infective and non-infective Uveitis, TB related uveitis, HIV related uveitis, Syphilis related uveitis, Scleritis, Optic Neuritis, Hereditary retinal and macular dystrophy
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Wong Hon Seng | Ophthalmology | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
QualificationAndCertifications: MD(UKM), MS(Ophth)UKM, Fellowship in Medical Retinal Diseases & Uveitis (Sydney)
ProceduresPerformed: Cataract surgery, Pterygeum excision, conjunctival limbal graft harvesting, Retinal laser, Photodynamic therapy, Intravitreal injection,  Orbital floor injection, Anterior chamber & vitreous tap, Incision and curettage, Excision of conjunctival and eye lid lesions, Fundus Fluorescein angiography, Indocyanine green angiography

MetaTitle: Dr. Wong Teck Boon | Urology | Gleneagles Hospital Kota Kinabalu
Recommendation:
DR T. B. Wong was initially trained in general surgery at Queen Elizabeth Hospital(QEH), Kota Kinabalu. He joined the Institute of Urology and Nephrology, Hospital Kuala Lumpur as a Urology clinical specialist in September 2000. Upon completion of training, he has been the Consultant Urologist at QEH since April 2004.

Dr T. B. Wong organised the Sabah Prostate Awareness campaign in 2004,the Sabah Incontinence Campaign in 2010 and numerous healthcare talks for the community. He is also involved in the training of paramedics and medical students. He is currently an Honorary Lecturer at University Malaysia Sabah.

He was instrumental in the recognition of QEH as a urology training centre and had accepted his first Urology trainee in January 2007.Since then, he has had four trainees undergoing first year urology training in rotation.Dr T.B.Wong is hopeful that in 5 years’time,there will be more homegrown urologists who is willing to serve in Sabah to develop the urology service further.

MetaTitle: Dr. Yeap Chee Loong | General Surgery | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
Recommendation:
Dr. Yeap Chee Loong is a Consultant General, Upper Gastrointestinal and Obesity Surgeon. Dr. Yeap stays up-to-date with the latest advances in his field. He is very much involved in surgical education and is a former Senior Clinical Lecturer with the University of Malaya, Kuala Lumpur.

Dr. Yeap obtained his MBBS and Master of Surgery (M.Surg) degree from the University of Malaya, Malaysia. With a profound interest, he underwent advanced surgical training in Senior Clinical Fellowship in Advanced Upper Gastrointestinal Surgery at the world renowned Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh, United Kingdom. He was then conferred the Fellowship of the Royal College of Surgeons of Edinburgh (FRCS), as well as the American College of Surgeons (FACS).

In his clinical practice, Dr. Yeap treats general surgical diseases with special interest in Minimally Invasive Techniques (Keyhole Surgery), Hernia Surgery as well as Upper Gastrointestinal Cancer Surgery. He too specialises and provides laparoscopic procedure for obesity and diabetes/metabolic diseases (Bariatric and Metabolic/Diabetes Surgery)

Dr Yeap’s affable and personal character makes him approachable to individuals of all walks of life and his goal is to provide excellent surgical care for his patients with a focus on minimising post-operative pain and getting patients back to their daily routines as short a time as possible.

MetaTitle: Dr. Yeo Sek Wee | Ear, Nose and Throat Surgery (ENT) | Gleneagles Hospital Kuala Lumpur
SpecialInterest:
• Head and Neck Surgery & Oncology 
  • Snoring & Paediatric ENT Surgery
  • Trans Oral Robotic Surgery (TORS)
  • Sinus Surgery (Balloon Sinusplasty),
  • Tympanomastoid surgery
Recommendation:
Dr. Yeo Sek Wee completed his undergraduate medical training at the The Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland in 1993 and after his Housemanship at Our Lady of Lourdes Hospital in Drogheda, Ireland, he gained full registration with the Irish Medical Council. He worked as a Senior House Officer in Ear, Nose & Throat surgery at the Royal Victoria Eye and Ear Hospital in Dublin before gaining entry to the Irish Higher Surgical Training in Otolaryngology / Head & Neck Reconstructive surgery from 1995 to 2000. Upon completion, he obtained his post-graduate degree in General Surgery and Otolaryngology both from the Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland in 1999. Dr. Yeo left Ireland in 2000 to undergo advanced training to sub-specialize in Head & Neck Surgery and Rhinology at Monash Medical Centre, Australia under the mentorship of Dr. Neil Vallance, Chairman of the Board of The Australian Society of Otolaryngology / Head & Neck Society. Dr. Yeo has extensive experience working in various ENT hospitals in Ireland, Australia and Malaysia. He is also the course director for the 1st Head and Neck conference with live surgery in Malaysia and he has been appointed as the regional expert in the International Federation of Head and Neck Oncological Societies. Dr. Yeo is currently a consultant ENT surgeon and performs Trans Oral Robotic Surgery (TORS) at Gleneagles Kuala Lumpur.

MetaTitle: Dr. (Mdm.) Yeoh Chee Lim | Obstetrics and Gynaecology (O&G) | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Yeoh graduated from University of Aberdeen, Scotland, and completed her housemanship at various hospitals in the United Kingdom. She worked for a year as Senior House Officer in the O&G Unit in Newcastle upon Tyne, U.K., before joining National University Hospital in Singapore where she worked from 1990 until 1996. She obtained her specialist qualifications – MRCOG, M.Med (O&G) and MRACOG in 1993, 1994 and 1996 respectively.

In 1996, Dr. Yeoh returned to Malaysia and was appointed as Lecturer in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynaecology, University of Malaya, Kuala Lumpur. She resigned from the post in 1999 to follow her husband to Kuantan. Whilst there, she worked as a Consultant Obstetrician & Gynaecologist at a private maternity clinic.

MetaTitle: Dr. Yeow Tow Non | Radiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Yeow’s basic education was in Penang and he completed his basic medical studies at University College Dublin medical school, Ireland, in 2000. He then moved to the UK where he obtained his MRCP (UK) in 2004 and subsequently trained as a Specialist Registrar in Radiology for five years. He was awarded FRCR (UK) in 2010.

In 2010, Dr. Yeow moved to Singapore to further pursue his career in Radiology by subspecialising in vascular and interventional radiology. He worked as an Associate Consultant / Consultant at Singapore General Hospital for two years before joining Gleneagles Penang in 2013.

Dr. Yeow is married and during his free time, he enjoys hiking and spending his weekends with his family.
OpenGraphTitle: Dr. Yeow Tow Non | Radiology | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
ProceduresPerformed: Apart from diagnostic imaging with MRI, CT scan, and ultrasonography, Dr. Yeow has a wide range of experience in all radiologically-guided procedures, both vascular and non-vascular interventions. He is well-trained in all aspects of minimally invasive radiological procedures including peripheral arterial and venous endovascular interventions, hepatobiliary interventions, oncologic interventions, gynaecologic interventions, renal and dialysis-related interventions.

MetaTitle: Mr. Yoong Meow Foong | Neurosurgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Mr. Yoong graduated from University of Malaya in 1982. He did his housemanship at University Hospital, Kuala Lumpur, and then worked as a Medical Officer at various hospitals in Malaysia. He passed his Fellowship of the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Glasgow, UK (FRCS Glasg.) in 1989. He was a Registrar in Neurosurgery in the Department of Neurosurgery, Kuala Lumpur General Hospital, and then subsequently in Dublin, EIRE; Glasgow, Scotland, UK. While in Glasgow, he was trained under the internationally renowned Spinal Neurosurgeon – Mr. Robin Johnston of the Glasgow Neurological Institute. He also underwent the full Australian Neurosurgical Training Programme in Adelaide and Sydney, Australia, and did a year’s elective rotation in Newcastle-upon-Tyne, UK, training under the world famous Cerebro-Vascular Surgeon, Mr. Robin Sengupta. He passed the Fellowship of the Royal Australasian College of Surgeons in Neurosurgery (FRACS Neurosurgery) by examination in 1995. He was gazetted as a Specialist in Neurosurgery by the Malaysian Government in 1991.

Mr. Yoong returned to Kuala Lumpur General Hospital as a Consultant in Neurosurgery in 1994. He was then posted to Penang General Hospital where he started the Department of Neurosurgery from scratch. The unit serviced the entire northern region from upper Perak to Perlis.

Mr. Yoong is registered as a Neurosurgeon with the National Specialist Register (NSR) of Malaysia. He is a Member of the Academy of Medicine, Malaysia since 2005. He is a current member of AO Spine, which is an International Spine Surgery Society. He is a past President of the Neurosurgical Association of Malaysia as well as a former member of the Specialist Subcommittee for Neurosurgery of the NSR.
OpenGraphTitle: Mr. Yoong Meow Foong | Neurosurgery | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Title: Yoong Meow Foong

MetaTitle: Dr. Zasmani Shafiee | Psychiatry | Gleneagles Hospital Penang
Recommendation:
Dr. Zasmani graduated from University of Malaya in 1983, obtained her Masters in Psychiatry from the Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia in 1991 and subsequently Postgraduate Diploma in Child and Adolescent Psychiatry from University of London in 1995. She has had over 20 years of working experience as a psychiatrist, both in local hospitals and in London. She was in the National Team for Autism and Asperger’s Syndrome in Maudsley Hospital, London and the Eating Disorders Clinic in Bethlem Royal Hospital, London. She also worked with adults and adolescents with learning disability and autism at Bassetts Centre in U.K. She previously held the post of Associate Professor at the Faculty of Medicine, UKM, and has vast experience both in the academic and clinical settings.

Dr. Zasmani is married and enthusiastic about NGO work related to learning disabilities and autism.
ConditionsTreated: Dr. Zasmani treats both adults and children with a range of psychological disorders, including depression, anxiety, school refusal, phobias, obsessive compulsive disorders, psychosomatic illnesses and psychosis like schizophrenia. She also does diagnostic evaluation on children and adults with autism, Asperger’s Syndrome, hyperactivity or ADHD and dyslexia or reading difficulties. She uses education counselling, individual or family therapy, medication, behaviour modification, and biofeedback training particularly for anxiety management.
